loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: Antonio es un joven trabajador,  tiene  34 años de edad, el se dedica desde  que era muy niño al trabajo en el campo o a la cuadrilla (son personas que a las 5 de la mañana se juntan y esperan que alguien les lleve a trabajar por lo general es en el campo),  también se dedica a la crianza de pollos ya que tiene un galpón pequeño que construyo con su hermano emprender este negocio, Antonio necesita el crédito para comprar pollos para mejorar su negocio, lo que Antoni le gustaría es seguir trabajando duro y que mejore su negocio e incrementar sus ingresos para comprarse un pequeño lote de terreno para construir una casa  y ahí llevarles a vivir a sus padres  para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Antonio, 34, had to go to work when he was just a boy.  He does farm work now or works "a la cuadrilla", i.e., as a day laborer with no promise of work, rising before 5:00 a.m. in the hope that an employer might need temporary workers.  He also raises chickens and has a small chicken coop that he and his brother built.  Antonio is applying for a loan that he will use to buy chickens.  He wants to develop the business and earn enough to buy a small lot where he can build a house for himself and his parents.

loans.use: to buy chickens for his poultry business.

loans.name: Sothea

texts.en: Sothea is 18 years old, an accounting student at a university. She lives in a family with five members in Tbong Khmum province of Cambodia. Due to the fact that she is short of financial support, Sothea would like to request a loan to pay for her tuition fees. This loan will help her achieve her dream of helping to support her family.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees

loans.name: Samorn

texts.en:
Samorn is 53 years old and lives in Khsach Kandal district, along the Mekong river in Cambodia. She married in 1987 and has three sons and one daughter. Two of her children are construction workers, one is a garment factory worker and another is a farmer.
Samorn has been a weaver for more than 22 years, while her husband is a farmer and is hired by the villagers to plow with payment. She wishes to make a roof in front her house better than before.

loans.use: to buy steel and zinc to make a roof in front of her house.

loans.name: Arthur

texts.en: Arthur manages a hog raising and farming business. He has been involved in hog raising for five years and 20 years for his farming business. He is a responsible and hard working husband and father to his three children. Two of his children are working while the other one is in school. He and his wife both work hand in hand in order to generate greater income and get ahead in life. Arthur would like to take out a loan amounting to 50,000 PHP to be use in purchasing hog feeds and essential vitamins to improve the growth of his hogs. He is hoping to obtain the said amount of loan to be able to sustain his hogs with complete nutrition and sell them for a better price.

loans.use: to purchase hog feeds and vitamins for his hogs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add a septic tank.

loans.name: Nhóm 14 Thôn 8 Quảng Hải Group

texts.en:
Sắc operates a food stall selling fish. She is applying for a loan to purchase fish to sell. Sắc has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Sắc is 54 years old and married with 2 children. She is the leader of a 5-member group, the Nhóm 14 Thôn 8 Quảng Hải solidarity group. 

In 2013, Sắc joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Sắc has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Sắc hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Ponirah

texts.en:
This is the story of Dina, daughter of Ponirah :
I come from a poor family. My parents names are Mr. Ponidi and Mrs. Ponirah. I am the first child of four siblings. My father's occupation is a small seller. My mother takes care of the household. My mother and father's income is about  500.00/month. That's a bit of my everyday life and my family at home or within the home.

loans.use: to pay for education fees at the vocational school.

loans.name: Puentecito De Illichua Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PUENTECITO DE ILLICHUA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Paucartambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Victoria ella es soltera y tiene 34 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales,la socia tambien se dedica al negocio de agricultura, la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de golosinas, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our members belong to the "PUENTECITO DE ILLICHUA" community bank in Cusco.

Sra. Victoria, 34, is a member of the community bank.  She is single and has 2 children.  She operates an animals sales business, raising and selling guinea pigs and chickens.  She fattens the animals and sells them at local markets.  She also has a small farm. The businesses are her only means of supporting her family.  For the future, Sra. Victoria would like to have a shop where she can sell her animals.  For now, she is applying for a loan that she will use to buy animals and feed so that she can carry on her business.

The other members of the community bank have a range of businesses: poultry sales, clothing sales, grocery sales, restaurants, etc.

Sra. Victoria is grateful for your support and committed to repaying your loans in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy animals and feed for her animals sales business.

loans.name: Las Favoritas Group

texts.es:
Kenia es una joven mujer de 18 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos y su negocio es la venta de refrescos.
Ella es independiente, responsable, dulce, alegre, optimista, feliz, de buena actitud, y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona ‘Plan 3000’ un sitio caracterizado por el gigantesco crecimiento de su población; migrantes de occidente del país y etnias como ‘Los Ayoreos’ nativas del lugar, se establecieron.
Kenia es de tez trigueña, cabello largo castaño, estatura mediana, su lengua nativa es el español y conoce el guaraní por herencia familiar (en la fila de atrás, blusa verde claro). Debido a sus ganas por Emprender un negoció más prospero, formó una banca de personas con negocios diferentes y necesidades similares para solicitar un préstamo. Su negocio es la venta de refrescos y gaseosas en un puesto de venta en la calle. Todos los días por las mañanas, ella se prepara para su labor diaria, se dirige al depósito y carga sus productos en un carro de dos ruedas, se asegura de tener bastante hielo y camina siete cuadras hasta llegar a su puesto de venta. Ya en el lugar; abre su sombrilla y ordena todas las botellas dejándolas visibles para los clientes. Ya son dos años de experiencia que tiene realizando esta rutina y este es el primer préstamo que solicita a la institución. Su sueño es tener un local propio y amplio. Por todo lo anterior ella piensa que puede mejorar su calidad de vida realizando una inversión en su negocio. Ella desea expandir su negocio realizando la compra de dos juegos de mesas y sillas plásticas.
Es por esos motivos que Kenia solicita un préstamo para la compra de dos juegos de mesas y sillas para expandir su negocio.
texts.en:
Kenia is an 18-year-old young woman. She is single with no kids, and her business consists in selling soft-drinks.

She is an independent, responsible, sweet, cheerful, optimistic, happy, hardworking person with a great attitude. She performs her job in the area “Plan 3000”, a place characterized by its huge population growth. Migrants from the west and local ethnic groups like “Los Ayoreos” established there. 

Kenia is of dark skin, long brown hair and medium height. Her native language is Spanish and knows guaraní due to her family heritage (she is in the back row with a light green shirt). 

Thanks to her desire of starting a more prosperous business, she started a cooperative of people with different businesses and similar needs with the objective of requesting a loan. Her business is the sale of soft-drinks and soda pops in a stand on the street. 

Every morning she prepares for her daily work, goes to the warehouse and puts the products on her wheelbarrow. She makes sure she has enough ice and walks seven blocks until she gets to her point of sale. Once in that place, she opens her umbrella and arranges all the bottles so they can be seen by her customers. 

She has done this routine for two years and this is the first loan she is requesting to the institution. Her dream is to have her own store with enough space. 

Due to all the above, she thinks she can improve her quality of life by making an investment in her business. She wishes to expand it, and with the help of this loan she will do so by purchasing two sets of tables and plastic chairs.

loans.use: to buy two sets of tables and chairs to expand her business.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
La socia Florentina se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Florentina is still hard at work making and selling soups and other cooked foods.  She works from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.  She has operated the business for 8 years and says that it's a success.  She hopes to open a restaurant one day but for now she is applying for a loan that she will use to buy the suppllies she needs--rice, vegetables, chicken, etc.--to carry on her existing business.

Florentina says that she is grateful for your help and committed to repaying your loans in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her prepared foods business.

loans.name: Verna

texts.en:
Vena, a 45-year-old resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines, is married and has three children who are in college, high school, and elementary school respectively. Vena manages her household while operating a business. She works hard to support and meet their daily personal, household and educational needs. 

Vena operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. Vena earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of Php 2500 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store which sells mostly household items, Vena is requesting a Php 50,000 loan to buy items such as plates, chairs, stools, foam and cooking pans. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. Vena thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Verna hopes to maintain and grow her business so her family can have a better life. She strives to give her children the best education possible and prays for a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for general home products.

loans.name: Pujiyati

texts.en:
This is the story of Lintang, daughter of Pujiyati:

I’m am the second child of three brothers. My father is a laborer. My father works the paddy rice fields. My father has been given materials to work on the rice fields, while my mother helps my father. My parents income is about 500,000 /month. It was enough to meet our daily needs. Revenue was in addition to meeting the needs of the family (daily food) and to also finance equipment for the school. My brothers are still in school. My parents hope that their children will be successful.

loans.use: to pay for education fees at the vocational school.

loans.name: Manuel Mesias

texts.es: Manuel es un joven de 33 años de edad, vive con sus padres en una casa donde pagan arriendo y ahí mismo junto con su hermano construyo  un galpón para criar pollos, es un año que Manuel se dedica a la crianza de animales y por lo general trabaja al jornal en la agricultura, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y de este negocio espera mejorar sus ingresos para invertir en un galpón más grande y así seguir surgiendo y  mejorar su calidad de vida  y de  ser posible apoyar mucho mas a sus padres.
texts.en:
Manuel is a 33-year-old man. He lives with his parents in a rented house, and in that same place he built with his brother a shed to raise chickens. Manual has worked raising animals for the last year, and he usually gets his daily wage working as a farmer. 

The loan will be used to buy chickens. From this business he hopes to improve his incomes to invest in a bigger shed, and thus keep improving his quality of life and if possible, support his parents.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Saeful

texts.en:
Meet Saeful. Saeful is a student who lives with his family in East Serang, a suburban area located about a 3 hours drive from Jakarta. 

In order to pay for his school and to support his family's living, Saeful runs a small stall in his house which sells mobile phone airtime to customers. Saeful joined Ruma about a month ago because he wanted to increase his family’s income. He feels really excited to expand his new business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. As the business grows, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide access to mobile services for his community by processing airtime transactions on the weekends. Saeful is glad that he has gained more experience as he works with Ruma field staff. 

He really hopes that he can finish his school on time and be able to support his family's needs. 

Saeful thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services for his community.

loans.name: Irum

texts.en:
Irum is a 33-year old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband owns a small crockery store, in which he sells plastic utensils and crockery items such as plates, platters, dishes, cups, jars, glass, jugs, mugs, cauldron and buckets. He wants to buy more inventory because most of his female customers purchase utensils in large quantity for making a dowry. For this is reason, more inventory is required to cope with the sudden increase in demand. Therefore, Irum has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so her husband can buy utensils and crockery items and can generate additional income for cherishing his family in a better way.

She is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy plastic utensils and crockery items for her husband's crockery store.

loans.name: Agung

texts.en:
Agung is married. He lives with his wife and their two children in North Bogor, a suburban area that is located about two hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city. 

To support his family's living, Agung sells mobile phone airtime and offers a bill payment service for his customers. 

Agung was introduced to Ruma by one of his friends. He quickly became interested to join Ruma about five months ago because he wanted to increase his income. He is excited about his new business which is selling mobile phone airtime to his community. As the business grows, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide access to mobile services for his community by processing airtime transactions on the weekends. 

Agung thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in his community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in creams, shampoo, lotions, deodorant, makeup, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: cassava, maize, bananas, meat, tomatoes, cucumbers, etc.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es: Ángel de 30 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y su hijo de 2 años de edad. Él es un hombre que se esfuerza cada día para llevar el sustento a su hogar algo que ha logrado gracias a que presta sus servicios de seguridad en una empresa cercana. Ángel tiene el firme deseo de reparar el techo de su vivienda, ya que este se encuentra deteriorado, por lo que él desea invertir en materiales para repararlo pero al no contar con la liquidez económica necesaria solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: polines, lamina galvanizada y pines para cambiar el techo de su vivienda lo antes posible y de este modo evitar que este se desplome sobre su familia.
texts.en:
Angel is 30 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and their 2-year-old son. He is a man who works everyday to bring sustenance to his household. This is something he has succeeded in because he offers security services to a nearby business. 

Angel wants to repair the roof of his house, since it has deteriorated. For this, he wants to invest in materials to repair the roof, but he doesn’t have the financial liquidity necessary. As a result, he requests a loan from FUSAI to invest in poles, galvanized sheets, and pins to change the roof of his house as soon as possible and, in this way, to ensure the old roof doesn’t collapse on his family.

loans.use: to invest in poles, galvanized sheets, and pins to change the roof of his house.

loans.name: Bladimir Antonio

texts.es: Bladimir de 47 años de edad es un hombre que se esfuerza por darlo mejor de sí para sacar adelante a sus 2 hijas de 15 y 12 años de edad que viven junto a él y su esposa en vivienda propia desde hace 26 años. Él es un hombre que se gana la vida apoyado en su negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad en los cantones cercanos y es gracias a ello que sostienen la economía de su hogar. Bladimir desea mejorar más las ventas de su negocio invirtiendo en diferentes artículos pero no cuenta con la liquidez necesaria para invertir en ello, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: golosinas, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, café, pan dulce, leche en polvo, etc.
texts.en:
Bladimir, 47 years old, is a man who puts forth the effort to improve himself in order to advance his two daughters, ages 15 and 12, who live with him and his wife. The couple has lived in their own house for some 26 years. He earns his living by means of his store, selling products of primary necessity [to residents of] nearby cantons, and thanks to this, he is able to sustain the household economy. 

Bladimir wishes to improve sales at his business by investing in different articles, but he lacks the necessary liquidity to do so. For that reason, he is requesting a loan through FUSAI to invest in: candy, rice, beans, sugar, coffee, pastry, powdered milk, etc.

loans.use: to invest in candy, rice, beans, sugar, coffee, pastry, powdered milk, etc., for his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to build a wall in his home

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 32-year-old lady. She lives with her husband and four sons in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a turner by profession. He manufactures and refurbishes vehicle spare parts. He has been operating a lathe machine for many years and can easily refurbish or manufacture the spare parts of various vehicles. His lathe machine has become out of order due to continuously working, and it needs to be replaced. He has spent all his savings to buy raw materials for manufacturing spare parts, and he does not have cash on hand to buy another lathe machine.

Therefore, Nazia has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy a used lathe machine and replace some of the savings that they have spent. She is relaxed now because she hopes that her husband can easily operate his lathe machine again. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a used lathe machine

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea de 56 años de edad, se dedica a los oficios domésticos, pero también trabaja en la agricultura con la siembra de maíz para garantizar la seguridad alimentaria de su familia, los ingresos de ella dependen directamente de una pensión que recibe mensualmente del Estado; ya que durante el conflicto armado que afecto a El Salvador durante los 1980 y 1992 ella su frio una lesión de arma de fuego, otra fuentes de ingreso que ella posee es la ayuda económica de su hija que trabaja en una empresa privada de elaboración de atún.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar madera, clavos, tejas y láminas, para terminar de construir el techo de su casa. El primer crédito lo utilizó para las paredes y la parte inicial del techo, ya con este estaria finalizando todo el techo de su vivienda.

El sueño de Andrea es ver finalizado su vivienda la cual ha ido construyendo poco a poco y seguir contando con el apoyo de su hija para ver cumplido este sueño tan anhelado.
texts.en:
Andrea is 56 years old and is dedicated to household tasks, but she also works in agriculture by growing corn to guarantee there is enough food for her family. Her income depends directly on a pension that she receives monthly from the state. This is because during the armed conflict that affected El Salvador during 1980 and 1992, she suffered an injury from a firearm. Other sources of income that she has include financial assistance from her daughter, who works in a private business that makes tuna. 

The loan she is requesting is to buy wood, nails, tiles, and sheets to finish building the roof of her house. Her first loan was used for the walls and the first part of the roof, and with this new loan, she will be able to finish the entire roof of her house.

Andrea’s dream is to see her house completed; it has been built little by little. She also will continue counting on the support of her daughter to see this long-time dream come true.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, tiles, and sheets to finish building the roof of her house.

loans.name: Cristobal Olmedo

texts.es: Cristóbal de 45 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y sus 4 hijos de de 19, 17, 15 y 9 años de edad. Él es un hombre honesto y responsable que presta sus servicios de seguridad en una empresa cercana, pero además junto a su esposa poseen un pequeño local de venta de antojitos típicos en el que ella elabora platillos como: empanadas, chilate, yuca frita, pasteles de carne, enchiladas, nuégados, etc. En diferentes horas del día por lo que él desea brindarle su apoyo realizando una inversión en dicho negocio. Cristóbal no cuenta con la liquidez necesaria para invertir en su negocio pero si con el deseo de apoyar a su esposa por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: maíz, yuca, atado de dulce, carne, etc. Para preparar los platillos típicos y apoyar a su esposa para que el negocio mejore.
texts.en:
Cristobal is 45 years old. He lives in his own home with his wife and four children of 19, 17, 15 and nine years of age. 

He is an honest and responsible man who works providing security services for a nearby company. In addition, he and his wife own a small shop selling traditional food that she elaborates during the day, such as empanadas [turnovers], chilate [corn drink], fried yucca, meat pastries, enchiladas, nuégados [fried dumplings], etc. 

Cristobal would like to support her by investing in the business. He does not have sufficient liquidity to do so, but he does have the desire to help his wife. He is therefore requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in corn, yucca, sugar cane candy, meat, etc., to be used in preparing these traditional dishes. This will allow him to support his wife in improving the business.

loans.use: to invest in corn, yucca, sugar cane candy, meat, etc.

loans.name: Exitosas Group

texts.es:
Flora es una mujer de 30 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos y su negocio es la venta de postres.
Ella es independiente, sincera, Inteligente, generosa, comprensiva, paciente, responsable y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en el barrio ‘plan 3000’ un lugar caracterizado por el crecimiento constante de su población y del comercio en todas las áreas, sitio que agrupa a diferentes culturas y etnias del occidente y del lugar.
Flora es de tez trigueña, cabello largo castaño, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el español y conoce el guaraní por herencia familiar (al centro, camiseta azul, pantalón jean, agarra una cartera color beige). La necesidad de expandir su negocio la impulsó a formar una banca de personas para solicitar un préstamo. Su negocio es la venta de postres, negocio que comenzó desde su casa, haciendo una mínima inversión, Inició con la venta de alfajores, queques de vainilla y tortas de chocolates que llevan insumos cómodos en el mercado, A medida que recuperaba su capital, ampliaba la oferta de postres para el público. Ya lleva dos años de experiencia y este es el primer préstamo que solicita a la institución. Su sueño es tener un kiosco propio y amplio donde pueda generar mejores ingresos económicos. Ella desea ampliar su negocio realizando la compra de una heladera para almacenar sus productos.
Es por esos motivos que Flora solicita un préstamo para la compra de una heladera y expandir su negocio.
texts.en:
Flora is a 30-year-old woman who is single with no children, and her business is selling desserts. She is independent, sincere, intelligent, generous, compassionate, patient, responsible, and hardworking.

She carries out her work in the “Plan 3000” suburb, which is characterized by its constantly growing population and commerce that is carried out in every area. It is a place that brings together different cultures and ethnicities, both western and local.

Flora has olive skin and long, Brown hair, and she is of medium height. Her maternal language is Spanish and she knows Guaraní through her family heritage. She is in the center of the photograph, wearing a blue t-shirt and jeans, holding a beige purse. 

The need to expand her business led her to form a communal bank in order to request a loan. Her business is selling desserts, which she started at home, making a minimum investment.  She began by selling alfajores (shortbread cookie sandwiches with Dulce de leche filling), vanilla cakes, and chocolate tarts, whose ingredients are easily found in the market.

As she recuperated her capital, she expanded her dessert offerings. Now she has two years’ experience, and this is the first loan that she is requesting from the institution. 

Her dream is to have a large kiosk of her own, where she could generate better earnings, and she wants to expand her business, purchasing a refrigerator for storing her products.

That is why Flora is requesting a loan to purchase a refrigerator and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator and expand her business.

loans.name: Walter Edgardo

texts.es: Walter de 39 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus 3 hijos de 16, 6 y 3 años de edad. Él es un hombre que se esmera para dar lo mejor a su familia cada día apoyado en su trabajo de mantenimiento el que desempeña desde hace mucho tiempo en una empresa cercana. Walter siempre está buscando mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, por lo que ha decidido cambiar el techo de su vivienda ya que este se encuentra deteriorado, pero no cuenta con la liquidez que esta mejora implica, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en lámina galvanizada y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Walter is 39 years old and lives in his own house with his partner and their 3 children, who are 16, 6, and 3 years old. He is a man that goes to a lot of effort to give the best to his family everyday, and he supports them through maintenance work, which he has done for a long time in a nearby business. 

Walter is always looking to improve his family’s quality of life, so he has decided to change the roof of his house, since it is deteriorating. However, he does not have the financial liquidity required. As a result, he requests a loan from FUSAI to invest in galvanized sheets and nails to change the roof of his house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized sheets and nails to change the roof of his house.

loans.name: Segundo Damian

texts.es:
Segundo Damian tiene 41 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico, con su cónyuge, cuenta con 3 hijos de 15, 12 y 2 años de edad, de los cuales los dos primero cursan secundaria en colegio nacional del distrito de Pomahuaca. Segundo Damian vive en la parte rural de este distrito contando con servicios de agua y luz. Dicho distrito está ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Segundo Damian es el comercio de chivos y patos, la compra lo realiza en caseríos aledaños y la venta lo realiza en el distrito de Pomahuaca, además se dedica al cultivo de cacao y arroz ingresos adicionales que le permiten solventar el crédito sin ningún problema. El destino del crédito será para invertir en su negocio en compra de ganado caprino y aves menores(patos, pavos, pollos) con ello le generará mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona y con ello obtiene mejores precios.
texts.en:
Segundo Damian is 41 years old and lives in his own house made from rustic materials with his wife. He has three children, who are 15, 12, and 2 years old; his two older children attend secondary school in the district of Pomahuaca. Segundo Damian lives in the rural part of this district, and he has water and electricity services. This district is located in the province of Jaén in the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Perú.

Segundo Damian sells young goats and ducks. He buys the animals in surrounding villages, and he sells them in the district of Pomahuaca. He also grows cacao and rice; this additional income allows him to repay the loan without any problems. 

The loan will be invested in his business by buying young goats and birds (e.g., ducks, turkeys, and chickens). With this, he will earn a better income and, thus, will be able to improve his quality of life. For this work, there isn’t anyone in the area with more competence than Segundo Damian, and as a result, he gets better prices.

loans.use: to invest in this business by buying young goats and birds (e.g., ducks, turkeys, and chickens).

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Her name is Mary Ann, 30, resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Gimson and has two children who are still in the preparatory level at school. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal and household needs.

Mary Ann operates a general store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dried and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all the products are essential household items and food. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a  5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and then selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of 500 PHP a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy grocery items such as fresh meat, sacks of rice, beverages, mineral water and other grocery stuff. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. Her store earnings help meet the family's daily expense and to send her children to school. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her.

Mary Ann hopes to maintain and grow her business and open another general store. She wants to give her children the best education and prays for a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Alvaro Arturo

texts.es: Álvaro de años de edad es un hombre que se esfuerza para sacar adelante a su familia por medio de su trabajo como auxiliar de ingeniero agrónomo en un ingenio azucarero cercano. Él es un hombre muy responsable que vive con su madre y una sobrina y es por ellas que siempre busca tener las mejores condiciones habitacionales. Álvaro desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda, ya que este se encuentra deteriorado, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Alvaro is a man that works to go forward for his family through his work as an assistant agricultural engineer in a nearby sugar factory. He is a very responsible man who lives with his mother and a niece. It is for them that he always seeks the best living conditions. 

Alvaro wants to change the roof of his house, since it is deteriorating. For this, he requests a loan from FUSAI to invest in galvanized sheets, wood, and nails to change the roof of his house.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized sheets, wood, and nails to change the roof of his house.

loans.name: Oscar Alejandro

texts.es: Oscar tiene 20 años de edad y  trabaja en oficios varios en una empresa cercana a su localidad. Oscar es un joven  que trabaja muy duro para salir adelante. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena y pintura para invertir mejorar las paredes de los cuartos de su vivienda. Desea repellar y pintar las paredes.
texts.en: Oscar is 20 years old and works various roles for a local business in his area.  He is a young boy who works very hard to move ahead.  With the hopes of improving his living conditions, he is requesting this loan from FUSAI in order to invest in the purchase of cement, sand, and paint and replenish the walls of the rooms of his house.  He wants to plater and pain the walls.

loans.use: To purchase cement, sand and paint for plastering and painting the walls of the rooms of the house.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela tiene 31 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 1 hijo, vive con sus padres en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Manuela se dedica a brindar los servicios de limpieza y lavandería, contando con indumentarias propias, con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que esta ubicado en su domicilio, ella solicita préstamo para compra de nuevos equipamentos de lavandaría ella desea comprarse una lavadora para agilizar su servicio, dicha inversión le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus equipos y herramientas, con gran influencia en el negocio; Manuela piensa mejorar productividad de sus servicios y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los clientes de la zona.
texts.en: Manuela is 31 years old, and a single mom of one boy.  She lives with her parents in a rural area of the district of Oyotún, a province of Chiclayo in the region of Lambayeque in the northern coast of Peru. Her community is dedicated to agriculture, livestock and trade.  Manuela is dedicated to providing cleaning services and laundry, using her own equipment, with more than 10 years of experience in the business.  Her business is located in her house.  She is asking for a loan to purchase new laundry equipment.  Manuela would like to buy a washing machine to streamline her service and this investment will allow her to have improved conditions of her equipment and her tools, with a big influence in her business.  Manuela plans to improve the productivity of her services in order to meet the diverse needs of the customers in her area.

loans.use: to purchase a washing machine.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 49 years old and married with two children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for five years. Marie needs a loan to buy two large chest freezers, drinks, snacks, canned items, frozen goods, a new cash register machine and deodorants. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She became a member of SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy two large chest freezers, drinks, snacks, canned items, frozen goods, a new cash register machine and deodorants.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a 67-year-old married woman from Ormoc, Leyte in the Philippines. 

She earns a living through her food vending business, selling home cooked food to the people in her locality. Lilia has been making an income from this business for more than 35 years now.

Lilia is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients like meat, vegetables, rice, cooking oil, and condiments. With this, she will be able to improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like meat, vegetables, rice, cooking oil, and condiments

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a responsible mother who has been gifted with 3 children. She helps her husband in earning income by cooking and selling meals and snacks within their local community. 

Due to the high cost of school fees, she needs to increase her income in order to support the education of her children. Mary Jane aims to do this by further improving her business. 

However, having inadequate capital, she would like to request a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy the fresh meat, fish, dressed chicken, vegetables, and seasonings she needs to prepare and sell her meals and snacks. 

Being a kind and diligent mother, she hopes to further improve her business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy fresh meat, fish, dressed chicken, vegetables. and seasonings.

location.town: Brgy. Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Lidia Mirian

texts.es:
Lidia Mirian tiene 54 años de edad, es soltera, sin hijos, vive con su familiares en una zona rural del distrito de Nanchoc, provincia de San Miguel, región Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Lidia Mirian se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, como gallos, gallinas, pollos, etc; con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que está ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Ella solicita préstamo para compra de más animales, pues desea aumentar y diversificar su stock de animales, para poder complacer todos los gustos y preferencias de su público consumidor, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, con gran influencia en el negocio. Lo que en un corto plazo le permitirá aumentar sus ingresos, mejorar sus ganancias y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Lidia Marian is 54 years old, is single, and doesn't have any children. She lives with her relatives in a rural area of the Nanchoc district, San Miguel province, Cajamarca region, in the northern Peruvian sierra. Her community is mainly dedicated to agriculture, livestock production and trade. 

Lidia Marian makes a living raising and selling animals such as cocks, hens, and fowl; she has more than 10 years of experience in her business, which is located in the back of her home. She is requesting a loan to purchase more animals, since she desires to increase and diversify her stock of animals in order to meet the tastes and preferences of her customers. This investment will help her to increase the variety and productivity of her animals, and will have a great impact on her business. This will in a short period of time allow her to increase her income and enhance her profitability, and finally will improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more animals, since she desires to increase and diversify her stock of animals.

loans.name: Griselda

texts.es:
La socia Griselda  tiene 50 años de edad es soltera y tiene 01 hijo, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurante, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de aceite, papas, pollos, entre otros.
La socia está muy agradecida con la ayuda de los inversionistas, por ayudarla a fortalecer su actividad económica la cual le permitirá ofrecer  una mejor educación a sus hijos. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “El Templo del Inca”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
The member Griselda is 50 years old, single, and has 1 child. The member alternates her daily activities with her restaurant business. For quite some time, she has made a living through this business. Her business does well as a result of the determination that she puts forth every day. The member desires to continue working so that, in this way, she can continue supporting her family.

Griselda is requesting a loan to buy oil, potatoes, and chicken, among other things.

The member is very grateful for the help from the lenders who have helped her strengthen her business, which will allow her to give her child a better education. The member belongs to the communal bank "El Templo del Inca" (The Temple of the Inca) in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy oil, potatoes, and chicken, among other things.

loans.name: Lynette

texts.en:
Lynette is a 45-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She is from Leyte in the Philippines. For more than 2 years now, Lynette has been earning an income from her small retail store.

Lynette has requested a loan to buy more merchandise to sell, like canned goods, noodles, rice, soap, and detergents. She believes that this loan will enable her to improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell, like canned goods, noodles, rice, soap, and detergents.

loans.name: Mokpokpo

texts.fr: Adjo, une femme de 47ans a en charge 04 enfants dont 03 scolarisés. Elle a pour conjoint un électricien. Elle revend de la nourriture au bord de la route et manque de fonds pour acheter des ingrédients(riz, huile végétale, tomate...) c'est pour cela, elle sollicite un second crédit. Le profit lui permettra de changer les conditions de vie de la famille et de rendre pérenne son activité.
texts.en: Adjo is a 47 year old woman with 4 children in her care, 3 of whom attend school. She is married to an electrician. She prepares and sells food at the roadside and requires funds in order to purchase ingredients (rice, vegetable oil, tomatoes); for this reason she is seeking a second loan. The profit that she generates from this will enable her to improve her family's living conditions and ensure the longevity of her business.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Balimaya vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 43 ans et 8 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Sido Sonikoura de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce de condiment, de bois et de fruits et. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  3eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Mamou  (la 2eme  femme debout  de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiment de tout genre dans le quartier et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une grande quantité de condiment de tout genre et à Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit au marché et à la maison à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Mamou    espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 30 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petites dépenses familiales  et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The four women of the Balimaya group all live in nuclear families. They are 43 years old on average and have 8 children each. They all live in the Sido Sonikoura quarter of Segou (the fourth largest administrative region of Republic of Mali). 
They met through neighbours, family, marriages and via their local businesses. They sell condiments, wood and fruit. In order to boost their working capital the group's members made the decision to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third loan. 
Madame Mamou (the second lady standing on the left in the photo) is a large seller of all types of condiments in the quarter and surrounding areas. She aims to use her loan in order to purchase a large volume of condiments of all types from Segou. She sells her goods for cash and credit at the market and via home sales to a mixed customer base. 
Madame Mamou aims to generate an average monthly revenue of 30,000 FCFA with this loan, which will be utilised for small family expenses, and she will also use it to boost her working capital. She would like to continue to work with Soro Yiriwaso in future.

loans.use: to purchase condiments

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Leyte, Philippines. She earns an income through her small retail store business. 

Lorena is selling goods such as canned goods, noodles, rice and so on. She has been in this venture for more than a year now. Her husband is a carpenter.

Lorena is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, rice and soft drinks, and to buy additional piglets to raise. A loan would be a great help for Lorena is improving her business as well as her income. She also wants to save money for the school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, rice and soft drinks and to buy additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en:
Gulnaz, 29 years old, is a housewife who looks after her family of six. Trained in cloth stitching, she provides services to customers from her own home. 

Gulnaz is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a sewing machine in order to continue her work efficiently and professionally. She is is very thankful to Brac Pakistan for this opportunity.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for sewing clothing.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is 44 years old and the mother of five children. Her husband owns a small firm in which he has a few compression molding machines. He takes orders for manufacturing plastic accessories. He employs day laborers for his molding machines. For the manufacturing of different plastic accessories he needs different categories and qualities of raw materials. Now he has taken a huge contract, larger than before, but he does not have enough cash on hand to buy additional crushed raw material to continue his manufacturing. 

Therefore, Shabana has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy crushed plastic raw material for his molding machine. She has to look after a huge family, taking care of each of her children, including their school fees, diet and health. For these purposes she needs a large income and her husband is the only person who is responsible for bearing the household expenses. 

Shabana is very happy after receiving this loan and thanks Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy crushed plastic raw material for her husband's molding machine.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Benkadi vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 27 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Sido sonikoura de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce d’habillement et de la de grains. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  2eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Sitan (la 1ere  femme debout  de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de pagne wax dans le quartier et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 pièces de pagne wax à Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit  au marché et à la maison à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Sitan  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 30 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petites dépenses familiales  et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The five women of the Benkadi group all live in traditional families. They are 27 years old on average and have 6 children each. They all live in the Sido Sonikoura quarter of Segou (the fourth largest administrative region of Republic of Mali). 
They met through neighbours, family, marriages and via their local businesses. They sell clothes and grains. In order to boost their working capital the group's members made the decision to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second loan. 
Madame Sitan (the first lady standing on the right in the photo) is a large seller of all types of pagnes (wax cloths) in the quarter and surrounding areas. She aims to use her loan in order to purchase 10 pieces of pagnes from Segou. She sells her goods for cash and credit at the market and via home sales to a mixed customer base. 
Madame Sitan aims to generate an average monthly revenue of 30,000 FCFA with this loan, which will be utilised for small family expenses, and she will also use it to boost her working capital. She would like to continue to work with Soro Yiriwaso in future.

loans.use: to purchase pagnes (wax cloths)

loans.name: Ma, Infamila

texts.en:
Ma. Infamila, a 45-year-old married mother of four, resides in Leyte, Philippines where she earns a living through her sari-sari or retail store business. She sells various goods and items to the people in her area.

Ma. Infamila is requesting a loan to buy more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, biscuits, snack foods, beverages, soap, toiletries, rice, cooking oil and condiments. In the future, she dreams of making her business more profitable and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, biscuits, snack foods, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Benkadi vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 46 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Sido sonikoura de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce d’habillement et de la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  3eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Kadia  (la 2eme  femme debout  de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de pagne wax dans le quartier et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 pièces de pagne wax à Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit  au marché et à la maison à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Kadia espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 30 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petites dépenses familiales  et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The four women of the Benkadi group all live in traditional families. They are 46 years old on average and have 4 children each. They all live in the Sido Sonikoura quarter of Segou (the fourth largest administrative region of Republic of Mali).
They met through neighbours, family, marriages and via their local businesses. They sell clothes and food for a living. In order to boost their working capital the group's members made the decision to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third loan.
Madame Kadia (the first lady standing on the right in the photo) is a large seller of all types of pagnes (wax cloths) in the quarter and surrounding areas. She aims to use her loan in order to purchase 10 pieces of pagnes from Segou. She sells her goods for cash and credit at the market and via home sales to a mixed customer base.
Madame Kadia aims to generate an average monthly revenue of 30,000 FCFA with this loan, which will be utilised for small family expenses, and she will also use it to boost her working capital. She would like to continue to work with Soro Yiriwaso in future.

loans.use: to purchase pagnes (wax cloths)

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en: To generate additional income, Minerva has been engaging in a hog-raising business within her local community. She is 47 years old and blessed with two children. She aims to improve her business and generate a higher income to meet the necessities of her family. Due to capital insufficiency, she would like to avail a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her hogs. She is hoping that she will improve her business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her hogs

loans.name: Maricruz

texts.es:
Maricruz vive con hijo mayor, en casa propia. Aproximadamente más de 35 años. Cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecino. Su familia es muy unida. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia; ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Maricruz se dedica a la venta de abarrotes(arroz, azúcar, aceite, menestras, entre otros) en el distrito de Cayaltí, desde hace más de 20 años aproximadamente. El destino del prestamo es para la compra de mercaderia pues desea aumentar y diversificar su stock de produtos y así ampliar du negocio, ya que depende de mucha demanda y con la diversificación de sus productos podrá cubrir las diversas necesidades de su clientes; de esta manera logrará mayores ventas, mejores ingresos, mayores ganancias y por ende una mejora en su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maricruz lives with a grown son in her own home for approximately 35 years. She has good personal and work references from her neighbor. Her family is very close. She lives in a community that works primarily in business, agriculture and farm animals. She lives in Cayaltí district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region in northern Peru.

Maricruz sells groceries such as rice, sugar, oil, household staples, etc. en Cayaltí for more than 20 years. The loan will be used to buy merchandise as she wants to increase and diverse the product stock and in this way cover the various needs of her customers. This will result in more sales, better profits, greater income and finally a better quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to increase the diversity and quantity of products.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela is 28 years old, married, and has three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Carmela is borrowing 24,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Carmela has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from making and selling native bags.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Parven

texts.en:
Parven is a 26-year-old lady who is very poor and needy. Her husband provides sheltering services to generate income to feed his entire family. He has been doing this business for many years and has been using wooden planks and bamboo, which have been depreciating over time. 

Now he is unable to continue his business without wooden boards and bamboo. Therefore, Parven has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy new smooth wooden boards, bamboo and a drill machine to continue his business again. She hopes that this loan will bring positive changes in her life and that her husband will earn maximum profit with the help of this loan.

Parven is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner because they empower her husband to buy new sheltering material.

loans.use: to buy new smooth wooden boards, bamboo and a drill machine for services.

loans.name: Noriniso

texts.ru: Норинисо пожилая жительница района Спитамен. Ей 61 год. Она уже многие годы продолжает ремесло своих предков. Вот уже 30 лет как Норинисо занимается животноводством. Она разводит крупнорогатый скот и у нее большой опыт в этой сфере. Это является главным источником дохода семьи. Сейчас Норинисо хочет расширить свой скотный двор и для этой цели нуждается в кредите. За счет запрашиваемой суммы кредита Норинисо собирается создать большой скотный двор и затем увеличить поголовье скотов. Она ждет финансовой помощи от Вас.
texts.en: Noriniso is an elderly woman living in Spitamen. She is 61. For many years she has done the work of her ancestors. Noriniso has been involved in animal husbandry for thirty years. She breeds cattle and has a lot of experience in this field. This is the primary source of income for the family. Noriniso wants to expand her farm and therefore needs a loan. With the money, Noriniso is going to build a large corral and then increase her livestock. She is waiting for financial assistance from you.

loans.use: build a large corral and increase her herd.

loans.name: Ima Sumacc

texts.es:
La socia Ima Sumacc se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa, la socia vende pantalones, blusas y polos, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un bazar. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar zapatos, polos, chompas, polos y blusas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Member Ima Sumacc has a business selling clothing. She sells pants, blouses, and shirts. She has had the business for some years now and it is going well. Her dream is to have a store. She seeks a loan to buy shoes, shirts, sweaters, jackets and blouses.. She is happy for the loan and promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy shoes, shirts, sweaters, jackets and blouses.

loans.name: Ciwara Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Ciwara vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 36 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Bougouni de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce de grains, de condiment et de bois. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  9eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Djelika  (la 2eme  femme debout  de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse grains de riz dans le quartier et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 sacs de grains de riz à Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Djelika   espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 27 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petites dépenses familiales  et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The five women of the Ciwara group all live in nuclear families. They are 36 years old on average and have 4 children each. They all live in the Bougouni quarter of Segou (the fourth largest administrative region of Republic of Mali).
They met through neighbours, family, marriages and via their local businesses. They sell grains, condiments and wood. In order to boost their working capital the group's members made the decision to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their ninth loan.
Madame Djelika (the second lady standing on the left in the photo) is a large seller of all types of rice in the quarter and surrounding areas. She aims to use her loan in order to purchase 2 bags of rice from Segou. She sells her goods for cash and credit at the market and via home sales to a mixed customer base.
Madame Djelika aims to generate an average monthly revenue of 27,000 FCFA with this loan, which will be utilised for small family expenses, and she will also use it to boost her working capital. She would like to continue to work with Soro Yiriwaso in future.

loans.use: to purchase rice

loans.name: Sabougnouman Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Sabougnouman vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Sido sonikoura de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce d’habillement et de la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  2eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Zenabou  (la 2eme  femme debout  de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de galette à sauce dans le quartier et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 sacs de grains de riz à Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Zenabou  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 15 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petites dépenses familiales  et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The five women of the Sabougnouman group all live in traditional families. They are 40 years old on average and have 5 children each. They all live in the Sido Sonikoura quarter of Segou (the fourth largest administrative region of Republic of Mali).
They met through neighbours, family, marriages and via their local businesses. They sell clothes and food. In order to boost their working capital the group's members made the decision to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second loan.
Madame Zenabou (the second lady standing on the right in the photo) is a large seller of all types of galettes (pancakes) with sauce in the quarter and surrounding areas. She aims to use her loan in order to purchase 3 bags of rice from Segou. She sells her goods for cash and credit at the market and via home sales to a mixed customer base.
Madame Zenabou aims to generate an average monthly revenue of 15,000 FCFA with this loan, which will be utilised for small family expenses, and she will also use it to boost her working capital. She would like to continue to work with Soro Yiriwaso in future.

loans.use: to purchase rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and laminated sheeting to finish the construction of her bathroom.

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es:
Anibal 34 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 03 hijos dependientes, vive con sus hijo y su conyugue, en el caserío Patacón en distrito de Pomahuaca. El caserío es pequeño con aspiraciones a superarse, en dicho caserío sus actividades principales son la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, y está ubicado en el distrito de Pomahuaca, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Anibal se dedica a la ganadería, cría de ganado caprino, cuenta con más de 05 años de experiencia en el rubro, dicho ganado los cría y los comercializa en el puerto Chiple o en la ciudad de Chiclayo, además Anibal se dedica a la cría de animales de corral como son gallinas, patos, pavos, etc., cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecinos, por su experiencia cuenta con bastante clientela de la zona, el destino del crédito es para invertir en el negocio compra de ganado caprino para engorde y posterior venta. Invirtiendo en su negocio y poder adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Anibal is 34 years old and lives with his life partner and their three dependent children. They live in the town of Patacón in the district of Pomahuaca.  The town is small with hopes of growing. In the town the principle economic activities are agriculture, business, and livestock.  It is located in the province in Jaén, in the region of Cajamarca, in the Northern mountains of Perú. 

Anibal works raising livestock.  He raises goats, and he has more than five years of experience in this field.  He raises these animals and sells them in the port of Chiple in the city of Chiclayo.  Anibal also raises small caged animals like chickens, ducks, turkeys, etc.  He has many good personal and work references from his neighbors.  He also has a lot of customers in the area because of his experience.  He will use the loan in order to purchase goats which he will fatten and then sell.  He plans to invest in his business in order to to be able to earn more income and thus improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase goats which he will fatten and then sell.

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en:
Nazia is 30 years old and the mother of 3 children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband runs his own auto body repair and painting business. He is the sole provider responsible for feeding his entire family and managing the household expenses.

Nazia's husband needs to purchase different types of tools and auto body repair accessories in order to increase the size of his business, improve the services for his regular clients, and earn a greater profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position, he is currently not able to make these necessary purchases. 

Therefore, Nazia has applied with another member for a Kiva group loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan. With her portion of the loan she will be able to help her husband purchase the above items for his auto repair business. 

Nazia is very thankful to Kiva lenders and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy paint and dent-repair accessories for her husband's auto repair business.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana is married and has one child. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as water, cigarettes, cards, glue, lighters, ointments, candies, detergent, sugar, sardines, noodles, biscuits, shampoo, soft drinks, hard drinks, and other things to sell. Ana opened her kiosk a few year ago with her own working capital of 150 USD. She is happy with the loan offered from Tuba Rai Metin, which enables her to have working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: To buy water, cigarettes, lighters, candies, detergent, sugar, sardines, noodles, biscuits, shampoo, soft drinks, hard drinks, and other things to sell

loans.name: Suriaya

texts.en:
Suriaya is a 52-year-old married woman. Her financial condition is not good. She has to think many times to start any task.

Her son has just started to drive a moto-rickshaw (a type of three-wheeled rickshaw that includes a motorbike). This rickshaw is being driven over local roads and for small distances. Its body is made of polyester, which is not strong enough to withstand the jerking it receives from the local roads.

Now the rickshaw body needs to be replaced because it rattles when driven. For this reason, he wants to buy a new body for his moto-rickshaw.

Suriaya has requested a loan so that her son can buy the moto-rickshaw body and drive it smoothly. She thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new moto-rickshaw body for her son.

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en:
Shumaila is a 32-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children. Her husband provides whitewash and oil paint services to his customers in the community; sometimes he has to go out of the city as well.  

He has secured a new contract for whitewash and oil paint of newly constructed houses, and Shumaila has requested a loan so that he can buy new paint brushes, rollers, kerosene oil, etc. The family's savings are very low, and she wants to change this situation, a goal she hopes this loan will help to achieve.

Shumaila is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy new paint brushes, rollers, kerosene oil, etc. for whitewash services.

loans.name: Djantoyerela Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Djantoyerela vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 43 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Bougouni de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce de grains et de la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  9eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Djeneba (la 1ere  femme debout  de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de grains d’arachides dans le quartier et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 sacs de grains d’arachide à Ségou et à Konodimini. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit au marché et à la maison à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Djeneba  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 60 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The four women of the Djantoyerela group all live in nuclear families. They are 43 years old on average and have 5 children each. They all live in the Bougouni quarter of Segou (the fourth largest administrative region of Republic of Mali).
They met through neighbours, family, marriages and via their local businesses. They sell grains and food. In order to boost their working capital the group's members made the decision to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their ninth loan.
Madame Djeneba (the first lady standing on the left in the photo) is a large seller of all types of peanuts in the quarter and surrounding areas. She aims to use her loan in order to purchase 10 bags of peanuts from Segou. She sells her goods for cash and credit at the market and via home sales to a mixed customer base.
Madame Djeneba aims to generate an average monthly revenue of 60,000 FCFA with this loan, which will be utilised for her children's expenses, and she will also use it to boost her working capital. She would like to continue to work with Soro Yiriwaso in future.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr:
Kossi est un homme âgé  de 43 ans. Il est marié  à une revendeuse et ont des enfants tous scolarisés. 
Kossi travaille comme blanchisseur depuis un moment. 
Kossi a requis son troisiéme crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter de la machine à laver, des fers à repasser et des détergents. 
Dans les prochaines années, Kossi voudrait créer des points de service  et assurer le bien –être de la famille.
texts.en: Kossi is a 43 year old man. He is married to a reseller and their children all attend school. He has been a laundry worker for a while. Kossi is seeking a third loan from WAGES in order to purchase a washing machine, irons and laundry detergent. In the years to come, Kossi would like to open further laundry spots and see to the wellbeing of his family.

loans.use: to buy a washer, irons, and laundry detergents.

loans.name: Luis Enrrique

texts.es:
El socio es el señor Luis Enrique, el socio tiene 33 años de edad y es soltero, él socio  continua dedicándose a trabajar como ejecutivo de ventas, él socio lleva buen tiempo con su trabajo  el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su trabajo, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta manera salir adelante.
 El socio Luis solicita el crédito para pagar sus estudios universitarios.
El socio Luis está muy agradecido con KIVA y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “El Templo del Inca”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Luis Enrique is a member of the communal bank "El Templo del Inca" in the city of Cuzco, in Peru.  He is 33 years old and single.

He continues working as a sales executive which he has done for quite some time now, and he is doing well thanks to the hard work he puts in every day. He wants to keep on working so that he can get ahead. 

Luis is requesting the loan to pay for his university studies. He is very grateful to Kiva and committed to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to pay for his university studies.

loans.name: Augusta Renee

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de casa de cambio y tambien la socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de bar,ella vende gaseosas y cervezas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de casa de cambio.La socia solicita el credito para comprar sillas para su bar.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Augusta Renee continues working in both her home business and in the bar.  She sells sodas and beer.  She works from 8am until 6pm.  She has several years of experience in this field and things are going well.  Her dream is to grow her home business.  She is asking for a loan in order to purchase chairs for her bar. 

She is happy about this loan and she promises to meet the repayment obligations.

loans.use: To purchase chairs for her bar.

loans.name: Rosa Benita

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 48 años de edad  de estado civil viuda vive con sus 4 hijos de 29, 27, 21 y 12 años en el cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Ella trabaja en el comercial Sisalema de secretaria y vendedora, Solicita el crédito para  realizar el mejoramiento de la casa. Su meta es tener un negocio propio. Su desafío es las enfermedades. En su tiempo libre le gusta ver la televisión y dedicarse a los hijos.
texts.en: Rosa is 48 years old, a widow, and lives in Ventanas region of the Rios province with her 4 children ages 29, 27, 21, and 12. She works for Sisalema (business name) as a secretary and salesperson. She seeks a loan to make home improvements. Her goal is to have her own business. Her challenge is staying healthy. In her free time she likes to watch television and spend time with her children.

loans.use: to make home repairs.

loans.name: Adilia Rafaela

texts.es:
Esos salones de clase en la que una vez ella estuvo ahí sentada recibiendo clases, ahora es el turno de Adilia de poder compartir sus conocimientos con los demás niños. Ejercer la profesión que ama es la que la motiva a culminar sus estudios como psicóloga, de esa manera podrá combinar la psicología con la educación, y al mismo tiempo ayudar con atención especializada a los niños que alguna vez les enseño a pronunciar sus nombres y a escribirlos. Adilia es madre soltera y tiene 12 años ejerciéndose como maestra de primaria, su motivación es la sonrisa de los niños y la satisfacción cuando aprueban todas sus clases. Para Adilia su hijo es lo más importante, por eso quiere brindarle una educación de calidad y lo mejor.
Adilia es el pilar fundamental de su familia, siendo madre soltera tiene muchas responsabilidades pero la de ser madre y maestra son las esenciales ya que su motivación son los niños y poder ayudarlos a ser mejores ha sido su meta. Adilia solicita el crédito para obtener su título de Psicóloga, necesita llevar un curso de titulación que le garantizara un futuro próspero para su familia, también cuenta con el apoyo de su madre. Confía en el financiamiento para aspirar a nuevas ofertas laborales que le garantizaran mayores ingresos económicos a su familia y podrá ser una profesional de calidad.
texts.en: These classrooms are where Adilia used to sit as a student to receive instruction, and now it is her turn to offer her knowledge to other children.  She exercises her teaching profession, which she loves and which motivates her to finish her studies in psychology.  In this way she will be able to combine psychology with education, and at the same time help children via specialized attention learn how to pronounce and write their names.  Adilia is a single mother and she has been teaching elementary school for 12 years.  Her motivation is the smile from the children and the satisfaction when they all are able to pass.  For Adilia, her child is her top priority.  For this reason she wants to provide high quality and better education.  Adilia is the pillar of her family.  As a single mother she has many responsibilities, but being a mother and a teacher are essential since her children are her motivation and she wants to help them become better - that has been her goal.
