El destino del crédito sera para mantenimiento de 1,5 has. De café en producción, con ello asegurará mayor y mejor producción para campaña 2015 y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Felipe is 53 years old. He has a stable home along with his wife and adult daughter. He lives in his own one-floor home made of rustic materials. Felipe and his wife were born in the village of El Pueblo. They live in family harmony and get along well with members of their village. He lives in the rural part of the village El Pueblo in the district of Santo Tomás. He lives in a community mostly dedicated to agriculture and livestock. His home has water service. Said district is located in the province of Cutervo, region of Cajamarca, in the northern mountains of Perú. 

The business that Felipe carries out is coffee farming, counting to date 1.5 hectares. The plantation, of Catimor variety, is three years old. It is in its first year of production and for 2015 it will be in its second year of production. He has his own agricultural land where the plot of coffee is, a business he has carried out for three years in the village of El Pueblo in the district of Santo Tomás. He has experience in the field of coffee growing, a product that he sells in the district of Santo Tomás to buyers of the region. Additionally Felipe works in livestock, raising sheep, and also the farming of grain products. He carries all of this out on his own land in the village of El Pueblo in the district of Santo Tomás.

The purpose of the loan will be to maintain 1.5 hectares of coffee production, and with it assure greater and better production for the 2015 season with the end to obtain better income to be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to maintain 1.5 hectares of coffee production, and with it assure greater and better production for the 2015 season.

loans.name: Marisela

texts.es:
Marisela una mujer de 32 años de edad madre de dos hijos de 7 y 11 años por los cuales un día tomo la decisión de tener su propio negocio de venta de comida pues no iba a permitir que sus hijos aguantaran hambre. 
Buscando mejores oportunidades de ingresos solicita un crédito para comprar ingredientes para sus preparaciones como lo son carnes frías como carne de hamburguesa, salchichas, panes, ensaladas, gaseosas etc.
Con la ayuda de este crédito obtendrá una mejor ganancia pues comprara los insumos en grandes cantidades y busca la manera desesperada de darle educación a sus hijos que es su gran sueño a corto plazo.
texts.en:
Marisela is a 32-year-old woman, mother of 2 children, ages 7 and 11, for whom one day she took the decision of establishing her own business selling food, since she wasn’t going to let her kids suffer from hunger. 

With the purpose of improving her incomes, she is requesting a loan to buy ingredients for her dishes, like processed meats, hamburger meat, sausages, bread, salads, sodas, etc.

With the help of this loan she will have more earnings, since she will buy these supplies in bulk. She is desperately looking for a way to give her kids an education, which is her biggest dream in the short run.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her dishes, like hamburger meat, sausages, potatoes, salads, and sodas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products to resell for her cosmetics store.

loans.name: Tulio Hernando

texts.es:
Tulio es un distribuidor de refrescos autorizado al por mayor que tiene gran coraje, espíritu y sentido de pertenencia por su trabajo, lo cuida, lo valora y lo ama y es que este negocio ha representado la sostenibilidad de su familia conformada por sus dos hijos de 17 y 18 años de edad a los cuales aspira poder ayudarles con los gastos de la universidad y con el que espera poder emplear personas y pensar en un proyecto de casa propia.
Sabe que la mejor manera de cumplir sus sueños es hacer bien las cosas y solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido al por mayor para esperar mejores ingresos y gracias a este crédito puede expandirse a otras tiendas y seguir ganando clientes para mejorar su futuro y comenzar a emplear personas pues tiene una edad ya considerable donde necesita un negocio que lo respalde en tiempos difíciles.
texts.en: Tulio is an authorized wholesale soft drink distributor who has guts, spirit, and a sense of belonging with his job. He takes care of it, he values it and he loves it because this business has meant stability for his family, which consists of his 17 and 18 year old sons and he aspires to help them pay for college expenses and he hopes to hire people and think about plans for a house of his own. He knows that the best way to achieve his dreams is by doing things well and he's requesting a loan to purchase wholesale an assortment of items to make more income and thanks to the loan he'll be able to expand to other stores and keep obtaining customers to improve his future and start hiring people because he's already at an advanced age and needs a business to support him when times get tough.

loans.use: To buy large amounts of merchandise to obtain more customers and help his children with college expenses.

loans.name: Nasira

texts.en:
Nasira is a 48-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her son. He is a shoemaker and very expert in his profession. He has been manufacturing shoes for many years. This is the reason he has a lot experience in his profession. 

He sews rexine shoes using a machine; after that he attaches the sole through stitching using his hands. In this way, he is generating income for his family. Nowadays, he has a huge contract, but he does not have cash in hand to buy raw materials to complete the contract.

Therefore, Nasira has requested a loan for her son so he can buy raw materials such as rexine, thread, glue, soles, etc.

Nasira is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, such as rexine, thread, glue and soles, for shoe making.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 26-year-old woman, living with her children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services by using a three-wheeled auto rickshaw. With the help of savings, he has purchased a used auto rickshaw. Its engine quality is good but the body is totally damaged. He does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy a new body and seat covers. He wants to start driving it and is looking for a lump sum amount to buy a rickshaw body. Therefore, Naseem has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy a new rickshaw body and can drive the rickshaw smoothly. Naseem hopes that now her husband will be able to generate more income. 

Naseem is very happy after taking this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw body for her husband.

loans.name: Rubina's Group

texts.en:
Rubina is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives with her four children and husband in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is the guardian of her family. He has been running his own blacksmith business for many years. 
 
Rubina's husband wants to purchase metal accessories and other tools for door-making purposes, but due to insufficient financial, he is unable to purchase these accessories. 

Therefore, Rubina has applied for a Kiva group loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she’ll enable her husband to purchase relevant items for his business purposes so that he can earn more profitable income to manage his business and household.

Rubina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy iron goods for manufacturing doors, windows, and iron accessories.

loans.name: Rosa Antonia

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre cabeza de hogar muy trabajadora que dedica a su negocio de tienda general de venta de productos de la canasta familiar 12 horas de cada día de la semana, aparte que desempeña su roll como madre con sus dos hijos que tienen 1 y 9 años de edad. 
Inicio su negocio pro necesidad económica y es que su tienda representa el único ingreso con el que se mantiene su familia y parte de sus padres ya que son personas de bajos recursos pero que tienen sueños y no le tienen miedo a lo que pueda pasar, por tal razón solicita un crédito para surtido de gaseosas, víveres, abarrotes, granos y productos de aseo personal que le permitirán acoger más público y más clientela lo que le representara aumento en sus ventas y mayores ingresos. 
Rosa es joven y sueña con una pareja con quien compartir pero que ella tenga todas las facultades para mantenerse y quiere que sus hijos estudien y tengan mejor futuro que su presente.
texts.en:
Rosa is a hard-working mother and the head of the household. She makes a living from her general store selling general family products 12 hours every day of the week. Apart from this, she performs her role as mother to her two children who are 1 and 9 years old.

She began her business because of economic necessity, and her store represents the only income, with which she supports her family. In part she also supports her parents since they are people of scarce resources who also have dreams, and are not afraid of what could happen. For this reason, she is requesting a loan for supplies of soda, provisions, groceries, grains, and personal cleaning products that will allow her to attract more of the public and more customers, which will represent an increase in her sales and a higher income.

Rosa is young and dreams of having a partner with whom she can share, but that she have all of the faculties to support herself, and she wants her children to study and have a better future than their present.

loans.use: to purchase stock in groceries, provisions, grains, and cleaning products to improve her sales.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: José tiene 54 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su sus dos hijos y una hija. José se gana la vida trabajando como albañil y cultivando principalmente maíz y frijoles. José es un hombre trabajador quien con mucho esfuerzo va sacando adelante a su familia. José desea cambiar las bases del techo de su vivienda dado que actualmente tiene madera y se encuentra deteriorada. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de polines  y así poder reemplazar la madera que se encuentra en mal estado.
texts.en: Jose is 54 years old and lives in a home of his own his with two sons and daughter. Jose makes a living by working as a mason and farming, mainly corn and beans. Jose is a hardworking man who puts great effort into getting his family ahead. Jose wants to replace the bases of his home's roof because currently it's wooden and has deteriorated. Due to this, he's requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of beams so he can replace the wood that's in bad condition.

loans.use: To purchase beams to replace the deteriorated wood in his roof.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a 47-year-old woman from Ormoc City. She is married with four children, ages 10 to 17. Wilma's husband drives a tricycle to earn a living for their family. 

Wilma, on the other hand, operates a sari-sari store business to help in raising their family. She is asking for a loan to buy rice, soft drinks, coconut wine, toiletries, and seasoning. She hopes that through this loan, she can increase her inventory and eventually increase her sales, too. 

In the future, she hopes to make her store bigger and introduce more items to make it more attractive to her customers, thus becoming more profitable.

loans.use: to buy rice, soft drinks, coconut wine, toiletries, and seasoning.

loans.name: Lilian Del Socorro

texts.es:
Lilian una mujer que atravesó por una difícil situación la cual fue perder a su esposo quedando sola, con su hijo y es que la época de ella era una donde el esposo llevaba todo al hogar y la mujer se encargaba del hogar. 
Luego de esta situación Lilian salió a buscar trabajo desesperadamente y no tuvo suerte y con la ayuda de un vecino pudo montar un negocio de tienda general que ahora representa todas sus esperanzas pues depende en la totalidad de los ingresos que este negocio genera para poder vivir. 
Es madre de un hijo de 12 años al cual le da apoyo moral y trata  de que estudio para que salga adelante en la vida y tenga un futuro prometedor.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido de la canasta familiar como abarrotes, víveres, productos de aseo personal y productos refrigerados. 
Con la ayuda del crédito mejorara sus ventas ya que será una tienda con buen surtido para el beneficio de sus clientes.
Sueña con seguir con su negocio y es que este crezca y beneficie a muchos más clientes.
texts.en:
Lilian is a woman who found herself in a difficult position when her husband died leaving her alone with a son and that was during a time when the husband provided for the home and the woman worked at home.

As a result Lilian went out to desperately look for work and didn't have any luck. With the help of a neighbor she was able to open a general store that now represents all her hopes because she depends totally on the income from this store to be able to live.

She is the mother of a 12 year old son who she supports and tries to educate so that he can be successful in life and have a promising future.

She seeks a loan to buy a supply of household goods including groceries, household items, personal care items and refrigerated products. With the help of the loan she will improve her sales as it will be a well-stocked store, to the benefit of its customers. She dreams of continuing with her business, growing the business so it benefits many more customers.

loans.use: to buy a variety of goods including groceries, household items, personal care items and refrigerated products to expand her store's inventory.

loans.name: Lene

texts.en:
Lene is 30 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Lene is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lene has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from selling personal products.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a supply of ice cream at wholesale so that he can achieve his goal of obtaining his own house and no longer settling for what he has.

loans.name: Kanoatkhon

texts.ru: Каноатхон пережила много трудностей. Ее муж умер много лет назад, и она одна вырастила своих детей. Каноатхон работала во многих местах, чтобы зарабатывать на жизнь. Она последнее 6 лет занимается шитьем женской одежды. Каноатхон предоставляет свои услуги у себя дома. Кроме женской одежды, она также шьет национальные матрасы «курпача». Каноатхон постепенно год за годом развивает данный бизнес и привлекает больше клиентов. Ее клиенты довольны ее работой и повторно обращаются ей. Каноатхон данное время нуждается финансовой поддержке, так как ее дочь собирается уехать в Российскую Федерацию на заработки, но не имеет денег для покупки авиабилета.  Каноатхон запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки авиабилета. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Kanoatkhon has lived through many hardships. Her husband died many years ago and she had to raise her children on her own. She worked in many places to earn a living. However, during the past six years she has been sewing women's clothing. She provides sewing services out of her home. In addition to women's clothing, she also sews traditional floor mattresses known as "kurpacha." Gradually, Kanoatkhon has been able to grow her business and attract more customers. Her customers are satisfied with her work, and she has many repeat orders. At present, Kanoatkhon needs financial support since her daughter plans to travel to the Russian Federation as a migrant worker, but lacks the money  for an airplane ticket. Kanoatkhon is requesting a loan in the amount of 3000 TJS to buy an airplane ticket. She is counting on your kindness and hopes for your compassion.

loans.use: to buy an air ticket for her daughter.

loans.name: Damaris De Jesus

texts.es:
Damaris, a sus 55 años de edad, es una mujer carismática y servicial que se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, una pequeña tienda de abarrotes que inició por la necesidad de generar ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia. 

A pesar de las adversidades, ella tuvo la fortaleza y la determinación para levantarse y seguir adelante y, gracias a ello lleva 8 años de trayectoria en esta actividad.

Su propósito en la vida es seguir progresando y por ello desea fortalecer su negocio acreditándolo con la compra de surtido de productos como abarrotes, granos, frituras, bebidas gaseosas y en general productos básicos de la canasta familiar, de esta forma podrá ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor calidad y servicio, logrando aumentar notablemente sus ventas y los ingresos que recibe de ellas.

Damaris manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo con su negocio y, en un futuro desea convertirlo en un supermercado, en el que los clientes puedan encontrar todos los artículos que necesiten y así mejorar la rentabilidad y poder ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.


Apoyando a este crédito estarás contribuyendo con el emprendimiento de las mujeres Colombianas!
texts.en:
Damaris is a charismatic 55 years old woman who works in her own business: a small grocery store that she opened out of necessity to generate income to support her family. In spite of adversity, she had the strength and determination to raise herself up and move forward. Thanks to that effort she has been in business 8 years. Her goal in life is to continue growing and strengthening her business by buying a variety of items to stock her store such as groceries, grains, soda pop and general groceries. In this way she will be able to offer her customers a better quality of selection and service, thus increasing her sales and the income she receives.

Damaris maintains that her main goal is to continue growing the business and in the future she wants to convert it into a supermarket, where customers can find everything they need and in this way improve profits and be able to offer a better quality of life to her family.

In supporting this loan you are contributing to the entrepreneurship of women in Colombia!

loans.use: to buy groceries, grains, soda pop and general groceries.

loans.name: Luz Mery

texts.es:
Luz Mery una mujer  honesta, trabajadora y soñadora que desde el año 1999 inicio su empresa buscando recursos para mejorar la condiciones de vida de su hogar el cual es conformado por su esposo y 4 hijos y claro como madre siempre quiere tener su hogar hermoso, ya sea con cosas no muy significativas pero por el esfuerzo y el amor que pone en su actividad representan un gran valor. 
Se dedica a la venta de productos como ropa, productos pro catalogo como productos de belleza, acolchados, productos de belleza etc. y necesita un crédito para comprar directamente los productos y tener mejor rentabilidad al venderlos por el precio estipulado en las revista demostrando gran transparencia en sus ventas. 
Con el crédito espera tener ganancias para seguir modificando su hogar y tener un “palacio” a su modo y claro seguir con su empresa que esta prevalezca en el tiempo y que sus clientes no busquen otra vendedora
texts.en:
Luz Mery is an honest, hard-working, and visionary woman who began her business in 1999 in search of resources to improve her home’s living conditions. Her household is made up of her husband and 4 children, and obviously as a mother she always wants to have her home be beautiful with things that are not very significant but because of the effort and love that she puts into her activity represent great value.

She makes a living from the sale of products such as clothing, and products from a catalog such as beauty products, cushions, beauty products, etc., and she needs a loan to purchase the products directly. This will increase her profitability by selling them at a the price stipulated in the magazine, demonstrating great transparency in her sales.

With the loan, she hopes to have profits to continue modifying her home to have a “palace” to her tastes. Of course, she hopes to continue with her business and for it to survive over time, and that her customers do not look for another seller.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products, cosmetics, clothing, and magazine and catalog products to have a variety to offer to her customers.

loans.name: Jaiver Francisco

texts.es:
Javier un hombre 34 años de edad, con un negocio de tienda general que lleva más de 10 años administrando y atendiendo con gran entusiasmo y su valor agregado es esa buena disposición que pone hacia el cliente dándole un excelente servicio.
Hoy Javier llega solicitando un crédito pues su tienda necesita variedad de surtido para competir en el sector y dar pelea a los grandes supermecardados que están llegando a los barrios amenazando con desparecer las tradicionales tiendas generales, por eso pide su ayuda para comprar un buen surtido y seguir operando ya que de su tienda depende su hijo y sus demás familiares que no cuentan si no con el apoyo de Javier.
texts.en: Javier is a 34 year old man with a general store he has been managing and operating for 10 years with great enthusiasm and what sets it apart is the attitude he has with the customers and the excellent service he provides them. Now Javier is requesting a loan because he needs a variety of merchandise to compete in this business and keep up with the big supermarkets that are showing up in neighborhoods and threaten to make traditional general stores disappear. That's why he's requesting help to buy a good variety of merchandise and continue operating because his son depends on it and his other relatives rely on Javier's help.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of household staple goods, seeking to compete with the supermarkets that threaten the survival of his store.

loans.name: Burulcha

texts.ru: Бурулча успешно погасила кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду КИВА и всем инвесторам за их помощь. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Бурулчи есть 2 коровы, 3 лошади и 10 овец. Также на земельном наделе мерою 0,7 ГА она выращивает кукурузу для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный доход Бурулчи от бизнеса составляет около 13,000 сом (KGS), также она подрабатывает пастухом.  Бурулча обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят и овец с целью дальнейшей их перепродажи. Доходы от кредита позволят Бурулче в дальнейшем развивать и расширять ее бизнес.
texts.en: Burulcha successfully paid off her last loan after using it for its intended purpose.  She is grateful to Kiva and everyone who contributed to her loan for their help.  She currently has two cows, three horses and ten sheep, as well as 0.7 hectares of land for growing corn both as a cash crop and for use on her own farm.  In addition, she earns some extra money herding livestock, bringing her monthly income to roughly 13,000 som.  Burulcha is seeking a loan of 150,000 som from Bai Tushum Bank to buy calves and sheep for eventual resale.  With her increased income due to this loan, she'll be able to grow and expand her business further.

loans.use: buy calves and sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando, de 45 años, inicio con un negocio de lavado de carros hace aproximadamente 8 años con el afán de buscar una actividad que le generara ingresos para poder sobrevivir.

En el momento en nació su hijo, encontró su motivación para trabajar incansablemente y así ofrecerle lo mejor para su vida y desarrollo.

Hoy en día su hijo tiene 8 años y se ha convertido en la alegría de este hombre trabajador.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de mangueras ahorradoras para poder continuar con su actividad de una manera más amigable con el ambiente, estos elementos le permitan mantener su servicio disponible y poder llevar el sustento para su hogar.

Con este préstamo podrá sostener  a su hijo y a su esposa brindándoles una calidad de vida mejor.

Apoya a Orlando para que pueda continuar con su actividad!
texts.en:
Orlando is 45 years old and started his carwash business approximately 8 years ago with the goal of finding an activity that could generate income to live on.

The moment his son was born he found motivation to work tirelessly so that he could offer him the best for his life and growth. 

Today his son is 8 years old and has become this working man's pride and joy.

He's requesting a loan to purchase water-saving hoses to continue his work in a more environmentally friendly way, and this asset would allow him to continue making his service available so he can support his household.

With this loan he'll be able to support his wife and son and provide them a better quality of life.

Help Orlando so that he can continue this job!

loans.use: To purchase water-saving hoses.

loans.name: Ivan Andres

texts.es:
El es Iván, un hombre de carácter y buena voluntad, con deseos de progresar y salir adelante con sus padres.

El se decidió por iniciar su negocio de preparación y venta de comidas rápidas y bebidas desde hace aproximadamente 6 años en un pequeño carrito con muchas ganas y empuje. 

Este oficio lo aprendió a través de su madre quien le enseño y le inculco buenos valores.

Hoy en día desea darle un pequeño impulso a su negocio, por esta razón requiere un préstamo para comprar insumos e ingredientes para sus preparaciones y así capitalizar su negocio.

Su principal sueño es poder abrir otro puesto de trabajo.

Es un hombre que sume retos y los enfrenta con valentía.
texts.en:
This is Ivan. He is a man of character and good will, who is eager to prosper and get ahead together with his parents.

Approximately six years ago, with a lot of drive and relentless will, he decided to start a business preparing and selling fast food and beverages from a small cart. He learned this trade from his mother, who taught him and instilled in him good values.

Today, he wants to give his business a boost. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy supplies and ingredients to prepare the food and, in this way, increase his business capital.

His main dream is to be able to open another stall.

He is a man who takes on challenges and faces them with courage.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients to prepare food to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is a married woman and a mother of three children from Ormoc, Philippines. She sells fish, vegetables and fruits in the market. She is also engaged in a business raising hogs. Marilyn is asking for a loan  to buy more fish, vegetables and fruits to sell. This will enable her to improve her sales as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more fish, vegetables and fruits to sell

loans.name: Bendita

texts.en: Bendita is married and has 6 children.  She is requesting a loan of $600 to buy additional supplies to keep in her store, including biscuits, sardines, noodles, cigarettes, shampoo, candies, lighters, soap, eggs and other items to sell. She has been running this business since 2000 with her own working capital of $500. Bendita is taking this loan to improve her business management because she wants to open a big store in the future.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, sardines, noodles, cigarettes, shampoo, candies, lighters, soap, eggs and other items to sell.

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en:
Zakia is a 26-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has owned an enterprise, stitching and selling embroidered dresses in nearby towns for many years. He has been recruiting skilled persons to do embroidery work for daily wages; he also brings some material home for Zakia because she helps him with the embroidery work. He is very expert in his profession and is especially famous for bridal dresses. People like his art and appreciate his efforts. 

Zakia's husband wants to meet the demand for bridal dresses, which is why he wants to buy stock of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors in advance. He requires some capital to buy the desired inventories but does not have sufficient cash on hand. Therefore, Zakia humbly requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan. Zakia is very glad and thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy stock of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors for her husband's business

loans.name: Elika

texts.en: Elika is a 60-year-old hardworking man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. Farming is his main source of income though he also earns extra income from his retail shop. Elika started this business to improve his standard of living. His main challenges are seasonal changes and inadequate capital. He has a vision of becoming a modernized farmer. Elika is requesting a loan to buy manure for his banana plantation.

loans.use: to buy manure for his banana plantation.

loans.name: Munanza's Group

texts.en:
Munanza is a 30-year-old woman and mother of four children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession. He sells fruits, e.g., apples, bananas, grapes, etc. He is solely responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Munanza's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits for reselling so that he can increase the size of the business, improve his sales growth, and earn maximum profit. But due to his unfavorable financial position, he is not in a condition to purchase fruits for his business. Therefore, Munanza has applied for a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase fruit. 

Munanza is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy fresh and seasonal fruits for reselling.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a 46-year-old married woman from Leyte, Philippines. She runs a small sari-sari, or variety store, business. Marissa sells various goods and items to the people in her area. For more than 6 years, this business has provided Marissa with her needed income.

Marissa is asking for a loan to buy more groceries such as canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap, toiletries, biscuits, snack foods, detergents and condiments to sell. This loan will enable her to increase her inventory, thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. Marissa hopes to expand her store so that it will generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy more groceries such as canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap, toiletries, biscuits, snack foods, detergents and condiments to sell

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en: Ruby is a 33-year-old woman from the city of Ormoc. She has owned a piggery for four years. Ruby is asking for a loan to buy more piglets to raise and feed to keep them healthy. Ruby dreams of expanding her business so she can provide for her children, ages 6 and 10, and to help her husband in meeting the needs of their family. In the future, Ruby hopes that her children can proceed to college and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Lisbe

texts.es:
Lisbe tiene 31 años de edad, su estado civil es conviviente, reside en el distrito de Buenos Aires, natural de la zona, vive en casa propia, junto a su familia. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila y se dedican a ala agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Dicha comunidad esta ubicada en el distrito de Buenos Aires, provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad a la que se dedica Lisbe es a la venta de cerveza, en su domicilio, y también vende plátano y zapallo, esta actividad la realiza desde hace más de 4 años, con experiencia en el negocio, y buen historial crediticio, destino del crédito será para capital de trabajo(compra de más cantidad de cerveza, incluyendo los cascos) y para abonar su platación de plátano, lo que le permitirá aumentar sus ingresos, mejorar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Lisbe is 31 years old, married, and lives in the district of Buenos Aires.  She is originally from that area and lives in a house she owns with her family.  Life in her community is calm and focused on agriculture, livestock, and commerce.  This community is located in the district of Buenos Aires, the province of Morropon, and the region of Piura on the northern coast of Peru.

Lisbe works selling beer from her home.  She also sells bananas and pumpkins.  She has done this work for four years.  She has experience and a good credit history.  She will use this loan for working capital to purchase a larger quantity of beer, including the bottles and to fertilize her banana crop.  This will allow her to increase her income, improve her profits, and therefore improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of beer, including the bottles, and to fertilize her banana crop.

loans.name: Gregoria Josefa

texts.es:
Gracias a la perseverancia y coraje de Gregoria es que ahora su hogar podrá tener unos ingresos extra.

Ella prepara y vende alimentos en su restaurante ubicado en el municipio de Medellín, actividad que emprendió con el afán de buscar nuevos ingresos para el sostenimiento de sus padres.

Sus padres son la mayor motivación que tiene para trabajar diariamente y esforzarse para ser cada día mejor.

Ella espera poder impulsar su negocio con la compra de surtido de ingredientes e insumos para sus preparaciones.

Con estos elementos ella podrá tener sus comidas siempre disponibles para sus clientes que son la razón de ser de su negocio.


Su mayor sueño es poder ampliar su restaurante y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Thanks to Gregoria's perseverance and courage, her household will now be able to have some extra income.  She prepares and sells food at her restaurant, which is located in the town of Medellin.  She started this business when she was making an effort to find a new source of income to provide for her parents.  Her parents are her biggest motivation to work every day and to make an effort to be better every day.

She hopes to improve her business by purchasing a stock of ingredients and supplies to prepare her food.  With these items, she will be able to have her food available, since her customers are the reason for her business.  Her dreams is to expand her restaurant and improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and supplies to prepare the food she sells at her restaurant.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 35-year-old divorced woman with two children, aged 12 and 9 years, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She owns a motorcycle which she uses to provide transportation services as her main source of income, although she owns rental houses and practices farming for additional income. These businesses have enabled Rose to sustain herself and take care of her children. High rental and license fees are a problem, but she has hopes of completing her other rental houses.

Rose is requesting a loan to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot, 50 years old, lives in the village of Tandzaver in the Syunik region. He is married and has two sons, who are already married and living with their families in the city of Kapan. Ashot is a leading specialist in his village since he provides mechanized services. He has his own wheeled tractor with attachments such as a lawnmower, grass fibulae and a plow. He says he is very busy, always having many orders from the villagers to mow hay, to clamp it or to plow. He works without days off and with great pleasure, since his village is not big and all of his customers are either his neighbors or friends, whom he is always happy to see. 

Ashot has asked for this loan since he must repair some of his machinery because his orders are especially high right now as all the villagers gather and store hay during these months for their farm cattle for the winter.

loans.use: to repair some of his machinery because his orders are especially high right now

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 44-year-old hardworking woman with five children, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She owns a school, where she earns a living, although she also carries out farming to earn extra income. She started the business to improve her standard of living. She has the hardship of delayed payment of school dues by the parents; however, she hopes to expand her school in the future.

Rose is requesting a loan to buy construction materials to complete constructing the school.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to complete constructing the school.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to restock supplies of natural and cosmetic products to continue forging the education and future of his three children.

loans.name: Ana Silvia

texts.es: Ana tiene 36 años de edad y habita junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos de 17 años, 13 años y un año de edad quienes actualmente se encuentran estudiando. Ana posee un pequeño negocio de venta de refrescos naturales y venta de variedad de fruta. Ella es una mujer emprendedora quien junto a su esposo mantienen la economía del hogar. Ana desea reparar el techo de su vivienda el cual se encuentra deteriorado. Además, desea comprar una pila y encementar el piso del área de donde colocará el área la pila. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, lámina galvanizada y una pila.
texts.en: Ana is 36 years old and lives together with her husband and their three children ages 17, 13, and 1 year old who are studying. Ana has a small business selling natural drinks and a variety of fruit. She is a entrepreneurial woman who together with her husband maintains the household expenses. Ana wants to repair the roof of her housing which has deteriorated. Additionally, she wants to buy a wash basin and to cement the floor in the area around it. With the amount requested she will buy cement, sand, corrugated metal and a wash basin.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, corrugated metal and a wash basin to repair the roof of her housing and to cement the floor where the wash basin is.

loans.name: Masturakhon

texts.ru: Мастурахон вдова. Она живет на севере Таджикистана вместе с 2 детьми. Им 12 и 18 лет. Мастурахон является единственным кормильцем семьи. Она начала свой бизнес купле продажей продуктов питания 3 года назад. Она имеет маленький магазин возле своего дома. Она продает  все первые необходимые продукты питания. Мастурахон сама справляется с бизнесом и работает упорно каждый день с раннего утра до позднего вечера. Она использует полученный доход, чтобы обеспечить своих детей со всеми необходимыми средствами и дать им хорошее образование. Она должна купить печку, дров и уголь для зимнего сезона и поэтому она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Masturakhon is a widow who lives in the north of Tajikistan with her two children aged 12 and 18. She is the only breadwinner in her family. She started her business buying and selling food products three years ago. She has a small shop near her home where she sells grocery staples. She runs the business by herself and works hard every day from early morning to late evening. She uses the revenue she receives to care for her children in every way and give them a good education.

Masturakhon needs to buy a stove, wood and coal for the winter and therefore she is requesting a loan of 5,000 somoni. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: to buy a stove, wood and coal for winter

loans.name: Nurbek

texts.ru: Нурбек родился  13 декабря 1989  года в  кишлаке  Ниджани   города Истаравшана   Согдийской  области. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. В течении трех лет он занимается дехканством.  В дехканском хозяйстве  «Хол» Он имеет 2,0 гектара земли, из них 0,5 гектара винограда, 1,5 гектара для  выращивания овощей и корма для скота. У него есть корова и баран. Он хочет получить кредит для покупки семян и обработки земли. Он заранее благодарит МДО Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Nurbek was born on December 13, 1989, in the village of Nidjani near the city of Istaravshan in the Sogdiski region. He is married and has two children. For the past three years he has been working as a farmer. On his farm, called "Hol", he has 2 hectares of land, of which 0.5 is planted with grapes and the remaining 1.5 with vegetables and animal feed. He has a cow and a ram.

Nurbek wants a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer. He thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dairy, cookies, chocolates, peanuts, etc.

loans.name: Eliso

texts.en:
Eliso, who is a 38-year-old married woman, lives in the village or Orsantia. She has six members in her family and they earn income from agricultural activity. Eliso works hard on the family-owned agricultural land, growing nuts and also taking care of the milking cow, whose products are sold locally. In addition to this, Eliso's husband gets an income from working as a private artisan. However they have a large family and require more income for living in normal conditions.

Eliso has a great desire to expand her agribusiness and purchase additional milking cows in order to produce more products to sell. She has her own loyal customers and the demand will be the same. With the requested loan Eliso wants to also purchase stock of clothing and home products and start trading in her community.

The loan will be a great support to this hardworking woman and her large family, as she will develop trading and agribusiness and will increase her productivity.

Eliso awaits your support and kindness.

loans.use: to expand her agribusiness and also start trading.

loans.name: Florenca

texts.en:
Florenca lives in Baucau. She is married and has two children. There four members in the family, including her husband and two children. 

She has been doing business since 2014 with her own working capital of $450.00. She is requesting a loan of $600.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to add with her working capital to buy more additional supplies to  keep in her store, such as coffee, candles, salt, biscuits,  noodles, cigarettes, aqua, soy, eggs, pens, notebooks, and other things to sell, Including soft drinks and hard drinks. 

 She wants to open a big store in the future , so she is taking this loan to improve her management for her business.

loans.use: To buy coffee, candles, salt, biscuits,  noodles, cigarettes, aqua, soy, eggs, pens, notebooks, and other things to sell, Including soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Piason

texts.en:
Piason is a hardworking man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in livestock as his main source of income, though he also practices farming to earn an extra income. 

He started this business with the intention of developing himself and improving his standards of living. He hopes to expand his businesses and become a modernized farmer, though he faces a challenge of lack of capital to meet the increasing demands.

He is requesting a loan to buy more cows for his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cows for his farm.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a thirty-nine year old, hardworking married man living in Kamwenge Uganda. He deals in livestock as his main source of income though he also practices farming to earn extra income. He started this business with the intention of earning a living, improving his standards of living, and educating his children. John hopes to expand his businesses and have a modernized farm though he faces a challenge of lack of capital. He is requesting a loan to buy more cattle for the farm in order to meet the increasing demands.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for his farm.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is a 31-year-old hardworking lady living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a retailer and at the same time sells goats. She has asked for a loan in order to buy soap, cooking oil, bread and biscuits to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap, cooking oil, bread, and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Luisa Maria

texts.es:
Luisa se encuentra casada y gracias a su gran capacidad de trabajo puede tener una buena calidad de vida gracias a su negocio con el cual genera ingresos para contribuir económicamente junto con su esposo para que en su hogar mejoren las condiciones económicas y puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida. 

Desde hace más de 3 años comenzó a trabajar vendiendo productos desechables en un pequeño negocio ubicado en el municipio de Medellín. 

Debido a que sus clientes están aumentando y cada vez demandan más productos, Luisa busca un préstamo para comprar surtido de productos desechables como vasos y platos para ofrecer a sus clientes mayor variedad de productos en su distribuidora.

De esta manera su negocio saldrá adelante y podrá ofrecer en su hogar unos buenos ingresos para que sigan teniendo una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luisa is married and, thanks to her great capacity for work, she can have a good quality of life. This is thanks to her business, with which she generates income to contribute economically along with her husband, so that the economic conditions of their home improve and they can have a better quality of life. More than 3 years ago, she started working selling disposable products in a small business located in the municipality of Medellin. 

Due to the fact that her customers are increasing and demanding more products every day, Luisa is requesting a loan to buy various disposable products like cups and plates to offer her customers a better variety of products in her business. In this way, her business will move forward and she will be able to offer good income in her home, so that they can continue having a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy various disposable products to supply her business.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is a 42-year-old woman from Leyte, Philippines. She is engaged in retail sales of coconut wine and soft drinks. This the source of her income. 

She needs a loan for her business and is requesting a loan to buy more coconut wine and soft drinks.

A loan will enable Merlita to augment her stocks, thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. In the future, Merlita hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more coconut wine and soft drinks

loans.name: Amjad

texts.en:
Amjad is a 28-year-old married man from Deir El balah city. He lives with his wife and one small son in a simple house. Amjad opened an internet cafe in the city three years ago. He provides general services for the students and he also has play stations for the kids. 

Amjad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new computers and chairs for his business. By taking this loan, the income will increase and Amjad will be able to improve the family's living conditions. 

Amjad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy new computers and chairs for his business.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a forty-five-year-old man, married, with thirty-five children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He deals in buying cattle and later selling meat for profit. In addition, he has cocoa gardens which supplement his business. He is very hard-working and he has a dream of educating his children. He faces a challenge of stubborn cattle especially during transportation, and some end up running away from him.
He started this business in 1990, and he would like a loan in order to buy more cattle to sell.

loans.use: to buy cattle for selling.

loans.name: Marry Jane

texts.en:
Marry Jane, a micro-entrepreneur from Quezon City, Philippines, has run her copy center for years now, and she makes a good income from this. She is married and the couple is determined to work hard to provide their children with a better education than they currently have. Having a big family requires a lot of effort to provide for everyone’s needs.

A copy center offers services like document copying and reproduction services. She also get revenue from fax services, on-site PC rental,and office product sales. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,500 in sales every day.

To improve her profit, Marry Jane is taking out PHP 60,000 loan assistance which she will be utilizing to buy an additional copier and supplies needed in her business. She is expecting a boost in her income through this financial assistance.

Marry Jane only wants good health for her family. She desires to expand her copy center  very soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional copier and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 40-year-old woman, residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children. 

Her husband has been providing the services of white wash for many years. Only he is responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family. Shehnaz's husband wants to purchase paint brushes and paint canes for his business purpose. But due to financial constraints he is not in a suitable position to buy all these products. 

Therefore Shehnaz has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these accessories and also helpful for him to earn maximum profitable income to manage his house hold and business. 

Shehnaz is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy brushes and paint canes

loans.name: Amor

texts.en:
This is Amor, 42, resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Robinson, a company driver. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Amor operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 16,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products.

Amor hopes to expand her business and dreams to have a good health and life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables, and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Valeriana works hard to support her family.

She has a firewood retail business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from pig fattening.  Valeriana is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of firewood to sell.

Valeriana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Marivel

texts.en:
Marivel is 36 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Marivel is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Marivel has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George, a thirty-eight year-old-man, is married with four children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He buys and sells cocoa as his major business, which he started in 2006. He has cocoa gardens that supplement his business for better returns. He is very hard-working and started this business to help him cater to the needs of his family. Inadequate capital is his major challenge, and he wants a loan to buy more cocoa to sell for increased profits.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to resell.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is thirty four years old and married with six children, living in Kasese, Uganda. 

Edward has operated a textile shop since 2009 and also has a motorcycle used for transport business where he gets a side income . Edward has a dream of growing his business into a wholesale business; however,he is faced with a challenge of limited capital. 

Edward wants money to buy dresses, shirts, blouses, trousers and children's wear to sell during the Christmas period.

loans.use: to buy dresses, shirts, blouses, trousers, and children's wear to sell

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en: Geofrey is thirty years old, married with no children, and he lives in Kasese, Uganda. For seven years, Geofrey has been operating a textile shop of new clothes and also sells second hand clothes to meet his customer demand. He began the business in order to be self-employed. He has a dream of making his shop into a model shopping center. Geofrey wants money to buy shoes, dresses, men's suits, ladies' and children's suits, and other textiles to prepare for the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy shoes, dresses, men's suits, ladies' and children's suits, and other textiles.

loans.name: Khama

texts.en: Khama is a 21-year-old student and is studying Accounting at a University. She lives in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. Due to a lack of financial support, Khama would like to request a loan to pay for her tuition fees. This loan will help her get a higher education. After graduation, she is going to find a good job with a reasonable salary in the city.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for university tuition for this semester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock up on basic staples, including a wider variety of staples in order to attract new customers

loans.name: Winefreda

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Winefreda works hard to support her family.

She has a broom-making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig-fattening.  Winefreda is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for her broom-making business.

Winefreda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her broom-making

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is married and she has five children. She has a very high interest in doing business. 

She has been involved in business activities since 2012 with her own working capital of $150.00, and she makes her best on it. 

She is earning good money but she still wants to improve her management for her business, so she is taking a loan of $1500.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy more additional items to keep in her store including noodles, wheat, coffee, cold aqua, cold drinks and other things to sell. 

She is happy with the loan that is offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: To buy noodles, flour, coffee, cold aqua, cold drinks, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal, wood, and nails to improve her home's corridor.

loans.name: Fidel Arnoldo

texts.es:
Fidel de 50 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado.  Está casado, tiene seis hijos tres de ellos ya están casados, los otros tres hijos todavía van a la escuela uno en 7°, el otro 4° y el menor de todos 2°.

Fidel junto a la esposa tienen el negocio de engorde y venta de cerdos, negocio que lo tienen desde hace ya 25 años, ya que cuando llega la fecha de hacer el cultivo del maíz, ellos ya por medio de la venta de cerdos tiene el dinero para la compra de los insumos agrícolas,  trabajo que realiza desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las tres de la tarde.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar una cerda, concentrado y harinilla para engordar los cerdos con los que ya cuenta, así seguir generando ingresos en su hogar y seguir ayudando y sacando adelante a su familia, dándoles, el estudio, la alimentación y el vestuario merecido.

Fidel sueña con poder seguir con su trabajo y llegar a tener una porqueriza, para que su negocio crezca, también desea poder ayudarle siempre a sus hijos para que no sufran y puedan tener una vida tranquila hasta que cada uno de ellos sea independiente.
texts.en:
Fidel, age 50, studied through the fifth grade.  He is married and has six children.  Three of his children are already married, while the other three still go to school—one in 7th, another in 4th, and the youngest in 2nd.

Together with his wife, Fidel has a business fattening and selling pigs.  He has had this business for 25 years now, because when it comes time to do the corn planting, through their pig sales he has the money to buy the farming supplies.  He works from six in the morning until three in the afternoon.

The loan that he is requesting is to buy a sow, as well as concentrated feed and grain for fattening the pigs that he already has.  In this way he can generate income for his household and keep helping and getting his family ahead, giving them schooling, food, and clothes, as they deserve.

Fidel dreams of being able to continue with his work and someday coming to the point of having a pigsty, so that his business can grow.  He also wants to be able to always help his children so that they don’t suffer and they can have a calm life until each one of them is living independently.

loans.use: to buy a sow, as well as concentrated feed and grain to fatten the pigs he already has

loans.name: Ricca

texts.en:
Ricca is a 27-year-old married woman and a mother of a two-year-old child from Leyte, Philippines. She runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Ricca has been in the business for more than a year now. 

As of this time, Ricca needs additional capital for the expansion of her store. She is asking for a loan to buy more stocks like canned goods, noodles, rice, soap, toiletries, biscuits, snack foods, condiments and others to sell. Through this, Ricca will be able to augment her stocks thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. Ricca hopes of making her business a sustainable one. She also wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stocks like canned goods, noodles, rice, soap, toiletries, biscuits, snack foods, and condiments to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more supplies like toys and beds for her nursery.

loans.name: Roslyn

texts.en: Roslyn is a fish vendor from Leyte, Philippines. She is a married woman and the mother of two children. She has been in fish vending for more than six years now. This is her main source of income. Roslyn is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell. A loan will enable her to sell more fish to the market. In the future, she hopes to improve her business so that it will generate more income necessary for their expenses and schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Agapito

texts.es:
Agapito vive en casa propia de material rustico, vive con su cónyuge y sus cinco menores hijos de 16, 14, 12, 10 y 9 años de edad, de los cuales los dos primeros cursan la secundaria en el caserío Sondor y los tres últimos cursan primaria en colegio nacional del caserío de Sondor, Agapito tiene 12 años radicando en la zona, tiene muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por sus vecinos. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio; y está ubicada en el distrito de Pomahuaca, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad a la que se dedica el Agapito es la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de cafeto, ubicado en el Anexo Alto Sondor - Pucara, con una experiencia en el rubro de 11 años, el préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudara a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto, además se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno contando con 2 cabezas de ganado, cultivos de maíz, yuca, piña.
texts.en:
Agapito lives in his own house made of rustic material. He lives with his spouse and their five youngest children, of ages 16, 14, 12, 10 and 9. The first two attend high school in the village of Sondor, and the last three attend elementary school in the national school in Sondor.

Agapito has made his home in the area for 12 years. He has very good references, both personal and work-related, from his neighbors. His community is mainly dedicated to agriculture, livestock, and trade. It is located in the district of Pomahuaca, part of Jaén province, which is found in the Cajamarca region of Perú’s northern highlands.

Agapito makes his living in agriculture, specifically growing coffee. Located in the Alto Sondor – Pucara settlement, he has 11 years of experience in this line of business. The loan that will be given to him will be used for agricultural work, application of sanitary products, fertilizers, and manual labor for his harvest.

This will help him with not only with the physiological, morphological, and productive improvement of his crops, but also to have an adequate harvest, which will allow him to have greater production and a better quality product, so that he will not have problems selling his product. Additionally, he makes a living raising cattle, having 2 head of cattle, as well as growing corn, yucca, and pineapple.

loans.use: to pay for agricultural work, application of sanitary products, fertilizers, and manual labor for his harvest.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana lives in Baucau. She is married and she has two children. She is applying for a loan of $1,500 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a shop for her business and her shop is in the center of the market, so many people come to buy from it. 

Luciana has been involved in business activities since 2008. She started with her own working capital of $600. She is earning a good income from selling shoes so she is still happy to do her business. She is selling shoes and she also sells clothes, bags and other things. 

She is taking this loan because she wants to add more including shoes, clothes, bags and other things to sell.

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothes, bags and other things to sell.

loans.name: Vilen

texts.en:
Vilen lives in Kapan City in the Syunik region of Armenia. He is 32 years old, married, and he has two school-aged children. His wife does not work and instead takes care of their children and their house. Vilen makes cargo transfers on his friend’s truck from the Meghri city of Syunik region to Yerevan.  In addition, he uses his own car to provide taxi services around the city.
Both of his occupations bring enough income to meet his family's basic needs, but any additional costs he simply cannot afford himself.  Now, his wife has some health problems that require treatment, but Vilen faces a lack of money. He and his family would be very happy and thankful to have this loan, which will be used for the treatment course of his wife.  This would be really great support for their family at this time.

loans.use: to pay for health treatment for his wife.

loans.name: Efluleziyo

texts.en: Efluleziyo is twenty-seven years old, married with four children, and she lives in Kasese, Uganda. She is a food vender and she sells bananas, cassava flour, and tomatoes. She has been in that business for four years. She has a dream of expanding her business although she is faced with the challenge of limited capital. Efluleziyo is a hard-working woman who wants money to buy additional bananas to sell.

loans.use: to buy bananas for selling.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
This is Aida. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Aida desires for her business to continue growing and for her family to have a sustainable source of living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
This young lady’s name is Anna and she is 28 years old. She lives with her parents and brother in Vanadzor City in the Lori region. Anna has a higher pedagogical education and already five years of experience in this field. She works at the school as a teacher of Armenian Language and Literature. She also gives private paid courses of Armenian Language and Literature, in this way preparing the pupils for the entrance examinations for the higher educational institutions. Despite her young age, Anna has already managed to excel in her profession of pedagogue as a clever and intellectual person, and her pupils distinguish her among many other teachers for her patience and kindness towards them.

Anna asks for a loan of 300,000 Armenian Drams in order to buy a computer and several professional literature items connected with teaching methodology.

loans.use: to buy a computer and several professional literature items connected with teaching methodology.

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.en: Vanessa is 38 years old, married and has two children. They live in Tuguegarao City. Her spouse provides motorcycle transport business for income. She uses the income for the family's daily expenses for meals and other bills in school. She is now asking for additional revolving capital of PHP 7,000 to buy gasoline and maintain the motorcycle. This will ensure a safe travel for all the passengers and gain good profits as well.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and maintain the motorcycle for her husband's transportation service.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim is the age of 49; she is the mother of five children. She  lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her son is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days his rickshaw is not working properly; because of this he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Shamim has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her son to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Shamim is so thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the repairing cost of her son's rickshaw for his transportation service.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en: Brigida is managing a talipapa (vegetable) stall for the people in their village. She is 47 years old, married and has three children. She uses her income to pay school fees and use as revolving capital in her business. She wanted to improve her profits, but has insufficient funds that is why she is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy fish, vegetables, and meat to sell. She promises to repay her loan in full.

loans.use: to buy fish, vegetables, and meat to sell.

loans.name: Jaber

texts.en:
Jaber is a 46-year-old married father of four children; he is a hard working Palestinian refugee. He puts so much effort into providing his beloved family with the necessary living needs. 

Jaber lives and works in a Palestinian camp; he has a furniture shop, which he established in 1993. The business is going on just fine. Jaber's family's needs are increasing, which makes expanding and developing his business hard to achieve without any additional external support. For this reason, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase his business merchandise with newly released low-priced furniture that is highly requested by his customers.

He is the sole earner of his family, and has to make sure that he can cover their necessary needs, especially providing them with the necessary education to make sure they will benefit from a brighter future.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise with newly released low-priced furniture that is highly requested by his customers.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a sari-sari or variety store owner from Leyte, Philippines. She is a married woman and the mother of three children. Rosemarie has been in the business for more than four years now. She sells various goods and items to the people in her place.

Rosemarie is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, biscuits and bread, soda and beverages. This loan will allow her to augment her stock and attract more buyers. Rosemarie dreams of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, biscuits and bread, soda and beverages.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is a rice retailer from Leyte, Philippines. She is a married woman and a mother of three children. Roselyn has been in the business for more than 14 years now. This is her main source of income.

Roselyn is asking for a loan to buy more rice. With this, she will be able to sell more to her customers thus augmenting her sales and income. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more rice for her retail shop.

loans.name: Romulo

texts.en:
Romulo is married and he works hard to support his family.

He has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Romulo is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for his motorcycle transportation business.

Romulo has been sustaining his business activities through his past 19 loans from NWTF. He hopes that his hard work will help him attain his dream to save enough money to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.en:
Inocencia is 49 years old, married, and has three children; two of whom are currently in school.

Inocencia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been in pig fattening for 31 years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Inocencia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Hope

texts.en: Hope is a resident of Muko in the Mbarara District with six biological children and two other dependents, all in school. She started farming some 20 years back but could not yield anything because of the poor methods she was using. That is when she got to know UGAFODE Microfinance and acquired a loan of 3,000,000 UGX which helped her farming business grow and because of her hard work she continued expanding. And now she is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 UGX to diversify her farming business. She thanks UGAFODE for supporting her in her business ventures.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers and improved seeds.

loans.name: Estidt Manuel

texts.es:
Estidt, a sus 28 años de edad, es un hombre carismático, activo y servicial. 

Ser independiente, fue el principal motivo para luchar incansablemente día a día, buscando alternativas para ganarse la vida y llevar el sustento a su hogar en el que vive con sus padres. 

Desde hace aproximadamente 5 años, comenzó a fabricar calzado para todo tipo de clientes, de muy buena calidad, lo que le permitió darse a conocer en el sector y lograr un buen reconocimiento. 

Esto lo impulsa a solicitar el apoyo del crédito para fortalecer sus inventarios, pues comprará materiales como suelas, pegas, puntillas, entre otros y así podrá satisfacer la demanda que aumenta en la temporada de fin de año, pues cuenta con la ventaja de vivir en un barrio donde hay mucha afluencia de clientes; esto le ayudará a mejorar los ingresos que percibe por su labor. 

Estidt manifiesta que nada le impide hacer lo que le apasiona, por ello siempre se propone nuevas metas y entre ellas está el de convertirse en un gran distribuidor de calzado y generar oportunidades de empleo, así podrá mejorar la calidad de vida y el bienestar tanto de su familia, como la de aquellas personas que le ayuden a realizar su labor diaria.
texts.en:
Estidt, 28, is a charismatic, active, service-oriented person.  To be independent was his main reason for working tirelessly day after day in search of ways to earn a living and to support the household where he lives with his parents.

Around five years ago he started making very good quality shoes for all kinds of customers, which allowed him to become well-known in the sector with considerable recognition.  This encourages him to request a loan to build his inventory.  He will buy materials such as soles, glue and tacks, among other things, to satisfy the demand that will increase at year end.  He has the advantage of living in a neighborhood that has an affluence of customers which will help increase his work income.

Estidt claims nothing keeps him from doing what he is passionate about.  So he is always setting new goals, among which is to become a large shoe distributor and generate employment opportunities.  This will improve his quality of life and the well-being of the family and those who help him carry out his daily work.

loans.use: To buy materials such as soles, glue and tacks to stock his business and continue making shoes.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Marissa is a diligent mother who is engaged in buying and selling fruits, vegetables and frozen foods within the local community. She is 37 years old and has three schooling children. She and her husband aim to improve their status of living to give their children a better life. To achieve their goal, she patiently operates her small bicycle roaming around the village to sell her products. She would like to acquire more stock of the said products to sell but she has limited capital. For this reason, she would like to avail herself of a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy more stock of fish, vegetables, fruits and frozen foods to resell. She hopes that she will achieve her requested amount to be able to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish, vegetables, fruits and frozen foods to resell.

location.town: Brgy. Mabasa, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay costs related to his son's university degree.

loans.name: Karen Esmeralda

texts.es: Karen tiene 19 años de edad y habita junto a su compañero de vida, y su abuela de 64 años de edad. Karen es una mujer emprendedora quien se dedica a la elaboración y venta de típicos como: yuca frita, tamales y pasteles de verduras. De esta forma se gana la vida y junto a su compañero de vida quien es albañil mantienen la economía del hogar. Karen solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea reparar el techo de su humilde vivienda ya que se encuentra deteriorado. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada, madera, pines, etc.
texts.en: Karen is 19 years old and she lives with her partner and her grandmother, who is 64 years old. Karen is an enterprising person who makes and sells typical foods, such as: fried cassava, tamales, and vegetable pasteles [similar to empanadas].This is how she earns a living, and along with her partner, who is a bricklayer, they provide for their household. Karen is requesting this loan from FUSAI because she wants to repair the roof of her humble house, which is in a deteriorated state. With the amount requested she will buy galvanized metal roofing sheets, wood, and nails.

loans.use: to repair the roof of her humble house, which is in a deteriorated state. With the amount requested she will buy galvanized metal roofing sheets, wood, and nails.

loans.name: Jorge Esneider

texts.es:
El negocio del aserrío es una actividad muy común entre los habitantes del municipio de Rionegro, pues con ello se ganan la vida y pueden sostener los gastos de sus hogares.

Tal es el caso de Jorge, un hombre trabajador y tenaz que ha decidido dedicar su vida al negocio de aserrío para garantizarle una buena calidad de vida a su familia.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de un lote de arboles en pie para continuar con su labor de aserrador y poder tener un negocio independiente.

Su mayor sueño es poder conseguir su vivienda propia y tener un futuro tranquilo al lado de su familia.
texts.en: Working is the sawmill business is a typical job for the inhabitants of the Rionegro municipality. It is a way for them to earn money and cover household expenses.
