This is the case for Jorge, a hard-working and committed man who has decided to work in the sawmill industry to guarantee a good quality of life for his family. He is requesting a loan to buy an tree lot in order to continue his work as a sawyer and have his own business. His greatest dream is to buy a house and have a peaceful future with his family.

loans.use: to buy a tree lot in order to start his own sawmill business

loans.name: Bibiana Andrea

texts.es:
Bibiana una persona muy dedicada a su trabajo de confección a terceros donde tiene buen volumen de clientes, que la buscan por su calidad de trabajo, su honestidad y su calidad humana que hacen que sus clientes siempre regresen. 
Hoy por Hoy Bibiana tiene una necesidad muy puntual y es comprar una maquina recubridora y una maquina plana para salir de sus pedidos y es que no tiene el capital para comprarlas por esta razón recurre al crédito y se compromete a pagar muy puntual.
Bibiana brinda bienestar a su hija y con la ayuda del crédito podrá emplear personas y empezar a forjar su empresa aspirando a tener un taller pero irá paso a paso y quieren que le ayuden a dar el primero impulsando su proyecto que beneficiara a madres cabeza de familia en busca de empleo.
texts.en:
Bibiana is very dedicated to her work as a seamstress and has many customers who seek her quality of work, integrity and kindness, and always return.

Right now she is in need of an overlock sewing machine and a coverstich sewing macine so she can fill orders.  She does not have the capital to buy them, so is requesting a loan which she is committed to paying back on time.

Bibiana provides a good life for her daughter and with the help of the loan can hire people and strengthen her business and hopefully set up a workshop.  But she will go little by little and hopes you will help her to start a project that will benefit women who are heads of family in search of employment.

loans.use: To buy an overlock sewing machine and a coverstick sewing machine so she can deliver her orders on time and generate employment for women who are heads of family.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet Emelda. She is a 47-year-old smallholder farmer from Igoji, situated in the Eastern province of Kenya. Emelda grew up as the last born in a family of four children that practiced farming for a living. Today, she has four children of her own. She gets support from a loving husband that she has stayed married to for 30 years. They work hand-in-hand to provide for their children. Emelda, specifically, cultivates their 1.5 acre land to grow bananas, vegetables and trees. She also keeps a dairy cow and operates a small quarry.

Emelda is seeking a loan to hire land and purchase farm inputs. With the KES 30,000 loan, she is going to spend KES 10,000 to hire land that she will use to grow additional bananas, KES 15,000 to pay for a truckload of manure and KES 5,000 to pay for seedlings.

She has been farming for nearly three decades. She is going to use your loan investment and the years of experience she has gathered to make this expansion a success.

Money gathered from this investment will enable Emelda to contribute to her family's general expenses, her children's education and her one-year-old's basic and medical needs.

loans.use: to pay for land lease and farm inputs

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 61 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Lilia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like canned goods, snack foods, coffee, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Lilia has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, coffee, detergent soap, shampoo, etc.

Lilia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like canned goods, snack foods, coffee, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Leticia Yoseline

texts.es:
Leticia de 20 años de edad, estudio hasta  9°grado, es madre soltera de dos niñas, una de dos años y la otra de 7 meses, la hija mayor padece de una enfermedad; pero el padre que está en estados unidos les ayuda para los medicamentos, Leticia vive en casa de su madre con un hermano de 8 años de edad que estudia segundo grado.

Leticia no tiene ningún trabajo fijo los ingresos que tiene son los que el padre de sus hijas le envía del extranjero, ella se dedica únicamente al cuido de sus hijas y de su casa y los animales que en ella tiene.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar arena, cemento, hierro, piedras, pago de mano de obra  y demás cosas para construir y mejorar su vivienda.

El sueño de ella es que su hija se cure de la enfermedad que padece, darles una buena vida, que nos les falte la alimentación nunca y poder darles el estudio hasta que lleguen a hacer cada quien su vida.
texts.en: Leticia is 20 years old and left school after ninth grade. She is a single mom to two girls, one of whom is two and the other who is seven months old. Her elder daughter suffers from an illness, although the father, who lives in the United States, helps her pay for the medicines she needs. Leticia lives with her mom and her eight-year-old brother, who is studying second grade. Leticia does not have a steady job, so her income comes from what the father of her daughters sends from the US. She takes care of her daughters, the house, and the animals they have. She is requesting the loan to buy sand, cement, iron, stone, labors costs and so on, to build on and improve her home. She dreams for her daughter be cured from her illness and to be able to give her daughters a good life, where they are never hungry, and can study until they become independent and lead their own lives.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, iron, stone, and to pay labor costs to build and improve her home

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 42-year-old married father of two, a Palestinian refugee who has worked hard as a taxi driver since 2001, to provide his beloved family with the necessary living needs.

His current car which he is working with is rented; thus he wants to save the amount he pays for renting and invest it in buying his own car which will definitely increase his income and develop his family's living.

Ali lives in a Palestinian camp, just like most of the Palestinian refugees living in Lebanon, with limited access to several work domains.

His current acquired Al Majmoua Kiva loan will be invested in buying his own car, which he hopes will meet his expectations.

He hopes that in the future he can buy another car and set it for renting purposes as an additional income business.

loans.use: to buy his own car to improve his business and develop his family's living.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Fe has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items to resell in his perfume store.

loans.name: Magna

texts.es:
Magna tiene 56 años de edad, vive en casa propia, con su cónyuge. Vive en el distrito por más de 4 años, en la parte rural del distrito, contando con servicios de agua y luz. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Dicho distrito es el de Pomahuaca, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Magna brinda el servicio de alquiler de auto a la empresa San Martín de Tours – Pucará, su cónyuge trabaja como chófer en esta empresa; la ruta en la que trabaja el auto es Pucara – Jaén y viceversa, Magna cuenta con más de 5 años dedicándose a esta actividad. El destino del crédito será para invertir en gastos de mantenimiento de auto pues desea asegurar el correcto funcionamiento de su herramienta de trabajo, con ello le generara mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Magna is 56 years old and lives in her own house with her husband. She has been living in the district for over four years, in the rural part, and her home has water and electricity. People in the area work in agriculture, selling livestock and trading. The district is called Pomahuaca, and is in the Jaen Province, in the Cajamarca region, which is in the northern mountains of Peru. 
Magna rents out her automobile to San Martin de Tours- Pucara. and her husband works as a driver for the business. He works the Pucara-Jaen route. Magna has been working in this sector for over five years. She plans to use the loan to pay for servicing the car, as she needs it to be in good working order so that she can generate more income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for servicing her car, as it is essential for her job

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 38 years old and married with four children.

Melanie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

She has borrowed and repaid 27 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Melanie aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Egelen

texts.en:
Egelen is 29 years old and married.

Egelen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

She has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Egelen aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Bridgit

texts.en:
Bridgit is a 30-year-old woman who is married to Raphael, and they are blessed with two children. 

Bridgit earns additional income to support their family by selling clothing. She has been doing this for a period of five years and earns an income of KES 8,000 at the end of every month.

Bridgit was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and she is now servicing her first loan of KES 20,000. She intends to use the entire amount to buy more stock of materials and to rent a clothing business shop.

She plans to use the anticipated income to educate her children, and then to be able to further their education to higher levels.

She hopes to become a successful business woman.

loans.use: To buy more clothing materials and to rent a clothing business shop.

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en: Cecile is 47 years old. She is married with five children aged between 15 and seven years; all of them go to school. She sells clothes and has been doing this business for the past six years. After getting her loan, she would like to buy more clothes for resale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es:
Maricela una mujer que duro 5 años como empleada de un restaurante donde adquirió toda la experiencia y ahorro dinero para montar su propio negocio pues su espíritu emprendedor a si se lo manifestó, hace 3 años tiene su restaurante, muy humilde pero con gran sabor.
Maricela presenta dificultades como todo negocio hace apenas 2 meses se mudó a un local propio lo que fue su gran adquisición y ahora le hace falta capital para trabajar y es por esta razón que solicita un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido de carnes, aceites, granos, verduras, frutas, e implementos de cocina.
Este crédito le permitirá seguir operando ya que por adquirir el local propio se quedó sin recursos pero demuestra las ganas de salir delante de esta mujer de 51 años de edad que es soltera y solo se tiene a ella misma para progresar.
texts.en: Maricela worked as an employee in a restaurant for five years, where she gained a lot of experience and managed to save enough money to start her own business. Her entrepreneurial spirit paid off as she has now been running her own restaurant, which is basic but the food taste very good,  for three years. Maricela's business has struggled like any other, but two months ago they moved to their own premises, which was a huge achievement, and now she needs some capital to be able to get going again. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy meat, oil, grains, vegetables, fruits, and cooking utensils. The loan will help her to keep the doors open, as buying her premises left her with little money, although it shows how much drive this 51 year old single woman, who only has herself to rely on, has to move forward

loans.use: to buy meat, oil, grains, fruits, and vegetables for her business as she has no money left after buying the premises

loans.name: Leidy Yurani

texts.es:
Leidy es una mujer dedicada a su familia y a su labor. 

Su tenacidad y perseverancia le han permitido salir adelante, sobrepasando diversos obstáculos que se le presentan. 

Desde hace 5 años inició su propio negocio, un salón de belleza que ubicó en un espacio de la casa donde reside y, además, también presta el servicio a domicilio, según el requerimiento de sus clientes. 

Esto le ha permitido generar los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar y a solventar las necesidades de su único hijo. 

El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de insumos al por mayor (tratamientos capilares, shampoo, acondicionador, esmaltes para uñas, entre otros), esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y prestar un servicio más completo a sus clientes, de una manera más ágil y eficiente; lo que beneficiará el margen de utilidades que percibe por su labor. 

Leidy manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es poder continuar con su labor, acreditar y fortalecer bien su negocio para lograr ser más competitiva en el mercado y así tener la capacidad para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Leidy is a woman who is committed to her family and her job. Her persistence and perseverance have allowed her to get ahead in life, overcoming several obstacles that she has met along the way. She has had her own business for five years, which is a beauty salon that she runs from home. She also offers a mobile service, depending on what her customers need. This job has helped her generate enough money to be able to support her husband by contributing to the household expenses and to take care of their only son. She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of supplies at wholesale (capillary treatments, shampoo, conditioner, nail polish, and so on). This will allow her to continue working and giving a better service to her customers by being quicker and more efficient, which, in turn, will have a positive effect on profits. Leidy says that her greatest wish is to be able to strengthen her business and become more competitive in the market, so that she can give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as capillary treatments, shampoo, conditioner, nail polish, and so on, in order to offer a better service

loans.name: Yuniah

texts.en:
Yuniah, 26, is a mixed farmer based in Birongo village in the Nyanza province area of Kenya. She been doing farming for only 3 years. She keeps dairy cattle and poultry, and grows tea and food crops.
 
She stated that she enjoys farming because it makes her money to take care of her 4 children. Her main challenge is that farming activities take up too much of her time that she would rather spend with her children.

Yuniah is seeking a KES 15,000 loan to purchase poultry. She sees that the poultry farm she runs at home has plenty of room for expansion. As a result of your lending, Yuniah will get more eggs from the brood of hens she will acquire. This means that she will have more food, more eggs to sell, and more chicks that will later grow for egg production.
 
Income from this investment will help her pay for her children's education. Her dream is to give her family financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a 46-year-old married woman from the Zugdidi district. She has a husband and father-in-law, who gets an age pension from the local government. Marina's husband is disabled and gets an appropriate pension. The borrower is the only person who started her own activity in order to make financial stability for her family members. Marina opened a traditional Georgian bakery and generates some income. Now she needs financial support for expanding her business. In particular, she plans to open a general store in the bakery area and lead these two businesses herself.
 
She requested a loan of 1,000 USD for purchasing all needed products and to have money for working capital. Her application was approved within the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up program gives people a chance to start or re-start businesses.
 
She will be very glad for the help, as her family's living conditions will significantly increase thanks to Kiva lenders. Marina awaits your support.

loans.use: to open general a store and increase her income.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 55 years old and married to Pedro, who is a tricycle driver in their village. Wilma also manages a talipapa (vegetable stall) to gain income. From their income, they are able to meet the needs of their family. 

Wilma wants to add more goods to sell such as squash, eggplant, onions and beans. As she had insufficient funds she is now asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to invest in her business and to buy squash, eggplant, onions and beans to sell. This will help her to make more profit. 

She will save the additional revenue to use for future expenses.

loans.use: to buy squash, eggplant, onions and beans to sell

loans.name: Joelito

texts.en: Joelito is 60 years old and married. He is a farmer who is raising his family in a rural community. He aims to uplift the living status of his family to give his children a better life. Aside from farming, he also engages in a hog-raising business to have additional income. He aims to improve this business to earn a higher income. Having inadequate capital, he would like to avail himself of a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy hog feed, and vitamins and vaccines for his hogs. He is hoping that he will further improve his business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and vitamins and vaccines for his hogs.

location.town: Brgy. San Antonio South, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 55 years. She is a widow blessed with nine children whom she supports.

Susan is a farmer. She has been a farmer for the last seven years, earning a monthly income of Kshs. 10,000.

Susan has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 40,000, which she will use to purchase manure and fertilizers. With the anticipated profits, Susan will be able to educate her children. Her hope and dream for the future is to live a stable life.

loans.use: to purchase manure, fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Yvette

texts.en: Yvette is 26 years old. She is married with two children aged one and six years. One of them goes to school. She sells foodstuffs, and has been doing this business for five years. After getting her loan, she would like to buy more sorghum, beans and potatoes for resale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and improve welfare.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum, beans and potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en: Doreen is a resident of Sanga in Kiruhura District with four biological children and two other dependents,  all in school. She started farming some five years ago but could not yield anything because of the poor methods she was using. That is when she got to know UGAFODE Microfinance and acquired a loan of 1,000,000 UGX, which helped her to start a stall in Sanga town. Because of her hard work she continued to expand. And now she is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to diversify her business. She is grateful for the financial support UGAFODE has accorded her.

loans.use: to buy food items to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 44 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Helen is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Helen has been in pig fattening for 20 years and earns additional income from farming vegetables and running her general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Romela

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Romela works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from rice retailing and pig fattening. Romela is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Romela has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lady Lou

texts.en:
Lady Lou is 26 years old and married with three children.

Lady Lou works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Lady Lou has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and earns additional  income from farming vegetables.

Lady Lou aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Ma. Victoria works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Ma. Victoria is borrowing 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional items for her store, like canned goods, bread, sugar, juice, milk, coffee and detergent soap.

Ma. Victoria has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her store

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy lives in Birongo village located in Nyanza province, Kenya. Birongo village is at the centre of a primary banana and tea growing region. However, most farmers, like Lucy, prefer to keep income-generating animals on their farmland too. Lucy started farming nine years ago. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs and tea. She uses the income from these activities to take care of her family.
 
Lucy is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. With more poultry on her farm, she will produce more eggs for food, hatching and selling. She will also expand her asset base to secure more loans in the future if need be. The immediate impact of this loan to Lucy's family is that she will be able to afford her child's education expenses. She cherishes her daughter. She would do anything to provide her with the best environment for mental and physical growth.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is thankful for the financial assistance that has been granted to her previously as she was able to buy additional stock of different phones accessories. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and her family's personal, house hold and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan for her to buy morel phone accessories like batteries, cases and chargers. The more items displayed at the store, the better, as this will result in higher profits. Her earnings will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and pay for the educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Antonia wants her business to grow bigger so she can give her family a good life. Every week she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more phone accessories like batteries and chargers

loans.name: Hilario

texts.es:
Hilario tiene 51 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 01 hijo dependiente, vive con su conyugue y su hijo en el distrito de Sallique, distrito mediano con aspiraciones a superarse, en dicho distrito la población se dedica a la agricultura siendo el cultivo de arroz siendo este el de mayor producción, así como al comercio en general. Dicho distrito esta ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Hilario se dedica a la carpintería cuenta con un taller propio ubicado en su domicilio, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace más de 15 años, por un buen servicio y experiencia cuenta con bastante clientela fija del distrito y sus caseríos, además el cliente se dedica a la agricultura cuenta con cultivos de pan llevar, tiene muy buenas referencias personales y laborales, solvencia moral y económica. El destino del crédito es para la compra de madera y de herramientas para mejorar su servicio y darle un valor agregado. Invirtiendo en su negocio y poder adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Hilario is 51 years old, has a partner and one dependent child. He lives with his wife and son in the district of Sallique, a medium area district with the desire to improve. In his district the inhabitants work in farming, whether that be growing rice as this is the greatest industry, or small business in general. This district is located in the Jaen province, Cajamarca district, northern highlands of Peru.

Hilario works as a carpenter, he has his own workshop located in his home, he has done this work for more than 15 years, because of his good service and experience he has many regular customers from the district and the surrounding villages. He also works in farming, he has crops of staple produce. He has very good personal and work references, and moral and financial standing. 

The purpose of the loan is to buy wood and tools to improve his service and give a better value added. Investing in his business and being able to get an acceptable profit will enable him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase wood and tools.

loans.name: Mylinda

texts.en:
Mylinda is 37 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. She is borrowing 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell.

Mylinda has been in the livestock business for eight years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Anton

texts.en:
Anton is a 50-year-old man married to Beatrice and blessed with three children. He has been operating a vehicle repairs business for five years, earning an income of 15,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) monthly. His wife earns additional income to support the family. 

Anton was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and is now servicing his first loan of 30,000 KES. He intends to use this amount to buy windscreens and panels to sell to his customers.

Anton plans to use the anticipated income to pay his children's school fees. He hopes to have a bright future with a lot of success, and provide the best quality education to his children.

loans.use: to buy windscreens and panels.

loans.name: Matimtiman

texts.en:
Matimtiman is thankful for the financial assistance she received through her previous loan as she was able to buy more products and expand her business' inventory. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and their personal, household and business expenses.

She would like to apply for another 35,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan to buy more meat products and other frozen goods. The profits will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and pay for the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Matimtiman dreams that her business will continue to flourish. She also desires good health for her family. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional processed and frozen meat products.

loans.name: Tionge Group

texts.en:
Lucy is 48 years old and married to Frank who is 54 years old. She is improving her family's living standards by doing a fish business and is requesting this loan to buy fish in greater quantities to reach more customers in her village. She has seven children and four orphans who go to school and her husband helps her with the daily business operations.

Lucy plans to use any profits generated to buy a fishing boat so that her husband can be fishing himself instead of buying fish from other fishermen. In the future, she wants to diversify her business with a restaurant when she has enough capital. Lucy is able to pay school fees for her children and orphans and she is self-reliant.

loans.use: To buy fish n bulk

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a 23-year-old single lady who is taking care of one child. She has been running a clothing sales shop for a period of three years, earning an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Jackline was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a neighbor and is now servicing her first loan of KES 20,000. She intends to use this loan to buy skirts, dresses, shirts, blouses and blazers to sell to her customers on a daily basis. 

Jackline plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her child and open a cosmetics shop. She hopes to become a successful businesswoman in her home town.

loans.use: To buy skirts, dresses, shirts, blouses, and blazers to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en:
Generosa is 58 years old, married and has four children. One of her children is in school.

Generosa is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Generosa has been raising pigs for 20 years now and has borrowed 28 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Generosa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon is 50 years old and has three children. She cooks and sells dim sum to the people in her village. She patiently became involved in this kind of business to gain income for the family. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy eggs, fish balls, and hot dogs to cook and sell. Though she only gains a minimal income from her business, this will help a little to sustain their needs. She hopes to sell more food to gain more profits.

loans.use: to buy eggs, fish balls, and hot dogs to cook and sell

loans.name: Norlanie

texts.en: Norlanie is 35 years old and married. She owns and manages a small retail store within her village to help her husband gain an income. She aims to make her business profitable in order to earn a higher income and provide the necessities of her family. Due to inadequate capital, she would like to access financial assistance from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 13,000 to buy more frozen foods, grocery items, load wallet and school supplies to resell. She believes that financial assistance will be a great help for her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods, grocery items, load wallet and school supplies to resell

location.town: Brgy. Domang, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase winter coats and stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a modern dairy unit and buy a chaff cutter

loans.name: Maria Aluna

texts.en:
Maria Aluna is 48 years old and married with one child.  

Maria Aluna is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Maria Aluna requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Maria Aluna has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Maria Aluna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Amira

texts.en:
Amira is a 28-year-old married mother of three children. Due to the low financial situation of her husband, she decided four years ago to open her own clothing shop to cover the needs and expenses of her family. 

Today, Amira is acquiring a Youth Loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with more clothes to satisfy her customers' needs.

She hopes to expand her business in the future by buying wedding dresses, which will increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 35 years old and has three children. Josephine is married and all of her children are in school.

Josephine is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock, feed and other supplies for her business.

Josephine has been raising livestock for three years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock, feed and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Horonya Group

texts.fr:
Les huit femmes du groupe Horonya vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Bougouni de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce d’habillement, de condiment, de grains et de bois de chauffage. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  8eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Aby  (la 2eme  femme debout  de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse pagne wax  dans le quartier et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 pièces de pagne wax à Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Aby  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 24 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petites dépenses familiales  et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The eight women in the Horonya group all live in nuclear families. They are, on average, 37 years old and have four children. They all live in Bougouni in Segou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know each other from neighborhood, family, and marriage ties, along with their businesses in the area, where they sell clothing, condiments, grain, and firewood.

In order to increase their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. They are now on their eighth group loan. 

Aby (who is standing second from the right in the photo) is a large seller of wax pagne [bright, colorful fabric] in the area and surrounds. She plans to use her loan to buy three lengths of wax pagne in Segou. Sales are made for cash and often for credit from her home to a mixed group of customers. 

From this loan, Aby hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 24,000 francs CFA, which will be used to support her family's small expenses and to increase her business capital. She would like to continue working with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy wax pagnes [bright, colorful fabric]

loans.name: Félicia

texts.fr: Félicia est une femme veuve qui est mère de 2 enfants. Elle exerce comme activité le commerce de produits d'alimentation générale, elle fait ce commerce depuis plus de 10 ans et maîtrise donc ce commerce. Sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. Elle voudrait agrandir son stock et sollicite donc de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 15 sacs de riz, 20 bidons d'huile et divers produits d'alimentation générale.
texts.en:
Félicia is a widow and a mother of two children. 

She works selling general food products. She has been doing this for over ten years and has a good command of her activity. Her customer base is very diverse.

Félicia wishes to expand her stock, so she is seeking a loan with WAGES to buy 15 sacs of rice, 20 cans of oil, and other various general food products.

loans.use: To buy general food products

loans.name: Seben Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Seben vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 33 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Bougouni de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce d’habillement, de condiment et la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  8eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Kadiatou (la 2eme  femme debout  de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse pagne wax dans le quartier et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 pièces de pagnes wax à Ségou et à Bamako. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit au marché et à la maison à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Kadiatou   espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 40 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petites dépenses familiales  et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The four women in the Seben group all live in nuclear families. They are, on average, 33 years old and have four children. They all live in Bougouni in Segou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know each other from neighborhood, family, and marriage ties, along with their businesses in the area, where they sell clothing, condiments, and prepared food.

In order to increase their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yirwaso. They are now on their eighth group loan. 

Kadiatou (the woman standing second from the left in the photo) is a large seller of wax pagne [bright, colorful, fabric] in the area and surrounds. She plans to use her loan to buy 10 lengths of wax pagnes in Segou and Bamako. 

Sales are made for cash and often for credit in the market and from home to a mixed group of customers.

With this loan, Kadiatou hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA, which will be used to support her family's small expenses and increase her business capital. She wishes to continue collaborating with Soro Yirwaso.

loans.use: to buy wax pagnes [bright, colorful fabric]

loans.name: Siguikafo Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes du groupe Siguikafo vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 33 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Bougouni de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce de calebasse, de condiment et d’habillement. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  2eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Djeneba (la 2eme  femme debout  de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de calebasses dans le quartier et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 colis de calebasse à Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit  au marché et à la maison à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Djeneba  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 30 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petites dépenses familiales  et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The six women in the Siguikafo group all live in nuclear families. They are, on average, 33 years old and have three children. They all live in Bougouni in Segou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  They know each other from neighborhood, family, and marriage ties, along with their businesses in the area, where they sell calabashes, condiments, and clothing.

In order to increase their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their second group loan. 

Djeneba (the woman standing second from the right in the photo) is a large seller of calabashes in the area and surrounds. She plans to use her loan to buy two bunches of calabashes in Segou. Sales are made for cash and often for credit in the market and from home to a mixed group of customers.

Djeneba hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA with this loan, which will be used to support her family's small expenses and to increase her business capital. She wishes to continue collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy calabashes

loans.name: Yiriwa Group

texts.fr:
Les huit femmes du groupe Yiriwa vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Bougouni de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce de restauration, de grains, de condiment et d’habillement. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  2eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Awa  (la 1ere  femme debout  de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse galette a base de sauce dans le quartier et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 sacs de grains de mil à Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Awa    espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 24 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petites dépenses familiales  et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The eight women in the Yiriwa group all live in nuclear families. They are, on average, 34 years old and have four children. They all live in Bougouni in Segou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know each other from neighborhood, family, and marriage ties, along with their businesses in the area, where they sell prepared food, grains, condiments, and clothing.

In order to increase their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their second group loan.

Awa (the first woman standing on the right in the photo) is a large seller of galettes made with sauce in the area and surrounds. She plans to use her loan to buy two sacs of millet in Segou. 

Sales are made for cash and often for credit from her home to a mixed group of customers.

Awa hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 24,000 francs CFA with this loan, which she will use to cover her family's small expenses and increase her business capital. She wishes to continue collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy millet

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes du groupe Danaya vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village Dona Were de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de charbon de bois, de grains d’arachide et la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  1er cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Fatoumata (la 1ere  femme debout  de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de charbon de bois dans le village et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 11 sacs de charbon à Cinzana gara et à Tona. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit au marché et à la maison à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Fatoumata espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 19 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petites dépenses familiales  et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The six women in the Danaya group all live in traditional families. They are, on average, 34 years old and have four children. They all live in the village Dona Were in Segou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know each other from neighborhood, family, and marriage ties, along with their businesses in the area, where they sell charcoal, groundnuts, and prepared food.

In order to increase their business capital, the group members have decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their first group loan.

Fatoumata (the first woman standing on the right in the photo) is a large seller of charcoal in the village and surrounds. She plans to use her loan to buy 11 sacs of charcoal in Cinzana, N'Gara, and Tona. 

Sales are made for cash and often for credit at a market and from home to a mixed group of customers. 

Fatoumata hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 19,000 francs CFA with this loan, which will be used to cover her family's small expenses and to increase her business capital. She wishes to continue collaborating with Soro Yirwaso.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis Alberto tiene 48 años de edad, es casado, vive con su esposa, en casa propia, en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Cayaltí y goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Dicha comunidad está ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Luis Alberto se dedica a la actividad de servicio y mantenimiento de refrigeradoras, desde hace más de 15 años de antiguedad en el negocio, en su propio domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de repuestos para refrigeradoras. De esta manera hacer crecer más su negocio, obtener más ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto is 48 years old and married. He lives with his wife in his own house in a large community in the urban part of Cayaltí. He has good personal and work references from his neighbors. The people of his community work mainly in agriculture, commerce and raising cattle. It is located in Cayaltí district, in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, on the North Coast of Peru.

Luis Alberto works servicing and maintaining refrigerators. He has 15 years experience in this field, working from his house. He is requesting a loan to buy parts for refrigerators. Doing this he will expand his business, get more income and he can improve his quality of living.

loans.use: to buy refrigerator parts to expand his business.

loans.name: Nargiz

texts.ru: Человек с огромным сердцем доброты и прекрасной душой, который живет отдаленном регионе, нуждается вашей поддержки, так как последние время у нее проблемы с финансами. Ее зовут   Наргиз. Ей 31 года, замужем, но не имеет   детей. Климат ее местожительство весьма благополучный для выращивания сельхоз культур, а также для скотоводства. Более  5 лет она занимается скотоводством. У него 2 коровы и  несколько баранов. У нее большой огород, где выращивает сено для скота. Она продает молоко своим соседям и соседи очень довольны от полученного натурального молочного продукта. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  4000 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы развевать бизнес. С полученного  дохода она собирается улучшить условию проживания, а также лечится, чтобы у нее были дети. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: A woman with a huge and kind heart, as well as a beautiful soul, needs your support because she has been experiencing financial difficulties lately.  Her name is Nargiz.  She is 31 years old, married, but with no children.  She lives in a remote area of Tajikistan, where the climate is ideal for the cultivation of crops and for animal husbandry.  Nargiz has been involved in animal husbandry for more than five years.  She owns two cows and a few head of sheep.  She also has a large vegetable garden where she grows hay for her livestock.  She sells milk to her neighbors who are very happy to receive such a natural dairy product.  She is taking a loan of 4,000 somoni to buy livestock and expand her business.  She plans to use her additional earnings to improve her living conditions and to receive the medical treatment that will allow her to have children.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle and increase her working capital.

loans.name: Dora Patricia

texts.es:
Dora es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de su hijo de 7 años que ha tenido que pasar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando con su familia. 

Hace un tiempo montó su venta de huevos, para lo cual tiene una pequeña cantidad de gallinas que le permiten tener muy buenas ventas.

Ella desea impulsar su negocio y mejorar sus ventas, es por esto que busca que un préstamo le permita comprar más gallinas para poder incrementar su capacidad de producción de huevos y así responder a la demanda de sus clientes por los huevos además de realizar adecuaciones a su galpón.

De esta manera sus ventas se incrementarán considerablemente, además de que su negocio resurgirá y podrá salir adelante. 

Además, Dora espera que con mayores ingresos su hijo pueda tener una mejor calidad de vida y el acceso a una mejor educación. 

Dora sueña con tener un gran negocio donde pueda utilizar toda la capacidad que pueda para sacarlo adelante y así ofrecerle a su hijo un futuro económico estable.
texts.en:
Dora is a single mother and the head of family of a 7 year old son. She has had to endure much adversity in her life. However she has had the strength to overcome it and continue to progress with her family.

Some time ago she started selling eggs. She has a small amount of chickens had allow her to have very good sales. She wants to stimulate her business and increase her sales. So she is requesting a loan which will allow her to buy more chickens to increase her production capacity. Then she can respond to the demand from customers and also make some improvements on her shed.

Doing this her sales will increase considerably plus her business will revive and she can get ahead. Also Dora hopes that with more income that her son can enjoy a better quality of living and have access to better education. Dora dreams of having a large business where she can use all her abilities to get ahead and thus offer her son a stable economic future.

loans.use: to buy chickens and adapt her shed.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 40 years old and married with one child. She earns a living by raising cattle in the Philippines. Marilyn is borrowing 29,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional cattle, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Marilyn has been raising cattle for 10 years and also earns additional income from direct selling household products. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional cattle, vitamins and other supplies

loans.name: Maria Marleny

texts.es:
María es una mujer muy trabajadora que dedica gran parte de su tiempo básicamente 12- 15 horas diarias a su negocio de tienda general donde distribuye productos de la canasta familiar y que ahora busca la ayuda de un crédito para mejorar su negocio y la razón es que sus clientes le están pidiendo ciertos productos para mejorar la variedad de su tienda en granos y abarrotes y quiere complacerlos trayendo los más importantes y relevantes para su negocio ya que hoy en día la competencia es muy fuerte y necesita de esa ventas para sobrevivir ya que este negocio representa la única fuente de ingreso para ella quien el por el cuidado de su hijo de 20 años y con mucho orgullo puede decir le puedo brindar educación y quiere seguir diciéndolo por eso necesita tu ayuda para mejorar y traer mejor mercancía que le generen más clientes. 
María fue cliente Kiva y pago exitosamente su ultimo préstamo.
texts.en:
María is a very hard-working woman who spends the greater part of her time, some 12 to 15 hours per day, at her business. It is a general store where she distributes basic food items. Now she is looking for the help of a loan to improve her business.

The reason she wants to do this is that her customers are requesting certain products and she wants to improve the variety of grains and groceries in her store. She wants to please them by adding the most important and relevant to her business as today the competition is very fierce and she needs these sales to survive.

Her business is her only source of income and she has to take care of her 20 year old son. With great pride she can say that she has provided him with his education and wants to continue to do so. So she needs your help to improve and bring more merchandise which will generate more clients. María has been a client of Kiva and successfully paid off her last loan.

loans.use: to buy basic food items for her store like grains and groceries.

loans.name: Vena

texts.en:
Vena is 29 years old and married with three children currently in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Vena runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell, like canned goods, sanitary pads, diapers, fabric conditioners, noodles and biscuits.

Vena has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries for her store

loans.name: Amparo

texts.es:
Amparo, de 36 años, ha optado por montar un negocio de helados cerca a su casa ubicada en el municipio de La Dorada, en este negocio vende todo tipo de helados y mantecados

Amparo trabaja todos los días desde las 6 de la mañana hasta la 6 de la tarde, es una mujer muy responsable, juiciosa y aplicada con su negocio.

Entre sus sueños más latentes esta el poder tener una gran heladería en el que ofrezcan distintos tipos de helados y puede ofrecer empleos.

Ella pide un aliento económico para capitalizar su negocio y comprar mesas, un enfriador y utensilios para la preparación y venta de sus helados.
 
El crédito impactara su vida y su negocio de un modo muy favorable pues podrá cumplir con su sueño y tendrá una mayor variedad de helados para ofrecer a sus clientes, además de que de este negocio dependen sus hijos.
texts.en:
Amparo is 36 years old and has decided to start an ice cream business close to her home in the city of La Dorada.  This business sells all types of ice cream and milk products.  

Amparo works every day from 6am to 6pm and she is a very responsible woman, just and dedicated to her business.

Among her latent dreams is being able to have a larger ice cream store that offers new types of ice creams and that can provide employment. 

She is asking for a loan in order to capitalize her business and to purchase tables, a freezer, and utensils for preparing and selling ice cream.

The loan will impact her life and her business in a very positive way.  It will allow her to fulfill her dream of having a larger variety of ice cream to offer her customers, and it will help her to support her children.

loans.use: to purchase tables, a freezer, and utensils for preparing and selling ice cream.

loans.name: Maria Paula

texts.es:
María Paula tiene 57 años, es soltera, conocida en el medio, por la crianza de ganado lechero. Vive en casa propia con hijo soltero quien trabaja de manera independiente. Persona con buenas referencias. Familia unida. Vive en una comunidad ubicada a 55 kms de chiclayo, habitada por gente amable y respetuosa, que se dedicadan a la agricultura y ganaderia. Dicha comunidad esta ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

María Paula se dedica a la crianza de ganado lechero, pues realiza la venta de leche a sus vecinos de la zona y alrededores de residencia y alrededores, desde hace más de 15 años aproximadamente. Necesita préstamo para invertir en compra de una vaca lechera, la cual le generara más ingreso a su unidad familiar ya que aumentará su stock de animales y su producción de leche.
texts.en:
María Paula is 57 years old and is single.  She is known in the area for raising milking cows.  She lives in her own home with a single son who works on his own.  She has good references and her family is very close.  She lives in a community located 55 kilometers from Chiclayo, and it is inhabited by kind and respectful people.  They mostly work in agriculture and livestock.  This community is located in the district of Cayaltí, in the province of Chiclayo and the region of Lambayeque, on the northern coast of Perú.  

María Paula works raising milking cows and sells the milk to her neighbors in the area and in other communities close by.  She has been working in this area for 15 years.  She needs a loan in order to invest in a milking cow, which will help her generate more income for her family since it will increase her livestock and milk production.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a married woman with two children who are in school. Rosemarie is 35 years old; she is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Rosemarie has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish for selling.

She has been in this business for five years.  In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 43 years old and married with seven children, who she works very hard to provide for. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and various groceries.

Vilma has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for her store

loans.name: Cesar

texts.pt:
O senhor  Cesar  é militar de 44 anos de idade casado pai de  3 filhos  dos quais apenas um a estudar  restante 2  ja nao estudam e vivem com as maes de relacionamentos anteriores  vive na casa do servico.
O valor do empréstimo irá comprar cimento, varoes,  chapas de zinco, barrotes, pranchas, areia para dar continuidade a sua obra.
Tem como projectos e sonhos  terminar a construcao de sua casa mudar se para casa propria, mobilar e continuar a sustentar os estudos de filha e adiquir uma viatura para uso pessoal
Diz que os principais desafios que tem enfrentado sao os financeiros  e que ira solicitar mais emprestimos para concretizar seu plano.
texts.en: Cesar is in the military.  He is 44 years old, married, and has 3 children. One is still in school and the other 2 are not. They live with their mothers who are from previous relationships.  He lives in military housing.  With this loan he will buy cement, metal bars, zinc panels, beams, boards, and sand to continue construction on his house.  His projects and dreams include concluding construction on his home, moving to his own home, furnishing it, continuing to support his daughter's education, and purchasing a vehicle for personal use. The primary challenges he has faced have been financial and he plans to request more loans to put his plans in action.

loans.use: to purchase cement, metal bars, zinc panels, boards and sand.

loans.name: Sabougnouman Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Sabougnouman vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 48 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village Cinzana gare de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de sucre et de savon ; d’habillement et de condiment. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  12eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Korotimi    (la 2eme  femme debout  de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de sucre et de savons dans le village et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 sacs de sucre et 6 cartons de savons à Cinzana gara et à Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit au marché et à la maison à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Korotimi  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 52 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petites dépenses familiales  et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The four women of the Sabougnouman group all live in nuclear families. They average 48 years of age with five children each, and they all live in the village of Cinzana Gare in Ségou (the Republic of Mali's fourth administrative region). They got to know each other as neighbors, through relatives and marriage, and through their income-generating activities in the village. They have small trading businesses selling sugar and soap, clothing and condiments. The group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso in order to expand their businesses and are on their 12th group loan cycle. 

Korotimi (who is standing second from the left in the photo) is a significant seller of sugar and soaps in the village and its surroundings. She is planning to use her loan to buy five sacks of sugar and six cartons of soaps in Cinzana Gare and Ségou. She sells her goods for cash and often on credit at the market and from home to a mixed customer base. 

With this loan Korotimi hopes to make an average monthly profit of 52,000FCFA, which will be used for small family expenses and to expand her business. She would like to continue collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy sugar and soap.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a vulcanizing shop business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

Agnes has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 45-year-old farmer from Kipkaren, a remote village in the Eldoret area of Kenya.  She is elegant, and admirable in spirit and effort. She is a role model, a mentor, and an inspiration to many young farmers in her village because of her resilience despite personal challenges and her passion to support her three angel-like looking children as a primary caregiver. 

For the past six years, she has been involved in mixed farming, and her primary source of income has been growing maize, poultry, tomatoes and also keeping dairy cows. Esther has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. After her husband lost his formal job, the role of primary caregiver of the family fell to Esther. It has been overwhelming because she now has to shoulder the responsibility of feeding the whole family. This challenge has not made her give up. “I have to do something for my family," she said.  

Esther is most passionate about horticulture farming. She takes pride in being a part of the fastest growing agriculture industry category in Kenya. However, she is facing serious challenges brought about by harsh weather conditions. 

Esther is seeking a loan to invest in the expansion of her horticulture farm. She sees a lot of room for improvement and growth. What is lacking is the capital to drive the positive change. With your loan, Esther will make enough income to take care of her family and other farming expenses. She wakes up early and goes to sleep very late every day to give her family a decent living and afford her children proper education. An improved income level will assure her family of a secure future. By joining Juhudi Kilimo, which assists smallholder farmers, she will also benefit from free extension services and links to markets. Esther believes that if female farmers had the same access to resources as men, the number of the world's hungry could be reduced by half.

loans.use: To expand her horticulture farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es una mujer de buenas ideas y de mente creativa, siempre está tratando de buscar actividades para aumentar sus ingresos familiares.

Ella desea montar un negocio de café internet en el municipio de Puerto Boyacá

Ella tiene 35 años y tiene todas las pilas puestas para enfrentar los desafíos que la vida le tenga preparados.

Ella solicita un apoyo económico para comprar algunos elementos como computadores y algunos escritorios para colocarlos. 

Con este dinero podrá invertir en el montaje de su negocio y atraerá clientes, impactando de esta manera sus utilidades de una manera positiva.

Su mayor sueño es tener una gran sala de internet con buenos ingresos y generar empleo.
texts.en:
Nancy is a woman with a creative mind who has good ideas. She is always looking for ways to improve her family's income.
She wants to start an internet cafe in the town of Puerto Boyacá.
She is 35 years old and has what it takes to face life's challenges.
She is requesting economic support to buy some computers and desks to put them on.
With this money, she will set-up her business and attract customers, increasing her profitability. 
Her major dream is to have a big internet room with good income and to generate employment.

loans.use: to buy computers and desks to put them on so she can start her business.

loans.name: Alcinda

texts.pt:
Senhora Alcinda tem 37 anos de idade, casada, mãe de três filhos, dos quais sustenta um frequentando ensino secundário, é criadora de frangos, vive em casa própria com a sua familia.
Com o montante financiado vai comprar racções e vitaminas para alimentar os frangos em criacao.
No futuro pretende concluir a construcao da sua casa, e oficializar o casamento, visto que agora actualmente vive apenas maritalmente.
A insuficiência de fundos torna os seus projectos morosos, assim sendo, pretende liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora de modo a solicitar mais pedidos
texts.en: Alcinda is 37 years old, married, and has 3 children, one of whom she supports and is in secondary school.  She raises chickens.  She lives with her family  in a home she owns.  With the loan she has requested she will purchase animal feed and vitamins for the chickens she is raising.  In the future, she plans to complete construction on her home and formalize her marriage, as she currently only lives with her partner. A lack of funds has delayed her projects, so she plans to pay off her loan without delay in order to request additional loans.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed and vitamins to feed the chickens she is raising.

loans.name: José Armando

texts.es:
José de 41 años de edad, estudio hasta 6°grado. Es casado tiene tres hijos, ya todos adultos dos de ellos trabajan  en un taller de mecánica y la tercera aún está estudiando ya le falta poco para salir de la universidad, la esposa tiene un puesto de venta de tortillas desde hace 4 años. 

José está trabajando como obrero en la iglesia del mismo cantón donde vive, también trabaja de motorista y en la agricultura desde que tenía 17 años, también sabe un poco de la albañilería pues siempre ha trabajado muy duro para que no le falte lo necesario a su familia.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar dos cerdos para engordarlos, este crédito le mejorara la vida pues tendrá un soporte económico más para así seguir ayudando a su familia y dándoles a sus hijos lo que necesiten y a su esposa que no le falte nada.

El sueño de José es ver crecer también a sus nietos,  así como él creció a sus hijos y que pueda vivir siempre feliz junto a su familia mientras Dios les preste vida.
texts.en:
41 year old José studied until the 6th grade. He is married and has 3 children who are all adults. 2 of his children work in a mechanic's workshop and the third is still in school and will soon be going to college. His wife has had a stall where she sells tortillas for 4 years.
José is a workman for the church in the town where he lives. He also works as a driver for agriculture and has been doing this since he was 17. He also knows a little about masonry. He has always worked very hard so that his family have what they need. 
He is requesting a loan to buy two pigs to fatten. This loan will improve his life as he will have more economic support with which to keep helping his family and giving his children what they need and ensuring that his wife lacks nothing. 
José's dream is to see his grandchildren grow as his children did and to be able to live happily with his family as God gives them life.

loans.use: to buy two figs to fatten.

loans.name: Donald Antonio

texts.es: Don Donald es originario de la comarca Las Palmas Teustepe. Es de oficio Agricultor, se dedica a cultivar Maíz, Frijol y Trigo desde ya hace varios años, está casado y tiene 7 hijos los cuales aún están en edad escolar. Sus hijos mayores les ayudan en las siembras que realiza cada cosecha. Don Donald solicita el crédito para comprar un abono para la siembra y terneras para desarrollo. El crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá obtener una buena cosecha en su huerta, también cuando las terneras se desarrollen bien podrá obtener mejores ingresos con la venta de leche. Dentro de los planes futuros de Don Donald están adquirir varias vaquitas lecheras, pero por el momento desea terminar la siembre de su cosecha.
texts.en: Donald is originally from district of Las Palmas Teustepe. He is a farmer and has been growing corn, beans, and wheat for some years. He is married and has 7 children who are all of school age. His older children help him with the crops every harvest. Donald is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for his crops and calves to raise. The loan will be a great help as he will be able to have a good harvest and, also, when the calves are grown he will be able to get good income from the sale of the milk. For the future, he plans to have more milk cows, but for the moment he wants to finish sowing his crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the crops and calves to raise.

loans.name: Morelia Ines

texts.es:
Morelia, a sus 68 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y pujante; pues siempre va en busca de alternativas que le permitan progresar. 

Desde hace muchos años se dedica a trabajar en el campo de la confección, el oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica por medio de la observación y, poco a poco fue perfeccionando su técnica y ampliando sus conocimientos por medio de la práctica, esto la impulsó para iniciar su propio taller, para lo cual adecuó un espacio en la casa donde reside y, con unos ahorros que tenía compró sus primeras máquinas, trabaja sola todos los días, pero en ocasiones recibe el apoyo de una persona, dependiendo de la cantidad de contratos que tenga; así ha logrado generar los recursos suficientes para solventar los gastos del hogar.

El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para el fortalecimiento de su labor, pues con el dinero comprará una máquina fileteadora, con la que podrá agilizar el proceso de producción y adquirir más contratos, generando mayor rentabilidad en el negocio, además comprara telas e insumos.

Morelia manifiesta que su mayor desafío es la competencia en el mercado, sin embargo esto la sigue motivando para seguir prestando un mejor servicio y luchar para que el sueño de la acreditación de su negocio se haga realidad y le permita generar oportunidades de empleo, así mejorará su calidad de vida y la de las personas que influyan en la labor.
texts.en:
Morelia is 68 years old. She is a hardworking woman and driven. She is always looking for alternatives that allow her to progress.  

For several years she has worked in sewing clothing. She learned it empirically from observation and little by little has perfected her technique and expanded her knowledge through practice. This drove her to start her own workshop. She set up a space in the house where she lives, and with some savings she had she bought her first machines. She works alone every day, but at times she has the help of one person, depending on the contracts she has. She has been able to generate enough resources to pay for her household expenses. 

The loan she is asking for is to help fortify her work. With the money she will buy an overlock machine to speed up the production process and acquire more contracts, generating more profit in the business. She will also buy fabric and materials. 

Morelia says that her biggest challenge is the competition in the market. Nonetheless, this still motivates her to keep offering a better service and fight for the dream of her business being accredited becoming a reality. This will allow her to generate employment opportunities. That way, she will improve her quality of life and that of the people who influence her work.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine, fabric and sewing materials.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les sept femmes du groupe Tiessiri vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village Dona were de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce d’habillement ; de charbon et de condiment. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  11eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Djeneba B asse  (la 2eme  femme debout  de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de pagne wax dans le village et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 4 pièces de pagne wax à Cinzana gara et à Tona. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit au marché et à la maison à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Djeneba  B asse  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 25 500 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petites dépenses familiales  et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The seven women in the Tiessiri group all live in traditional families. They are, on average, 39 years old and have four children. They all live in Dona Were in Segou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know each other from neighborhood, family, and marriage ties, along with their businesses in the area, where they sell clothing, charcoal, and condiments.

In order to increase their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their 11th group loan. 

Djeneba Basse (the woman standing second from the left in the photo) is a large seller of wax pagne [bright, colorful fabric] in the village and surrounds.

She plans to use her loan to buy four lengths of wax pagne in Cinzana, N'Gara, and Tona. Sales are made for cash and often for credit at a market and from home to a mixed group of customers.

Djeneba Base hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 25,500 francs CFA with this loan, which will be used to cover her family's small expenses and to  increase her business capital. She wishes to continue collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy wax pagne [bright, colorful cloth]

loans.name: Alice

texts.pt:
Senhora  Alice é casada, tem 5 filhos, todos ainda estudantes, dois dos quais aprendem a arte de mecánica na oficina do marido cita na sua casa.
Com o montante financiado vai comprar cimento, areia para o fabrico de blocos para vender no seu estaleiro.
No futuro espera construir  uma casa grande para sua familia e comprar electrodomesticos, visto que agora ainda vive em condicoes precárias, numa dependéncia antiga.
Não teve condições para estudar para mais além por falta de condições, assim sendo , como grande desafio é de investir na formação profissional dos filhos
texts.en: Alice is married.  She has 5 children who are all in school.  Two of them are studying to be auto mechanics in her husband's garage, which is located at their home.
