In the future, Linda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like eggs, canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, biscuits, candies, etc. to sell

loans.name: Nzadze

texts.en:
Nzadze is married with eight children. She buys bags and polyurethane, packages the charcoal, and sells it to small businesses in the zone.

She needs this loan to buy charcoal for resale because she is increasing her number of customers and needs to increase the amount of charcoal to meet their demands. Her greatest desire is to provide an education for her eight children who attend school so that she can guarantee them a prosperous future.

loans.use: to buy charcoal  for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a 22-year-old single lady, who three years ago established her own mobile phone selling shop in order to cover her beloved family's increasing needs. She is the sole breadwinner for four other members of her family.

Hala is a hardworking lady who puts so much effort in developing her business so that she can reply to her family's increasing living needs.

Due to her family's increasing needs, Hala isn't capable of saving any cash to expand her business, thus for this reason she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with new released mobile phones accessories and prepaid cards.

She is working hard to open another branch in the future so that she can further develop her family's living.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with new released mobile phones accessories and prepaid cards.

loans.name: Benbesigija Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe   BENBESIGIJA  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  31 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FAKOLA, une des sous-préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités à tout moment. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution et compte bien le rembourser.Mme   NABINTOU  2ème personne sur la photo de la droite à la gauche compte acheter avec son prêt 2 colis de condiments. Elle vend à FAKOLA, elle s’approvisionne à GUEYA, FAKOLA et à BAMAKO. Elle vend au comptant et parfois à crédit à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 24 000FCFA.Ce bénéfice va la permettre de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the BENBESIGIJA group are married women who average 31 years of age and four children. They all live in polygamous families in FAKOLA, a sub-prefecture of the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution to sustain their activities whenever the need may arise. This is their second loan cycle with the MFI, and they expect to repay it correctly. 

Mrs. NABINTOU, second from the right in the group photo, plans to use her loan to buy 2 packages of condiments. She buys her stock in GUEYA, FAKOLA and BAMAKO, and she sells for cash, occasionally on credit, to a mixed clientele in Fakola. 

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 24,000FCFA. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy condiments for resale.

loans.name: Nabil

texts.en:
Nabil was born in 1952. He is the sole provider for his family. 

Nabil has been sculpting stone and carving drawings, such as Petra drawings in stone, for 12 years now. He also makes building entrance decorations by carving directly on the wall. 

While his business has been profitable, he nonetheless cannot work in several areas because he does not have his own vehicle. 

Now Nabil needs to buy a stone cutter and other tools for stone carving. But because he faces financial difficulties that prevent him from buying the tools he needs, Nabil has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy tools for stone carving.

loans.name: Jose Benigno

texts.es: Jose de 61 años de edad se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras su negocio está ubicado en el mercado municipal desde hace 15 años, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas frutas y verduras por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y así poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose is 61 years old and has been selling fruits and vegetables from his stand in the town market for 15 years. 

With the income from his business he can cover some of the expenses that arise in his household. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more fruit and vegetables in bulk, to continue his sales and thus offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Maria Betty

texts.en:
Maria Betty is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  Maria Betty is 42 years old and has three children who are in school.

Maria Betty has a beauty salon business in the Philippines and requested a 7,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more beauty products for her beauty salon business.  She has been in this business for 4 years.

In the future, Maria Betty would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products for her beauty salon

loans.name: Suheil

texts.en:
Suheil is an ambitious twenty-year-old young man living with his family of seven in Irbid, Jordan. 

He is a university student majoring in Economics, and he is only just in the middle of his journey. Suheil is seeking to work in his field after getting his Bachelor’s Degree. 

Now Suheil is applying for a loan to be able to fund his upcoming semester's tuition fees, which he is unable to pay because of the financial crisis his family has been facing.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester's tuition.

loans.name: Ameera

texts.en: Ameera is a 33-year-old married mother of five sons and daughters. Her husband works at a governmental entity in the morning and works at a mall in the evenings. But her family has been facing a financial crisis during this period. Ameera wants to register one of her children at school to provide them with the best education. But not having enough money for that has pushed her to apply for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her child's school fees

loans.name: Jigisseme Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe   JIGISSEME  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  35 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FAKOLA, une des sous-préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités à tout moment. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution et compte bien le rembourser.Mme   MAMOU    2ème personne sur la photo de la droite à la gauche compte acheter avec son prêt 5 colis de condiments. Elle vend à FAKOLA. Elle s’approvisionne à GUEYA, FAKOLA et à BAMAKO. Elle vend au comptant et parfois à crédit à une clientèle mixte.Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000FCFA.Ce bénéfice va la permettre de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the JIGISSEME group are married women who average 35 years of age and three children. They all live in polygamous families in FAKOLA, a sub-prefecture of the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution to sustain their activities whenever the need may arise. This is their second loan cycle with the MFI, and they expect to repay it correctly. 

Mrs. MAMOU, second from the right in the group photo, plans to use her loan to buy 5 packages of condiments. She buys her stock in GUEYA, FAKOLA and BAMAKO, and she sells for cash, occasionally on credit, to a mixed clientele in Fakola. 

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 40,000FCFA. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy condiments for resale.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses, 65, is married to Ann, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with two children.  

Moses has been a landlord for six years, renting houses and earning an income of 15,000 Kenyan shillings at the end of each month.

He was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer. He is now servicing his first loan, of KES 30,000, and intends to use this amount to buy cement, nails, timber and iron sheets to build additional rental houses. 

Moses plans to use the anticipated income to buy an additional plot to build guest or lodging houses in his hometown and hopes to become a successful business man with a bright future.

loans.use: To buy cement, nails, timber and iron sheets to build rental houses.

loans.name: Grigor

texts.en:
Grigor lives with his nice family in Yerevan city. He is 48 years old and already the father of two clever boys. Grigor worked at the Tax Inspectorate for many years. Now he works as a manager at a private company. His wife does not work. Their elder son now studies at the Yerevan State Economical University at the paid faculty of Accountancy and Audit. Grigor’s son studies at the distance learning division. Grigor now is very worried about the tuition fee of his son, since it is time to pay but financial hardships do not allow him to do it on time.

He asks for a loan in the amount of 400,000 Armenian drams to pay his son’s tuition fee.

loans.use: to pay his son’s tuition fee

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 22 years old. She is married and has one child. She works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 6000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell, such as beverages, shampoo and canned goods.

Marilyn has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, such as beverages, shampoo and canned goods

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa is 55 years old and lives with her family in Yerevan city in Armenia. 

Larisa has a higher education degree with a specialty in engineering. For many years Larisa worked at the Research Institute as an engineer. She is currently working at the hospital as an administrator. 

Larisa is married, and she has a daughter. Both Larisa's husband and daughter are also employed. 

Larisa greatly needs this loan since she must undergo very urgent surgery. She is requesting a loan of 500,000 AMD in order to pay for the surgery, which her doctor recommends she have as soon as possible.

loans.use: to pay for the surgery which her doctor recommends she urgently undergo.

loans.name: Mercy Molina

texts.en:
Mercy Molina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 13,500 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy more materials for her business.

Mercy Molina has been in this business for 24 years and earns additional income from fish vending.

She has sustained her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Watheq

texts.en: Watheq is a 23-year-old university student majoring in Islamic Studies, and he is in his third year. He is seeking to work in his study field after graduating to be able to depend on himself. He is now applying for this education loan to pay for his upcoming semester fees which he didn’t have enough money to pay for because of the financial problems his family has been facing.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Haxhirete

texts.en:
Haxhirete is seeking your financial help to invest in beehives. Husbandry of bees and honey production are her activities, and they have been worthwhile so far. Haxhirete has 50 beehives and wants to add some more, since honey and bee milk are very much in demand in Albania. She also owns a grapevine and makes wine, most of which she sells. 

Haxhirete is 47 years old and a married mother of two children, 23 and 12 years old. She had surgery some years ago, and one of her kidneys was removed. Since then, she’s been living with only one. Despite this, she continues to labor in her activities of bees and homemade wine. 

Kindly note, it was impossible to take a photograph of Haxhirete near the beehives, since she has located them up on a mountain.

loans.use: to add some more beehives to her existing hives

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, skirts, shirts, socks, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
El socio Santiago continua dedicándose a la agricultura y ganadería, el socio  cultiva trigo,  papa, tubérculos, entre otros, él socio lleva años dedicándose  a esta actividad el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de eta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de abono y semillas.
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “Apu Asangani” 
El socio agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
The member Santiago continues working in agriculture and livestock. The member grows wheat, potatoes, and tubers, among other things. He has spent years doing this work, which has been going well thanks to the determination he puts into his business everyday. He wants to be able to continue working so that he can continue supporting his family.

The member requests the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds.

He belongs to the community bank “Apu Asangani.” He is thankful for and values the loan, and he promises to comply with the monthly repayments responsibly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Valentin

texts.es:
El socio Valentín continua dedicándose a  cultivar y sembrar diferentes productos como  papa, cebada, trigo, habas y otras cosas más, él socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “Apu Asangani”.
El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes entre otros.
El socio  agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
The member Valentin continues growing and harvesting different products, including potatoes, barley, wheat, broad beans, and other things. He spends a lot of time on his business, which has gone well thanks to the determination that he puts into his business everyday. He feels that in this way, he can take his family forward.

He belongs to the “Anu Asangani” community bank. He requests the loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other things. 

He is thankful for and values the loan, and he promises to comply with the monthly repayments responsibly.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other things.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is 42 years old and married with three children. With one child still in school, Rhoda works very hard to provide for her family. 

Rhoda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy snack foods, soft drinks, canned goods, cooking oil, noodles, sanitary pads,and other items to sell.

Rhoda has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, soft drinks, canned goods, cooking oil, noodles, and sanitary pads.

In the future, Rhoda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, soft drinks, canned goods, cooking oil, noodles, sanitary pads,and other items to sell.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is 37 years old and married with two children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for her family. 

Florita runs a cellphone accessories store in the Philippines and requested a 7000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional inventory to sell. 

Florita has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future, Florita would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional cellphone accessories to sell

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Meet Lawrence, a smallholder farmer from Kiringa village, which is found in the Eastern Province of Kenya. Lawrence is a husband to Anita. The couple has stayed together for 10 years, and their union has been crowned with 2 children, both boys: the younger is 6 years old and the older is 11 years old.

2005 was the year Lawrence started farming on a 3-acre piece of land he owns. The land is fertile and close to a river from where he fetches water. On the farm he grows bananas, and he also keeps 3 dairy cattle, poultry and a pig. He has also grown 100 trees on the farm because he believes such initiatives have a real impact on climate change.

Lawrence is seeking a Kiva loan to purchase farm supplies for an agrovet business he is running. He will use the loan investment to restock the business. He is an astute businessman whose primary focus is on the nature of the product that he offers to the market. 

He plans to repay the loan for the first few months using income from other sources as the sales of the farm supplies in the agrovet business picks up. Lawrence hopes the investment will increase his income that he will use to meet basic family expenses and education fees for his children, who are both in boarding schools.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Maribel is 40 years old and has two children who are in school.

Maribel has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She requested a 45,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials like fabric, threads, buttons, zippers, etc., for her business.

Maribel has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Maribel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials like fabric, threads, buttons, zippers, etc., for her business

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 60 years old, married, and has 5 children. 

Elisa is in the agriculture business in the Philippines and is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation so she can buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been rearing pigs for 5 years now. In order to sustain her business, Elisa has already borrowed and successfully repaid 8 loans from NWTF.

In the future, Elisa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Entisar

texts.en: Entisar is a 46-year-old married woman and the mother of four. She has always wanted to provide her children with the best education. Her 20-year-old daughter is a university student majoring in special education, and she is in her third year. She is seeking to pass her Bachelor's so that she will experience work life. But because of the financial crisis her family has been facing, she couldn’t pay for her upcoming semester fees. For that, Entisar wants to help her by applying for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her daughters' upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and has seven children, who all attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Fatuma operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood operators.
 
She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With this loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is a 33-year-old married mother of three who has been working in a beauty business for ten years. Manal has a specialized beauty clinic where she provides her customers with necessary laser, Botox and facial filling to reveal women's beauty in a special way.

Manal is a hardworking woman with a very good reputation in her region. She is working hard on developing her business through updating her business machines and tools, but since her family's needs are increasing, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to buy necessary laser spare parts for her existing machine to improve her business.

She hopes that in the future she can open another branch and expand her working region.

loans.use: to buy necessary laser spare parts for her existing machine to improve her business

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
Mahbuba is a 42-year-old married mother. She is a very enterprising woman. She constantly struggles to raise her 3 children, who are the motor of her life. 

For more than 4 years, she has had a clothing sewing business. Mahbuba sews national and European style clothes. She has repeated clients, thanks to her good and hard work. She always tries to offer good quality of life to her children.  

She dreams of seeing her children as highly qualified specialists. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni to buy a computer for her children. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy a computer for her children.

loans.name: Teolinda

texts.es:
Teolinda tiene 48 años de edad, su estado civil es casada, tiene 5 hijos mayores de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su cónyuge en el distrito de La Matanza. La vida en el distrito se desarrolla tranquilamente, la actividad que desarrollan sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería y crianza de animales. Dicho distrito está ubicado en la provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Teolinda es la venta de chicha de jora, almuerzo y cerveza. La actividad la realiza desde hace más de 15 años, en el sector Carrasco - La Matanza. El destino del crédito será para invertir en su negocio comprando mayores cantidades de jora y materia prima para la elaboración de más almuerzos y asi satisfacer toda la demanda que existe en su comunidad. El mercado presenta buenas perspectivas debido a que el producto es muy comercial en la zona. Piensa trabajar otorgando buen producto a sus clientes e incrementando sus ventas.
texts.en:
Teolinda is 48 years old, is married, has 5 adult children, and lives in her own house with her husband in the district of La Matanza. Life in the district is peaceful. Its residents work in agriculture, livestock, and raising animals. This district is located in the province of Morropón in the region of Piura on the northern coast of Perú.

Teolinda sells corn beer, lunch, and beer. She has been doing this for more than 15 years in the area of Carrasco in La Matanza. The loan will be invested in her business by buying more corn and raw materials to make more lunches, thus satisfying all of the demand that exists in her community. The market gives good perspectives since the product is very popular in the area. She plans to work giving good product to her clients and increasing her sales.

loans.use: to invest in her business by buying more corn and raw materials for making more lunches.

loans.name: Alia

texts.en: Alia is a conservative lady, so she asked her son to take her place in the picture. She is a 47-year-old married woman living in Zarqa-Jordan with her family, which consists of seven members. Her husband is a retired man. Her son Hamzeh, who appears in the photo, has started his study journey at the university. He is majoring in Computer Information Systems, and he is in his first year. Her son is seeking to continue his studies until he gets his masters. But because he currently doesn’t have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees, Alia wants to help him by applying for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her son's semester fees.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Vilma is 53 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Vilma has a general store business in the Philippines. Vilma requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Vilma has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marilou is 48 years old and has two children who are in school.

Marilou has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 6,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stock of fruit to sell.

Marilou has been in this business for 2 years.  In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of fruit to sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Judith is 29 years old and has two children who are in school.

Judith has a general store business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, cigarettes, shampoo.

Judith has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Judith would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, cigarettes, shampoo.

loans.name: Reema

texts.en:
Because Reema is a conservative woman, she asked her son to take her place in the picture. Reema is a 44-year-old married woman living with her family that consists of five members. Her husband is a retired man. Her son Saddam and her daughter Rawan are university students. 

Rawan is in the middle of her studies, while Saddam is in his last year.  Both of them are seeking to work in their study field after getting their Bachelors’. But because of the financial problems Reemas’ family has been facing recently, she doesn’t have enough money to pay for their upcoming semester fees. 

For that, Reema wants to help them by applying for this loan.

loans.use: To pay the upcoming semester fees for her son and daughter.

loans.name: Al Amal 4 Group

texts.en:
Ehsan is the featured borrower for Al Amal 4 Group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Ehsan is a 44-year-old widowed mother of four children who began selling clothes from her home a year ago, as she has eleven years of business experience in this field. She is trying hard to satisfy the needs of her beloved children for she is the sole earner of her family, thus today she is acquiring Al Majmoua Loan to increase her business merchandise with more fashionable clothes to attract more customers and increase her income.

With respect to the other group members, Nassima is a 31-year-old married woman who sells cell phones and wants to increase her business merchandise with new phones, while Darine is a 33-year-old married mother of one child who gives private lessons and wants to renovate her house. 

Ehsan is the woman standing in the middle, Nassima is the first lady on the left of the photo, and Darine is the first lady standing on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with more fashionable clothes.

loans.name: Youssera

texts.en:
Youssera is a 58-year-old married mother of three children who started twenty years ago preparing and selling "Mouneh" from her house to help her husband who has limited salary to cover the needs and expenses of their beloved children. 

Today, Youssera is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise by buying necessary ingredients to prepare new kinds of preservatives. She hopes to expand her business more in the future and attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy necessary ingredients to prepare new kinds of preservatives.

loans.name: Jayakutaki

texts.es:
Jayakutaki tiene 18 años de edad. Reside en el distrito de Buenos Aires, junto su esposa en casa de su madre, natural de la zona. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila y se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería, ademas del comercio. Su distrito está ubicado en la provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad a la que se dedica Jayakutaki es al servicio de mototaxi, en toda la zona de Buenos Aires, además de manejar un carro de carga de Guayaquil. Actividad que realiza desde hace más de 2 años en la misma actividad. Conocido en la zona, con muy buenas referencias en la zona. Destino del crédito será para la bajada de motor de su mototaxi y compra de carpas. Lo que asegurará el correcto funcionamiento de su herramienta de trabajo y asi poder seguir generando ingresos para su unidad familiar.
texts.en:
Jayakutaki is 18 years old. He and his wife live his mother’s house in Buenos Aires district, where his mother was born. Life is calm in this community where the people are farmers, raise livestock, or have small shops. His district is located in Morropón province, Piura region, on the north coast of Peru. 

Jayakutaki makes his living working as a motorcycle taxi all around the Buenos Aires district. He also drives a freight car to and from Guayaquil. He has been doing this job for over two years. 

Jayakutaki is well-known in the area, and has very good references in his district. He is asking for this credit to take the motor out of his motorcycle taxi and to buy tarps. This will allow him to ensure that the equipment he needs to do his work is functioning properly, so he can continue to generate income for his household.

loans.use: to take the motor out of his motorcycle taxi and to buy tarps, so he can ensure that the tools of his trade are functioning properly.

loans.name: Tenin

texts.fr: Mme TENIN est née en AVRIL 1974 à MARKALA, cercle de SEGOU, une des préfectures de la 4ème Région administrative du Mali .Mme TENIN est âgée de 40 ans; Mme TENIN réside à FAKOLA dans une famille traditionnelle. Mme TENIN s’est vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat et vente d’habits pour enfants, pagnes wax et de chaussures. Sa vente se fait à FAKOLA. Forte de  ses 18 années d’expérience dans le domaine, elle collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso pour augmenter  son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir et est à son  neuvième prêt. Mme TENIN compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 douzaines d’habits pour enfants, 10 pagnes wax et 15 paires de chaussures. EIle s’approvisionne à FAKOLA  et à BAMAKO, elle effectue ses ventes au comptant  et parfois à crédit à une clientèle mixte. Mme TENIN espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Mrs. Tenin was born in April 1974 in Markala, Segou circle (one of the prefectures of Mali’s fourth administrative region). She is forty years old and lives in Fakola, in a traditional family.

From a young age, Mrs. Tenin has been interested in business, especially the retail of children’s clothing, a local type of apparel called “wax,” and shoes. She sells in Fakola. Drawing on the strength of her 18 years of experience in her domain, she is collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso to increase her working capital and meet the demand from her ever-growing clientele. This is her ninth loan. With it, she will purchase twenty dozen children costumes, ten wax dresses, and fifteen pairs of shoes. She procures her products in Fakola and Bamako. She accepts cash and occasionally extends credit to her mixed-gender clientele.

Mrs. Tenin hopes to make a monthly profit of 75,000 XOF. It will be used to provide for her family, pay back the loan, and reinvest in her activities.

loans.use: to buy children’s clothing, Wax-style apparel, and shoes

loans.name: Tharwat

texts.en:
Tharwat is a 23-year-old single lady living with her family that consists of four members in Mafraq, Jordan. She is a university student majoring in Managerial Information Systems, and she is in her third year. Her father is a retired man. 

Tharwat is aiming to get her Bachelors’ so that she can experience work life. But because she doesn’t have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo works hard to support her family. Amparo is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Amparo requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Amparo has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Amparo would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 12 years now.

Virginia requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell to her customers.

In the future, Virginia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Maisaa

texts.en:
Maisaa is a 19-year-old single lady living with her family in Zarqa, Jordan. She is a university student majoring in Arabic Language, and she is in her second year. 

Maisaa is seeking to continue her studies till she gets her Bachelor's, but because of a financial crisis her family has been facing, she doesn’t have enough money to pay her upcoming semester fees. For that reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Renaldo

texts.en:
Renaldo is a 24-year-old single hard-working man who lives in the city of Korca; he loves his parents and he helps them financially all the time, according to him. He has been operating a little shop for over three years now where he has been stitching upholstery for almost all types of vehicles. His clientele are residents of his city. 

Renaldo is requesting this loan to buy leather and other materials for his activity and he hopes that he will get some understanding from you. The amount he is requesting is 100,000 Albanian Lek.  

Renaldo has been photographed in his shop.

loans.use: to buy leather and other materials needed in his vehicle upholstery shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy millet, milk and sugar needed to prepare degué to sell.

loans.name: Yama

texts.fr: Mme YAMA est née en Septembre 1987 à KADIANA, une des sous-préfectures de la 3ème Région administrative du Mali .Mme YAMA est âgée de 27 ans; Mme YAMA réside à FAKOLA dans une famille nucléaire. Mme YAMA s’est vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat et vente de poissons. Sa vente se fait à FAKOLA. Forte de  ses 3 années d’expérience dans le domaine, elle collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso pour augmenter  son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir et est à son  cinquième prêt. Mme YAMA compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 25 cartons de poissons. EIle s’approvisionne à BAMAKO, elle effectue ses ventes au comptant. Mme YAMA espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yama was born in September 1987 in Kadiana, one of the sub-prefectures of Mali’s third administrative region. She is twenty-seven years old and lives in Fakola, in a nuclear family.

Mrs. Yama has long been interested in business, especially the fish business. She sells in Fakola. She benefits from three years of experience in this domain. She is collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso to increase her working capital and meet the demand from her ever-growing clientele. This is her fifth loan. With it, she will purchase twenty-five boxes of fish. She procures her products in Bamako. Her business is cash-operated.

Mrs. Yama hopes to make a monthly profit of 100,000 XOF. It will be used to provide for her family, pay back the loan, and reinvest in her activities.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en:
Hanifa is a 60-year-old woman. She is married and her husband doesn’t work anywhere. She has an adult son who is married and has some children. 

Hanifa is a very enterprising woman. For more than 10 years, she has worked as a saleswoman of dried fruits. Her honesty, responsibility and punctuality have been the reasons for her job promotion, and she believes she is doing well because she always gives the best of herself. 

Hanifa is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because with their support she will be able to make improvements to her house, such as painting the walls and finishing repairing it. In this way, she and her family will have a better quality of life. She is asking for a loan of 7,500 Somoni to buy paint, wall-paper and etc. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy building materials to repair her house.

loans.name: Melissa Yomayra

texts.es:
En la pila de Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido por su rica cultura tradicional, se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía elaboradas por sus habitantes.
En este lugar vive la señora Melissa, tiene 21 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 8 meses  de edad. Su esposo es artesano.
Doña Melissa y su esposo tienen un taller de artesanía, allí ellos fabrican  todo tipo de figuras las mismas que elaboran  en barro o en cerámica, trabajan todos los días ya que la demanda de sus productos es muy grande, ellos entregan sus productos semiterminados y acabados a comerciantes de su localidad y también venden al publico ya que tiene un local. Llevan más de 5 años dedicados a esta labor con la cual salen adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar cerámicas y pinturas para elaborar sus productos. Lleva 2 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan en el grupo. Sus sueños es darle lo mejor a su pequeño.
texts.en:
The Grupo de Crédito para el Futuro de la Mujer meets in the La Pila area of Montecristi twice a month. This place is known for its rich traditional culture where a great variety of handicrafts made by local people can be found. Melissa lives here. She is 21 years old, has a lifetime partner, and from this relationship they have an eight month old son. Her husband is an artist.

Melissa and her husband have an artist workshop. There they make all types of clay or ceramic figures. They work every day as the demand for their products is quite large. They deliver their products finished and semi-finished to dealers in their area and they also sell to the public as they have their facility. They have been doing this work for more than five years and have been getting ahead.

This loan is to buy ceramics and paints in order to create her products. This is her second cycle with the Grupo de Crédito and she likes the support they give the group. Her dream is to provide the best for her little one.

loans.use: to buy ceramics and paints

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 36 years old and married with six children; four of her children are in school. Arlene works very hard to provide for them.

Arlene runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, etc.

Arlene has been in this business for a year. 

In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo and canned goods.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 34 years old and married with two children, both of them are in school.  

Victoria is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Victoria requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Victoria has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Victoria would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Cindy

texts.en:
Cindy is single and has a direct selling Avon products business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years now.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more products from Avon to sell to her customers. In the future, Cindy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more products from Avon to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Fedaa

texts.en:
Fedaa is a 26-year-old married lady living with her family that consists of six members. Her husband works in construction. Because her husband’s income wasn’t enough to cover his children's needs, Fedaa started her own business two years ago selling curtains. She also started selling blankets recently for the upcoming winter season. 

Now she needs to expand her business so that she will gain better profit, and she wants to open her own store in the future. Fedaa currently needs to buy more blankets and curtains. But because she doesn’t have enough money to buy them, she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy more blankets and curtains for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more products for his kiosk such as hot drinks and snacks.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Bernadeth works hard to support her family.

She has a business doing direct selling of Avon products in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Bernadeth is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of Avon products like lipsticks, deodorant, body spray, etc. to sell.

Bernadeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of Avon products like lipsticks, deodorant, body spray to sell.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz is a 39-year-old married woman. She has 5 children. She has been running a business alongside her husband for many years, purchasing and selling cattle. She looks after the cattle and is responsible for feeding them, while her husband sells to different markets in the city. Their business is providing them with enough income to support their family. 

However, they need to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, health and clothing. In order to expand their earnings, Mumtaz has requested a loan amount of 45,000 PKR to buy cattle for resale purposes. That will help in improving her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy cattle for resale purposes that will help in improving her family’s living standards.

loans.name: Alema

texts.en:
Alema is a 47-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband and son in Maynaguri, in the district of Jalpaiguri. Her son studied up to grade 8 and now is engaged with a small business. Alema’s husband's name is Samsul. He is a farmer by occupation. Alema is illiterate, and only can sign her name. 

Alema is a hardworking and very confident woman. She wants to help her family financially. She wants to start tea cultivation on their land.  She will sell the tea leaves in the different tea factories. This is a very demanding and profitable business.

Alema is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy fertilizers and tea saplings for farming. She says this will help her to strengthen the business and fulfill client demands. This business will supply an additional profit, with which Alema wants to achieve her goals.  She wants to give financial security to her family and provide better education to her son.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, tea saplings and other agricultural inputs to cultivate tea plants.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BENKADI ont en moyenne 32 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à LAFIABOUGOU l’un des quartiers de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers et des habits.  Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur 2ème prêt solidaire. KAMISSA, 1ère femme de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 15Kgs de farine de blé, 10Kgs de sucre, 10Litres d’huile, 1carton de savon, 1 paquet de Bic et 1 paquet de Cube Maggi. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 12 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of BENKADI group are on average 32 years old with five children. They all live in large traditional families in LAFIABOUGOU, one of the SAN/SEGOU neighborhood (in the Republic of Mali’s fourth administrative region). These women met through family ties. They retail various products, notably clothing. After paying back their previous loan, this is their second solidarity loan.

KAMISSA, the first woman from the left to the right on the photo, intends on using her loan to purchase 15 kilos of flour, 10 kilos of sugar, 10 liters of oil, 1 box of soap, 1 pack of ballpoint pens, and 1 box of bouillon cubes. She procures her supplies from local wholesalers. She retails to a mixed-gender clientele. She accepts cash, and also often extends payment facilities.

She is forecasting an average monthly profit of 12,000 XOF, which will be used for expenses related to healthcare, food, clothing, and schooling. The remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase various products.

loans.name: Confiance Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe CONFIANCE ont en moyenne 41ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à KARANTELA l’un des quartiers de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers et des condiments. Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe CONFIANCE sont à leur 9èmeprêt solidaire. RAMATA, 1ère femme debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 paires de colliers en caoutchouc, 15 paires de chaussure en plastique, 2 pièces de Wax réal et une douzaine de bracelet. Elle s’approvisionne sus place chez les grossistes.Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 12 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of CONFIANCE (trust) group are on average 41 years old with three children. They all live in large traditional families in KARANTELA, one of the SAN/SEGOU neighborhood (in the Republic of Mali’s fourth administrative region). These women met through family ties. They retail various products, notably food products. After paying back their previous loans, this is their ninth solidarity loan.

RAMATA, the first woman from the left to the right on the photo, intends on using her loan to purchase 10 pairs of rubber necklaces, 15 pairs of plastic shoes, 2 coupons of Wax réal (a high-quality local fabric) and a dozen bracelets. She procures her supplies from local wholesalers. She retails to a mixed-gender clientele. She takes cash, and also often extends payment facilities.

She is forecasting an average monthly profit of 12,000 XOF, which will be used for expenses related to healthcare, food, clothing, and schooling. The remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy various articles

loans.name: Darlyn

texts.en:
Darlyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Darlyn is 46 years old and has one child who is still in school.

She has a cake baking business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 10 years.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like eggs, flour, etc. for her business.

Darlyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like eggs, flour, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Manuma

texts.en:
25-year-old Manuma lives in Altagram in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is a very young married woman with two children (one boy and one girl). One attends school in grade 2, and the other is too young for school. Manuma studied up to ninth grade and after that could not continue as her family could not afford the fees.  Now she is a housewife.

Manuma's husband, 26-year-old Hapej, is a farmer. He has been practicing farming for many years. He is motivated to give financial sustenance to his family. So he works tirelessly for the attainment of his goal. The land he works on is fertile enough to cultivate vegetables and paddy rice. His income is generated from the sale of crops like paddy, potatoes, beans, and gourds, but now he wants to concentrate on paddy cultivation. He is pleased with the produce of his farm because it brings in good returns. What challenges him is lack of sufficient money to carry out farming activities. He wants some financial assistance.

Manuma wants to help her husband by taking a loan. She chose Kiva’s partner, BJS, to fund her because they offer good training to farmers before giving out the loans, and also, their loans have a lower interest rate. Manuma said this loan will help her to purchase agricultural materials such as seeds, manure, pest control, etc. for paddy cultivation and thus, increase her income. This will improve her family's living standards. With the profit she intends to purchase a motorbike.

Manuma wants to thank BJS and Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en:
Riffat is 39 years of age. Her great skill in hand embroidery, with experience of 4 years in this field, has given her a very good reputation in her community. 

Over time, the demand for her hand embroidered cloth has grown, and she uses the income generated to pay for the expenses of her 6 children. 

Riffat is in her 3rd loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She has now requested a loan of 40,000 PKR which she will use to purchase more spools of threads, measuring tape, embroidery scissors, frames and tracing paper. 

She hopes that her skill will help in covering her family’s health expenses.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, measuring tape, embroidery scissors, frames and tracing paper.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new collection of clothes for the upcoming season

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 51-year-old married mother of five children. Due to her husband's low income, 11 years ago she started working in agriculture to help provide for the needs of her children.

Today, Salma is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renovate the shops she owns in order to rent them as a second source of income. She will save some profit for her children's future and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate the shops she owns

loans.name: Fotemogoban Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe FOTEMOGOBAN ont en moyenne 49 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à LAFIABOUGOU l’un des quartiers de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers, des céréales et des condiments. Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe FOTEMOGOBAN  sont à leur 7ème prêt solidaire. SENE, 1ère femme de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 4 paquets de cahiers, 1 paquet de Bic, 20Kgs de sucre, 5Litres d’huile, 1 carton de savon, 10 paquets de bonbon, 5 paquets de biscuit et 1 boîte de craie. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of FOTEMOGOBAN group are on average 49 years old with five children. They all live in large traditional families in LAFIABOUGOU, one of the SAN/SEGOU neighborhood (in the Republic of Mali’s fourth administrative region). These women met through family ties. They retail various products, notably cereals and other food products. After paying back their previous loans, this is their seventh solidarity loan.

SENE, the first woman from the left to the right on the photo, intends on using her loan to purchase 4 packages of notebooks, one box of ballpoint pens, twenty kilos of sugar, five liters of oil, one box of soap, ten bags of candy, five boxes of cookies, and one box of writing chalk. She procures her supplies from local wholesalers. She retails to a mixed-gender clientele. She takes cash, and also often extends payment facilities.

She is forecasting an average monthly profit of 10,000 XOF, which will be used for expenses related to healthcare, food, clothing, and schooling. The remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy various products.

loans.name: Marjina

texts.en:
Marjina hails from Dhupguri. She is only 29 years old and married and has two children (one son and one daughter). They are in grade 9 and grade 3. She lives with her family at Baroghoria in the district if Jalpaiguri. She studied till 5th grade and now is a homemaker who looks after her husband and children and manages the household work.

Her husband, 43-year-old Alauddin, is hardworking, reliable, trustworthy and an experienced farmer. Being educated till fifth grade, he chose agriculture as his profession. He has been a farmer for several years. He grows only paddy rice which is an all-season crop, so the cultivation and selling of paddy is a very lucrative business. In order to get a  good plentiful harvest and to earn enough to feed his family and send his children to school, he needs to invest in his farmland, but he lacks the money. 

So Marjina has taken a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer. She hopes the loan will help them to get a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives. 

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase high yield paddy rice seeds and other farm supplies to enhance their paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en:
Noreen is a 36-year-old married woman. She has been in the beauty parlor business for the past two years.

She does her job passionately. She knows the techniques of makeup and hair design and serves her customers by providing bangles, jewelry, mehndi, etc. She is a well-known beautician in her town. Noreen is a responsible mother of three children. She has slowly but surely improved her business through the support of Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy more beauty products for her beauty parlor, including lotions, makeup kits and lightening creams to cater to a large number of customers efficiently.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products, including lotions, makeup kits and lightening creams.

loans.name: Manora

texts.en:
Manora is a 25-year-old lady who resides at Baroghoria village in Jalpaiguri district. She is married and a mother of three lovely daughters. Two of them are students of grade five and grade one and the other is too young for school. Manora and her husband are illiterate; they are able to sign their names only. So for lack of education, her husband had no other choice but to take agricultural activities as his profession. He cultivates different vegetables in different seasons on his farmland.

Manora is currently engaged in selling goats and goat milk. From this activity, she is able to earn substantial profit for her family. She rears goats and sells goat milk at the market.  Moreover she sells goats to the local butcher shop for meat after fattening them. Her husband helps in Marora's business activities. Manora and her husband both take on all the family responsibilities. As the family expenses are increasing, she had a thought to improve her existing business by purchasing one more goat. She has applied for a loan from BJS for the purpose.

Manora has a dream of building a house for her family and educating her children. She is really very thankful to Kiva for this opportunity.

loans.use: To purchase a goat to improve her livestock business.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar, age 46, is a married woman. She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to cover her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her 4th loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Desirie

texts.en:
Desirie is 37 years old and married with four children. With four children currently in school, Desirie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 3 years. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, cooking oil, candies, diapers, noodles, biscuits, beers, cereals, etc. 

In the future, Desirie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, cooking oil, candies, diapers, noodles, biscuits, beers, cereals, etc.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is 54 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them. She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines and has been for 3 years now. Linda has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other materials to use in her fruit farming business. In the future, Linda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other materials to use in her farming business.

loans.name: Mahrri

texts.en: Mahrri is 34 years old and a dedicated mother of seven children. The man shown in the photo is Mahrri's husband. Her husband runs a donkey cart as a transportation service. The donkeys help customers carry material from one place to another. He makes enough to meet the family's needs. In order to purchase a larger size wooden cart for the donkey to carry more things at once, Mahrri contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 55,000 PKR. This ultimately saves his time and hopefully will increase his net income. Mahrri plans to spend the additional revenue on bettering the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a larger size wooden cart for the donkey

loans.name: Afsana

texts.en:
Afsana is a 34-year-old married woman. She is a mother of 6 children. Her husband has been doing a business of cattle sale and purchase for the past 10 years. Afsana fully supports and assists her husband with his work.  Now, they have 4 cows and 3 goats. 

Afsana is in her 7th loan cycle. She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more cattle for the purpose of resale. She is expecting a boost in their earnings, and she dreams of providing a better standard of living for her kids thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for the purpose of resale.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 47-year-old married woman. She has 2 daughters. Rukhsana is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for the last 5 years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns with her hands. Her skill is known throughout the town. 

She is in her 4th loan cycle and has requested a loan amount of 40,000 PKR. This loan will enable her to purchase more beads, threads, frames, etc. to gain more customers for fulfilling her dream of providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, threads, frames, etc. to gain more customers for fulfilling her dream of providing quality education to her children.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en: 25-year-old Farzana is a married woman. The only source of income in her family is from the rickshaw that her husband (shown in the picture) drives. This rickshaw helps him to provide transportation services to passengers in his locality. Farzana has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR for her husband. He will use this loan to pay for maintenance costs and new tires for the rickshaw. She is positive about her husband’s future earnings.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance costs and new tires

loans.name: Zohera

texts.en:
Zohera is a 40-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of a beauty parlor for a period of about 6 years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Over that time she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. 

She needs to deal with more customers time after time. For this reason, she has applied for a loan of 45,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) through Kashf Foundation to buy hair treatment products, cleansers, and lotions, along with packs of makeup kits. She is very experienced in her business is and confident that her business will move toward a positive direction as a result of loan investment.

loans.use: to buy hair treatment products, cleansers, and lotions, along with packs of makeup kits

loans.name: Sitora

texts.ru: Ситоре 28 лет. Она проживает на районе под названием Шахритус. Ситора замужем, но ее муж находится за приделами страны. Ситора живет вместе с мамой. Также с ними живут жена брата сестры и ее дети. У них дружелюбная семья. Ситора занимается продажей одежды в одном из рынков района Шахритус. Она начала заниматься торговым бизнесом благодаря своим друзьям. Они помогли ей начать бизнес. Она влюбилась в свою работу и хочет продолжить расти в этом направлении. Ситора просит кредит, чтобы купит и привести новый товар зимней одежды. Из-за того у нее не хватает средств она обратилась за кредитом с надеждой на то что ей обязательно помогут.
texts.en: Sitora is 28 years old. She lives in the Shahrituz region. Sitora is married, her husband is now abroad. She lives with her mother and also her brother's wife as well as sister and her children. They have a very friendly family. Sitora sells clothing on one of the markets of Shahrituz. She started selling clothing thanks to her friends who helped her start her business. She fell in love with her work and wants to grow in that direction. Sitora is asking for a loan to buy and deliver new winter clothing. She does not have enough means and that is why she has come to ask for a loan with hopes that she will be get help.

loans.use: to buy and deliver winter clothing for sale.

loans.name: Nancy Alexandra

texts.es:
En la pila de Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido por su rica cultura tradicional, se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía elaboradas por sus habitantes.
En este lugar vive la señora Nancy, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 11 y 8 años de edad, ambos estudian en escuela, actualmente está en su octavo mes de embarazo de su tercer hijo. Su esposo es artesano.
Doña Nancy se dedica al comercio, compra y vende  de adornos y cerámicas,  tiene un  local en la vía principal lugar por donde pasan muchas personas y  por lo general pasan comprando algo todos los días, allí vende todo tipo de artesanía, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00. Lleva 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien. Sus productos los compran a artesanos de la zona pero semi terminados luego ellos le dan el acabado necesario para que estén listos para la venta.
Este crédito es para comprar más artesanías de todas las formas y modelos para surtir su negocio. Lleva más de 4 años en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta por los servicios de médico y medicinas gratis que ofrece la institución. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
The Grupo de Crédito para el Futuro de la Mujer meets in the La Pila area of Montecristi twice a month. This place is very well known for its rich traditional culture where one can find a great variety of handicrafts made by its inhabitants

Sra. Nancy lives here. She is 34 years old and married. From this union they have two children, who are 11 and 8 years old, and both of whom  attend school.  Currently Nancy is 8 months pregnant with her third child. Her husband is a craftsman.

Doña Nancy is in business. She buys and sells decorative items and ceramics. She has a shop on the principal thoroughfare of the city, a place where many passersby generally stop by to buy something every day. There she sells all kinds of handicrafts. She works every day from 8 in the morning until 5 in the evening.  She has had this business for 10 years and it has done well.

She buys her products from artisans in the area, however they are semi-finished. Then she and her husband give the items their finishing touches so they are ready to be sold. This loan is to purchase more handicrafts of all kinds in order to stock their business. 

Nancy has been a member of the Grupo de Crédito for over four years and she likes it because of the free medical services it provides. 

Her dreams are to give the best to her small ones.

loans.use: to purchase handicrafts..

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a hard-working lady from Biafra cell, Mbarara district. She is married and has two children. She also has three more children under her care who she provides an education for. Personally, she never studied and she has been struggling in small businesses to earn a living, given that she is almost the sole bread winner.

She is also a farmer who depends a lot on growing matooke (a type of banana) and rearing goats. She has a number of challenges that include poor climatic conditions, bad weather, and high competition in the market.

She came to Ugafode Mbarara branch for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX, which she intends to use to buy more goats for fattening and selling. She is really shrewd at the business, and she is optimistic that her business will improve with the financial boost.

loans.use: To buy goats

loans.name: Flor Beatriz

texts.es:
En la pila de Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido por su rica cultura tradicional,  se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía elaboradas por sus habitantes.
En este lugar vive la señora Flor, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 11 y 5 años  de edad, ambos estudian en escuela. Su esposo es taxista. 
Doña Flor trabaja de maestra en una  escuela particular en la zona, pero además también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, ella tiene un local en su casa y también vende puerta a puerta,  les vende a sus compañeras y madres de familia en su lugar de trabajo cuando está desocupada, deja a crédito sus productos  y cobra cada 8 días. Tiene más de 13 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana algo que les sirve para salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Grupo De Crédito  hace  10 años  y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten financiar su negocio. Sus sueños son salir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
In La Pila of the town of Montecristi, the communal bank "Para el Futuro de la Mujer" (For the Future of the Woman) gets together every fifteen days. This place is very well-known as a result of its rich cultural tradition. A great variety of crafts made by its residents can be found there. 

Flor lives in this town. She is 39 years old, married, and has two children from this relationship, who are 11 and 5 years old. Both children are in school. Her husband is a taxi driver. 

Flor works as a teacher at a private school in the area. In addition, she works selling clothing of all kinds. She has a store in her house and also sells door-to-door. She sells to her coworkers and mothers at the place where she works when she is free. She sells her products on credit and collects every 8 days. She has been making a living in this way for over 13 years. Her earnings help them to move forward. 

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing. She has been a member of the communal bank for 10 years, and she likes it because the loans allow her to finance her business. Her dream is to move forward with her business.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is a 48-year-old married woman. She has 4 children. She is a vigorous lady, and has a business selling cloth in her locality. 

She buys cloth in various fabrics and in different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. Tahira expects a boost in her earnings with the loan and she plans to spend the part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is 43 years old and married. She has been running a bangle sales business for many years. She buys bangles from the wholesale markets at lower rates and then sells them to the people of her community at a profit. 

Her husband’s income is not enough to fulfill the family needs. Therefore, she started her own business to contribute to the family income.  

Sajida has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy the latest variety of bangles in different colors and designs. This will help her to increase her sales. She is in her 8th loan cycle with a good repayment history. She wants to expand her business to provide a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy the latest variety of bangles in different colors and designs to increase her sales.

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en: Sobia is a 30-year-old married woman. A year ago she started a business selling cloth in her locality. She purchases cloth of different varieties at low prices from the city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base. Currently, Sobia has requested a Murabaha of 20,000 Pakistan rupees (PKR). She wants to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business.

loans.name: Ebtisam

texts.en: Ebtisam is a 44-year-old married woman who lives with her family that consists of six members in Jordan. Her husband works as a truck driver, and his income isn’t enough to cover his children's needs. Her 20-year-old son is a university student majoring in Accounting, and he is in his second year. He is seeking to obtain his Bachelor's so that he will experience work life. But because of the financial crisis her husband has been facing, he couldn’t pay for the upcoming semester fees. For that, Ebtisam wants to help him by applying for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her son's upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, 70, is a brilliant and resilient smallholder mixed-farmer from Soy, located in North Rift Kenya. Even in old age, he is still the caring family man who is committed to his 60-year-old wife Salina. For the past five years, the couple's primary income sources have been milk, eggs, crops and transportation services. 

Joseph is seeking a loan to purchase a high-yielding dairy cow. The cow he wants may be pricier than dominant breeds but he will get real value for his money when it comes to milk production. Joseph will also be able to get more cow dung for manure and fuel. With your loan, he will kill two birds with one stone: increased milk production and reduced costs. This will greatly boost his profit margin and thus his income. 

When asked, "How will this loan benefit your family?" Joseph replied, "My family will get food and more income and thus better living."

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Dina Marleni

texts.es:
Dina Marleni tie 47 años de edad, es soltera, sin hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia, en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Dina Marleni se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral(pollos, gallinas, entre otros), hace 3 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ella solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo, pues desea aumentar y diversificar su stock de animales comprando cuyes, patos, gallina, pavos el préstamo le ayudará para tener una mayor inversión, esto con la finalidad de incrementar su negocio de los mismos y satifacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Dina Marleni, age 47, is single and has no children to care for. She lives in her own home in a rural area of the Oyotún district in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region along the northern coast of Peru. Her community is primarily dedicated to agriculture, cattle ranching, and related goods sales.

Dina Marleni is in the business of raising and selling pen animals such as chickens, hens, and more. She's been in this business for three years, and her work is located in her home. She is requesting this loan for working capital as she wants to expand and diversify her stock of animals buy buying guinea pigs, ducks, hens, and turkeys.  The loan will used to increase her investment, expand her business, and meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: increase and diversify her stock of animals

loans.name: Muni

texts.en:
Muni is a 22-year-old resident of the remote region of Subhas Pally in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is a housewife and blessed with two children (one son and one daughter). She is married to Lutfor, who is 26 years old. Both Muni and her husband Lutfor have elementary education. Their children are too young for school. They live in a small kachha house (mud, bamboo and straw-made).

Muni's husband grows seasonal vegetables. His earnings are the main source of income for the family, but are hardly enough to cover the family's food and household costs. Muni has a strong will to surpass the financial hurdles of her family. So, she asked for a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to help her husband. 

She has decided to cultivate bananas on their small piece of land. She will purchase banana saplings and fertilizers to start cultivation of banana trees. As bananas are a very common fruit and are in great demand in their locality, she hopes to earn a profit from this new business.

Her goal is to increase and improve the production, which would help her dream of improving the living conditions of her children and providing them with education.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase banana saplings and fertilizers for banana cultivation.

loans.name: Ruqiya

texts.en:
Ruqiya is a 39-year-old married woman and has been running a business of selling milk for the past 2 years. 

She has one cow for milking. She looks after it and performs the task of collecting milk and arranging fodder on daily basis. Through her business she has enough to support her husband financially. She is the mother 6 children. 

In order to make huge profits, she requested for a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy one more cow to inflate her sales and generate more income.

loans.use: to buy one more cow to inflate her sales and generate more income.

loans.name: Nurnehar

texts.en:
Nurnehar is a young and enterprising woman. She is only 24 years old, married and a mother of two children (one son and one daughter). One is in school. Her husband is a mason by profession, and they both have an elementary education. Due to the poor economic resources of their families, they could not go for higher studies. They live in a small village, Baroghoria, in Jalpaiguri, West Bengal.

Nurnehar's husband Aaliul is a hardworking man. He is 25 years old. His greatest motivation in life is his children. For them, he wakes up early in order to go to work and tries earnestly to provide them with a better future with better education. But his income is inconsistent and seasonal. So, with his earnings he cannot cover all the expenses of his family, as the prices of essential commodities are increasing by leaps and bounds these days. So, Nurnehar has been practicing goat rearing to solve the financial problem of her family.
