She has been working in her goat meat business. She fattens goats and then resells them at a profit. 

She is requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner BJS to purchase goats, so that she can expand her customer base and earn more income, and meet all her needs and those of her entire family. She also aspires to purchase a plot of land with the profit from her business.

She expresses her gratitude to her generous lenders.

loans.use: to purchase another goat for her animal husbandry.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 20 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 2 años, tiene muchos clientes por la variedad de productos que comercializa, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante, vive en casa propia con su madre y su padrastro, la joven esta solicitando un credito para la compra de sopas, granos básicos, huevos, golosinas, refrescos, etc. todo por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi poder obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: This young woman, whose face has been blurred out because she is 20 years old and lives in a high-risk area, has run a small shop located in her home for two years now.  She has many customers thanks to the wide variety of goods she sells. With the money she makes, she is managing to get ahead. She lives in her own home with her mother and stepfather. She is requesting this loan to buy soap, staple grains, eggs, candies, soft drinks, and more, all at wholesale. This will enable her to continue her sales and earn greater income.

loans.use: buy groceries at wholesale to stock her store

loans.name: Arati

texts.en:
Arati is a housewife of 40 years, hailing from Maynaguri. She resides at a small village, Petkati, in Jalpaiguri district of West Bengal with her husband Chhentu. They have no children. Arati is illiterate, but she can sign her name. Her husband studied up to grade six. 

Arati's husband is a small trader associated with a small business. He is the only breadwinner for the family. Arati is a hardworking and optimistic woman. Poverty can't curb her indomitable will power to do something for the family's wellbeing. She wants to purchase a dairy cow for starting a milk supply business. She has decided to sell cow’s milk to her neighbors. 

With the goal of starting her business, she has turned to BJS (Kiva’s partner) for a loan to purchase a cow, which will allow her to produce milk she will sell and consequently, to improve her family's wellbeing. She plans to invest profits from the loan into further increasing her quantity of livestock, making a cattle herd for securing their future by earning more profit.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for starting a milk supply business.

loans.name: Salvador De Jesus

texts.es: Salvador de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, el posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 15 años, tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante, el esta solicitando un crédito para comprar mas sopas, detergentes, huevos, golosinas, granos básicos, jabón, refrescos, etc. y asi surtir mas la tienda y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Salvador, age 44, lives in his own home with his wife and their three children. He has a general store in his home that he's run for 15 years. He has many customers, particularly his neighbors. With his income, he is managing to get ahead. He is requesting this loan to buy more soups, detergents, eggs, sweets, staple grains, soap, soft drinks, and more. This will allow him to stock his store better and earn greater income.

loans.use: stock his general store

loans.name: Aytanit Group

texts.en:
Rima is the featured borrower of the Aytanit group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua.  The three ladies have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their family's living in a well managed way.

Rima is a 47-year-old married step-mother of one child. She has been working in providing cleaning services for ten years in order to support her beloved husband in covering their family's increasing living needs. Her loan portion will be used to pay for her necessary dental expenses, since she can't save from her income to cover unexpected medical needs. She is the lady on the far left side of the picture.

As for the other group members, Reema, single, is the lady at the center. She is going to use the loan to buy a small van for her brother so that he can have his own business and support their family with additional business income. 

Yousfiyeh, single, is the lady on the right and has worked as a chef for twenty two years.  Her acquired loan will be invested in paying for her brother's medication expenses.

loans.use: To pay for necessary dental needs

loans.name: Erick Irving

texts.es:
El Grupo de Crédito  Picoaza  se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la rica cultura histórica que encierran sus montañas.
En este lugar vive el señor Erick, tiene 24 años de edad y está soltero. El vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva dos años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos él puede sacar adelante su negocio y ganarse la vida honradamente.
Don Erick es un joven muy trabajador que le gusta salir adelante a base de esfuerzo, se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta él se desplaza a Manta, Jipijapa y Calceta lugares que recorre ofreciendo sus productos. Trabaja tres a cuatro días por semana casi todo el día, el  deja su mercadería a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Tiene seis años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual sale adelante.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Sus sueños son comprar un carro para salir a vender.
texts.en:
The Crédito Picoaza Group meets twice a month in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo. It is a place known for being a commercial zone, for its traditional festivals of St. Peter and St. Paul, and for its rich cultural history surrounded by mountains. 

Erick lives here. He is 24 years old and is single. He lives at home with his parents. He has been in the credit group for two years and he likes it because he is able to get ahead in business and make a decent living. Erick is a hard working young man who likes getting ahead through his effort. 

He works selling all types of clothing, selling door to door in Manta, Jipijapa and Calceta traveling through offering his products. He works three or four days a week, most of the day, leaving his merchandise on credit to his customers and collecting twice a month. He buys his merchandise in Guayaquil once or twice a month according to what he needs. He has six years experience in this business and is getting ahead.

He is going to use this loan to buy more merchandise such as: pants, blouses, shirts, and children’s clothing. His dream is to buy a car to use in his work.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing

loans.name: Haya

texts.en:
Haya is a 20-year-old single lady living with her family in Irbid-Jordan. She is a university student majoring in Finance, and she is in her second year. 

Haya is seeking to continue her studies until she gets her Masters. However, because of the financial crisis her family has been facing, she does not have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees. For that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es: Hilaria de 58 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, desde hace 20 años que ella se dedica al oficio de corte y confección, tiempo en el cual ha ido adquiriendo mucha experiencia como también clientes fijos. Ella es una persona muy responsable, quien trabaja con mucho esmero por dar lo mejor de sí, Hilaria solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda invertir en su negocio, comprando mayor cantidad de materia prima como: telas, botones, hilos y agujas, para poder atender un pedido grande con el que cuenta y no perder la oportunidad de obtener ganancias extras para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Hilaria is 58 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband. 

She has been working as a seamstress for 20 years and throughout this time she has obtained a lot of experience as well as regular customers. She is a very responsible person who works carefully in order to give her best. 

Hilaria is asking for a loan so she can invest in her business, buying more raw materials such as: fabric, buttons, thread and needles, in order to complete a large order so she does not lose the opportunity to earn greater profits for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, buttons, thread and needles

loans.name: Hayat

texts.en: Hayat, 43 years old, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a small general store. She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. In order to avoid shortages, Hayat needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. Hayat has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc to consistently meet increasing demand

loans.name: Al Mahaba Group

texts.en:
Nayfeh is the featured borrower of Al Mahaba group. She, along with the other group members, got together to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua. They have always been neighbors and friends, and they work hard to develop their family's living and businesses.

Nayfeh is a 40-year-old married lady with no children, she has been working in the agricultural business for two years. She is specializes in apples, olives and olive oil, in addition to figs. She is a hardworking woman, who supports her retired husband in increasing their family's income and developing their living.

Nayfeh is expecting her first child, and wants to get ready for this big day. Her loan will be invested in paying for the baby's delivery expenses which is very expensive in Lebanon. Nayfeh is the lady at the far left side of the picture. As for the other group members, 

Nabiha is at the center, while Dina is the first from the right.

loans.use: to pay for her expected baby's delivery expenses.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 23-year-old single man who started working in a liquor shop to satisfy his needs and expenses.

Mahmoud desires to study and requests  a loan to pay the tuition fees at the university. He is an ambitious hard worker  and this loan will help him make the first step towards a better future.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
El socio Santos continua dedicándose a la agricultura el socio  cultiva trigo,  papa, tubérculos, entre otros, él socio lleva años dedicándose  a esta actividad el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de abono y semillas.
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “Apu Asangani” 
El socio agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Santos continues in the business of agriculture, growing wheat, potatoes, other root vegetables and more. He has years of experience in this work and it's going well for him thanks to the drive that he brings to his work every day. He wants to keep working in this way to keep supporting his family. 

Santos intends to use the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds. He is a member of the community bank "Apu Asangani." He is grateful and appreciates the loan and is committed to making his monthly payments responsibly.

loans.use: buy seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Gaudence

texts.en:
Gaudence is 28 years old. She is married with 3 children aged between 1 and 8 years, one of them goes to school. She sells clothes and has been in this business for 9 years. 

With the loan requested, she would like to buy more trousers, shirts and t-shirts for sale. 

The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business and for her family's welfare.

loans.use: to buy more trousers, shirts and t-shirts for sale.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 44 years old, married, and has three children who are in school.

Marites is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Marites requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marites has been raising pigs for 15 years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Marites would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 22-year-old university student majoring in Civil Engineering, and he is in the middle of his program. He plans to work in his field of study  after graduating so that he can be independent.  

He is now applying for this education loan to pay the fees for  his upcoming semester. He needs the loan because of the financial problems his family has been facing.

loans.use: to pay for his fees for the upcoming semester.

loans.name: Samah

texts.en: Samah is a 20-year-old single young lady living with her family in Zarqa-Jordan. She is an ambitious lady who is planning to  work after getting her Bachelors’. She is currently a university student majoring in Special Teaching. Because Samah doesn’t currently have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay the fees for  her upcoming semester.

loans.name: Sumati

texts.en:
Sumati is a 40-year-old humble and hardworking woman from Maynaguri. Her family is comprised of her husband and one son. Her son is in grade 5. They live in their small kachha house (made of mud, straw and bamboo). Her husband Abiram, aged 45 years, is a day laborer by occupation. Both are uneducated and can only sign their names.  
 
Sumati’s husband's income is inconsistent. So to provide a better living, Sumati has been engaged in cattle breeding for the last four years. She started her business with the purchase of one cow. She supplies milk to her neighbors and earns income for her family. Now this business is a strong financial support to the family. As the prices of essential commodities are increasing by leaps and bounds, she has to work hard so that she can generate more income. She has decided to purchase one more cow and start a milk products (such as curd, butter, paneer etc.) business.

For this reason she is seeking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to be able to purchase a dairy cow that will be of great help to her in terms of getting more milk for her business. Through the loan she will be able to fulfill her dream of selling milk products to her neighbors and the village around where demand for these products are very high.

She wants to save money to provide better education for her son. She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for her existing dairy business.

loans.name: Kosar

texts.en:
Kosar is a 26-year-old married woman. She is a mother of 3 children. Her husband has been In the business of cattle sales and purchase for the past 10 years. Kosar fully supports and assists her husband with his work. They currently have 4 cows and 3 goats.  

Kosar is in her 6th loan cycle. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. 

She desires to improve her standard of living through all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Khurshida

texts.en:
Khurshida, who is 25 years old, is a very young woman entrepreneur who has a strong determination to contribute to her family and to educate her two children. That spirit gives Khurshida a new inspiration to exist in better manner in her daily life. Her family tries hard to survive in the best possible way and her husband works as a daily laborer. So there has been always a chance of uncertainty and they feel this every day.

Khurshida wants to expand her dairy business by purchasing another cow which will give her the opportunity to produce more milk and earn sufficient money which may secure not only her future but also her family’s future.

She is seeking loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS to expand her existing business. With the loan amount Khurshida will be able to increase the quantity of milk and produce different types of milk products which may enhance her earning capacity. 

Khurshida gives heartiest thanks to BJS and Kiva for considering her capability and courage.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her milk and milk products selling business.

loans.name: Hanifan

texts.en: Hanifan has successfully built her business of animal selling with the support of Kiva and Kashf Foundation. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family, she began the business of animal selling. Over the years, she has established a good list of customers and earns a good amount of income to meet her family expenditures. Previously with the help of her Kiva loan, she was able to expand her business. For the improvement of her business now, she has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more baby goats for resale purpose. She is positive about her future earnings with this loan investment.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats for resale purposes.

loans.name: Lidia Zoila

texts.es:
En la pila de Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido por su rica cultura tradicional, se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía elaboradas por sus habitantes.
En este lugar vive la señora Lidia, tiene 50 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció y no tuvo hijos, ella vive con su mamá la cual ya está muy anciana.
Doña Lidia es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta a base de esfuerzo salir adelante junto  a su madre, se dedica al comercio, compra y vende  adornos hechos en tagua y cerámicas en diversidad de formas y tamaños, ella viaja a varias ciudades como Guayaquil, Quito, Libertad entre otras ofreciendo sus productos, por lo general  viaja una vez por semana a estas ciudades, luego regresa a su ciudad lugar en el cual compra estas obras a artesanos de la localidad. Llevan más de  15 años con esta actividad con la cual sale adelante. 
Este crédito es para comprar más artesanía de todas las formas y modelos. Lleva más de 10 años en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y gozando de buena salud.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank for Future of the Woman meets every fifteen days in the town of La Pila in Montecristi. This place is well known in the province and in the country for its rich traditional culture, and you can find a wide variety of crafts there made by the inhabitants according to traditional customs. Here we met Lidia. She is 50 years old; her husband passed away some years ago, and they had no children. Now she lives with her mother, who is quite elderly.

Lidia is a hardworking woman who enjoys getting ahead along with her mother, based on her hard work. She is in the business of buying and selling ornaments made from tagua (vegetable ivory) and ceramics in a wide variety of shapes and sizes. She travels to various cities such as Guayaquil, Quito, and Libertad, among other artisan centers in her area. She has more than fifteen years of experience in this line of work and it's how she is making her living.

This loan will be used to buy handicrafts of all types and kinds. She's been in the credit group for more than ten years and she likes it because the loans help her a lot. She dreams of continuing forward and enjoying good health.

loans.use: buy handicrafts

loans.name: Manuel Agusto

texts.es:
El Grupo de Crédito  Picoaza  se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la rica cultura histórica que encierran sus montañas.
En este lugar vive don Manuel, tiene 37 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos, todos  estudian en colegio y escuela. Su mujer es ama de casa.
El señor Manuel es un hombre muy trabajador que le gusta a base de esfuerzo sacar adelante a su familia, el se dedica a la venta medias, interiores, camisetillas y ropa en general, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también se desplaza a Manta, trabaja todos los días y esto le permiten ganarse la vida y llevar el pan a su hogar. Tiene 17 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual saca adelante a su familia.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa como: medias, ropa interior y otras prendas. Lleva tres ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con la ayuda de los créditos sale adelante. Sus sueños son comprar un carro para salir a vender.
texts.en:
The Crédito Picoaza Group gets together twice a month in the parish of Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for being a commercial zone, for its traditional festivals of St. Peter and St. Paul, and for its rich historical culture surrounded by mountains.

Manuel lives here. He is 37 years old and lives with his life partner and from this relationship he has 5 children all in primary or secondary school. His partner is a housewife.

Manuel is a hardworking man who likes bringing up his family through his effort. He works selling socks, underwear, t-shirts and general clothing. He sells door to door and travels to Manta working every day and this permits hime to make a living and bring home the daily bread. He has been working in this business for 17 years supporting his family. 

He will use this loan to buy clothing such as: socks, underwear, and other garments. He has been with the credit group for 3 cycles and he likes it because he is able to get ahead with the help of the loans. His dream is to buy a car to use in his work.

loans.use: to buy socks, underwear, and other garments.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis Alberto tiene 47 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene un hijo a su cargo, vive en casa propia, en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Luis Alberto tiene su bodega la cual vende productos de primera necesidad, desde hace 14 años, negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio; solicita préstamo para invertir en capital de trabajo; compra de arroz, azúcar, fideo, aceite, etc., esto le servirá para tener mayor variedad en lo concerniente a productos de primera necesidad esto con la finalidad de poder satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes y así poder incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en: Luis Alberto is 47 years old. He lives with his wife and he has one son that he takes care of. He lives in his own home in a rural area of the Oyotún district in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Perú. His community is essentially dedicated to agriculture, livestock and trade. Luis Alberto has a grocery store where he has sold staple products for 14 years. The business is located in his home. He is seeking a loan to invest in working capital: to purchase rice, sugar, noodles, oil, etc. This will allow him to obtain a greater variety of staples with the goal of satisfying the preferences of his customers and increasing his sales.

loans.use: to be able to invest in working capital.

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en:
Jean Pierre is 33 years old. He is married with 5 children, aged between 1 and 9, 3 of whom go to school. 

He has been selling phones for 2 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more phones to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to improve his welfare.

loans.use: to buy more phones to sell.

loans.name: Mediatrice

texts.en: Mediatrice is 33 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of 1 and 8. One of her children goes to school. She has been selling fruit for three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more pineapples, sweet bananas, and cassava for resale. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare.

loans.use: To buy more pineapples, sweet bananas, and cassava

loans.name: Haya's Group

texts.en:
Haya is a 20-year-old single woman living in Ajloun-Jordan with her family. Haya studies Political Science at university and is in her second year. She is planning to start work and earn a good income after graduating. 

Huya and her sister are shown in the photo.  Her sister wants to help Huda to pay the upcoming semester fees, but they didn’t have enough money. They have applied for this loan to provide Haya with what she needs to continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay for Hayas' upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Sunita

texts.en:
Sunita is a 38-year-old lady from Maynaguri. She lives in Anandanagar, a small village in Jalpaiguri district with her husband and two daughters. They are continuing their studies.

Sunita is associated with the bori business. Bori is a conical ball made of different pulses. Bori is used in Indian vegetable dishes. She makes this bori at home by sun-drying them. Then, with the help of her husband, sells them in the market. She needs many necessary ingredients like Urad dal, red chilli powder, ginger powder, water, etc. for making good quality bori. For this reason, she has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy the various necessary ingredients to make a huge quantity of bori from different types of pulses. There is a great demand for her bori in the local area.

Sunita has insufficient capital to buy the raw materials for supplying a huge quantity of bori in her locality. She expects that, with this loan, she can fulfill the market demand for bori. In the future, she wants to increase her business and see it flourish.

She is highly obliged to BJS and Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for making "Bori".

loans.name: Lumnbani Group

texts.en:
Ireen and Patrick are husband and wife; together they have two children and an orphan who all go to school. Ireen supports her family by selling fish and she wants this loan to increase her capital by ordering more fish from the Lake to attract more customers in her neighborhood.

Since she started accessing loans she has seen herself making more profits and she plans to use any profits generated to satisfy her family's basic needs and to send her children to private schools. 

Before she started her business she was a housewife and now she has managed to build an Iron roofed house for her family and she is able to buy good clothes for herself and her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a new bed for the house.

loans.name: Shefali

texts.en:
Shefali, a 30-year-old lady, lives with her husband Dinanath and their two children (one son and one daughter). They are students of grade 2 and grade 6.  They live in a small village of Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri, West Bengal.  

Shefali runs a grocery shop which sells essential commodities of everyday needs like rice, oil, salt, sugar, flour, biscuits etc.  Her husband is a farmer by profession. 

Both husband and wife work very hard and save money from their earning for their children’s future.  By carefully managing their expenses, Shefali manages to set aside money every month towards providing for her children's future education costs.

To generate more income to cover all the costs of a 4-member family smoothly, Shefali wants to expand her business by adding more items to her inventory. To stock and store this inventory, she needs financial help.

She requests a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy more grocery items for her shop. With the expansion, her income has been projected to increase substantially. She wants to use the additional income to send their children to renowned schools. She will also have the option of reinvesting these savings in her business for further growth, and the improved income and savings can help them achieve their simple goals.

She thanks her lenders because their loan will take a hardworking young mother and her family a step closer to achieving their basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for their grocery store.

loans.name: Shyamali

texts.en:
Shyamali is a woman of 44 years, who lives with her husband and three children (two sons and one daughter). They live in the village of Debinagar which is located in a remote area of the district of Jalpaiguri. All their children are attending school.

Shyamali's husband has been running a business selling tea leaves. He buys varieties of tea leaves from the wholesale market and sells them in his locality. Shyamali and her husband want to expand her business by increasing the stock that they have in the business.  

Thus Shyamali took a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase a stock of tea leaves. Shyamali hopes this will help her to increase her income so she will be able to materialize her dreams of expanding her business and providing better education for her children.

She is grateful to both Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of tea leaves for her business.

loans.name: Maria Marcelina

texts.es: Maria de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 30 años, vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias, con las ventas que realiza logra salir adelante, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas frutas y verduras por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Maria is 52 years old. She lives in her own home. She has worked selling fruits and vegetables for 30 years. She sells them as a street vendor throughout the different towns. With the sales that she makes she is able to succeed. She is seeking a loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables via wholesale to be able to continue her sales, now that they are her only source of employment. This way she will obtain better earnings.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables via wholesale

loans.name: Al Domoh Group

texts.en:
Domoh is the featured borrower of Al Domoh group.  She joined the group  to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends. They  work hard to develop their  family's standard of living.  Domoh is the lady at the center of the picture with blue top and Amina is the first lady at the right.  Amina  will use her loan to  maintain her house. Elham is the first at the left.  She has eleven years of experience in making  souvenirs.  She will use her loan to purchase a refrigerator for her house.

Domoh is an 18-year-old single lady who has been working as a tutor for two years  to support her family's needs. She  completed the Intermediate level at school and works hard to develop her teaching skills by educating others. 

She began working in a hair dressing shop six months ago  to meet her family's increasing needs. The income she earned from tutoring wasn't enough to cover their increasing living needs.  She wants to provide her brother with the necessary education for a brighter future. 

Domoh will use the  loan to pay for her brother's school registration fees and school supplies to provide him with the best education, which she couldn't have herself.

loans.use: to pay for her brother's school registration fees and supplies to provide him with the best education.

loans.name: Rudi Alberto

texts.es: Rudi de 42 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida, el se dedica a la crianza de cerdos desde hace 5 años, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde ella reside, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los  gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Rudi está solicitando un crédito para la compra de cerdos para seguir con la crianza y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Rudi is 42 years old. He lives with his life companion.

He has been raising pigs for five years, selling his product around the area he lives. He pays the household expenses from what he obtains from his sales. 

Rudi is asking for a loan in order to buy pigs to breed so he can have better income.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Magali Asuncion

texts.es:
El Grupo de Crédito  Picoaza  se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la rica cultura histórica que encierran sus montañas.
En este lugar vive la señora Magali, tiene 57 años de edad, hace varios años falleció su esposo y de esta relación tienen 5 hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa. 
Doña Magali es una mujer que le ha tocado trabajar duro para salir adelante, ella en sociedad con uno de sus hijos se dedican al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, mientras el hijo se desplaza a la ciudad de Loja lugar en el cual se dedica a la venta de ropa en su mayoría camisetas de equipos de futbol los mismos que tienen mucha salida,  ella por su parte sale a recorrer por la localidad vendiendo su mercadería, ella deja sus productos a créditos y cobra cada ocho días, lleva más de 10 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual ha podido salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 10 años y le agrada porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The Crédito Picoaza Group meets twice a month in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo. It is a place known for being a commercial zone, for its traditional festivals of St. Peter and St. Paul, and for the rich, historical culture that its mountains hold. 

This is where Magali lives. She is 57 years old. Her husband passed away many years ago, and from this relationship they have 5 adult children, two of whom still live in her house. Magali is a woman that has had to work hard to move forward. She, in partnership with one of her children, makes a living in commerce. She sells all kinds of clothing, while her son travels to the city of Loja, where he makes a living selling clothing. He mostly sells t-shirts of soccer teams – the ones that have good sales. She, for her part, goes all over the town selling her merchandise. She leaves her products on credit and charges every eight days. She has spent more than 10 years making a living in this occupation, which has allowed her to move forward.

She will use this loan to buy clothes such as pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children’s clothes. She has been part of the credit group for 10 years, and she likes it because she started her business with the first loan. His dream is to keep moving forward.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children’s clothes.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 29 years old and married with three children who attend school.

Marcelina has grown rice for 2 years and requests 7,500 PHP  through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

She has previously borrowed 3 times rom NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Marcelina would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a 59-year-old married woman with ten children, four children attend school.

Virginia has grown  rice for 2 years and requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her farming business.

She has previously borrowed 3 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her farming business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married mother with three children, all attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and transportation.

She has operated a business to make clothes for 3 years.  She sells them from door to door to her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of high  transportation costs. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

She will use 50,000 KES to purchase material, needles, and thread.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to epand her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing material, needles, and thread to  make clothing.

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
Jona is 48 years old and has three children. She is married and one of her children is in school.

Jona is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jona has been raising pigs for 28 years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Jona would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Annabella

texts.en:
Annabella is a 52-year-old  hard working entrepreneur.

Annabella has raised pigs for 1 year and requests 10,000 PHP  through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has previously borrowed 3 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Annabella would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.
